loans.name: Rorelyn

texts.en:
Rorelyn owns and operates an agriculture business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rorelyn has been engaged in farming for many years and earns well from these activities.  

Her farm is still doing well, and yet she needs financial assistance to improve it. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Iuni

texts.en: Iuni is a 52-year-old married woman with 11 children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 4 years of experience with this business. Iuni needs a loan to buy sacks of flour, yeast, sugar, shopping bags, etc. She plans to use her profits to save for her children's education and to support her family as well. Iuni has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, yeast, sugar, shopping bags, etc.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace owns and operates a plot of farmland, cultivating fruit trees and harvesting their fruit for sale to earn a living. With her good income from farming, she was able to start up a new business raising pigs for sale. To boost her pigs, she took out a new loan to purchase feeding supplies. In the future, Mary Grace hopes to build a pigpen for her business.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Iuni

texts.en: Iuni is a 58-year-old married woman with seven children. She makes and sells barbecued food in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Iuni needs a loan to buy chicken, sausage, tomato sauce, soy sauce, and a new barbecue set. She plans to use her profits to support her family and her kids' education. Iuni has been a member of SPBD for three years.

loans.use: to buy goods and equipment for her barbecue business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is from Aloran. She is 44 years old and earns a living through farming. Gina and her husband are hands-on farmers who plant corn. For this cropping season, they seek a loan to purchase seedlings and compost. 

Gina hopes that the family will have good produce and will be able to finance the construction of their display outlet.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Jerom

texts.en:
Jerom is a hardworking 20-year-old man. He was working his part time job as a butcher attendant to help him in his studies. He studied BS - Criminology at the university. Being part of a big family means that he needs to make more effort in order to succeed in his goals. Jerom is someone who is very dedicated to his family. He wants his parents to be proud of him. 

He used his previous loan for his tuition fees and now he is requesting another loan to pay his first semester school tuition fees. His goal is to continue his studies and work for the success of his future.

loans.use: to pay his first semester school tuition fees

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Hotel and Restaurant Management. She lives in Oroquieta City with her family. She is determined to  finish her studies because she wants to become successful. She joined GDMPC and she gained access to micro finance services. Her father is earning from his salary as a security officer and her mother in a public utility. She borrowed a new loan to pay her school tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee.

loans.name: Florife

texts.en:
Florife is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her direct selling business and she increased her income because of that. Her income was used in their everyday household expenditures at home. Her husband and children are helping her generate income for their family.

She would like to apply for another loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Florife dreams that her business will last longer and hopes to be successful in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
José, se decidió por un  nuevo préstamo para comprar insecticida, herbicidas, plaguicidas y abono, se limitara a comprar únicamente los materiales necesarios para realizar sus cultivos de maíz y frijol, así tener los buenos resultados del crédito anterior.
Con la ayuda del financiamiento anterior logro aumentar su producción y sus ganancias, ha mejorado el estilo de vida familiar y su situación económica.
texts.en:
José decided to apply for a new loan to buy insecticides, weed killer, pest-control substances and fertilizers. He will limit himself to only buying the materials he needs for his corn and bean crops, to have the excellent results of the previous loan. 

Thanks to the previous financing, José was able to increase his production and his sales, he has improved his family lifestyle and his financial situation.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, weed killer, pest-control substances and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jal Chris

texts.en:
Jal Chris is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Accounting. He lives in Oroquieta City with his family. He is determined to finish his studies, for he wants to become an accountant in the future. 

He joined GDMPC and he gained access to microfinance services. He needs another source of financial support, for his parents earn an income from their cafeteria that is not good enough for his studies. He borrowed a new loan to pay his school tuition fee. 

He wants to become successful in the future.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fee.

loans.name: Ines Cordero

texts.es:
Inés, ha tenido un mejor inventario en su tienda con la inversión del crédito anterior, permitiéndole  ofertar  nuevos productos a sus clientes a mejor precio, la situación económica es más favorable, su familia le brinda su apoyo para continuar trabajando y subsistiendo.
Se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito para comprar aceite, arroz, frijoles, dulces, pan, jabón, jugos, gaseosas, boquitas, huevos, azúcar y papel higiénico, de esa forma seguirá cubriendo las demandas de sus clientes y teniendo ingresos, con los que responderá positivamente a los pagos de la nueva deuda.
texts.en:
Ines's last loan has allowed him to expand the inventory in his store and to offer new products to his customers at better prices. His financial situation has improved, and his family is supporting his efforts to sustain the business.  

Inés has decided to apply for a new loan for the purchase of cooking oil, rice, beans, candy, bread, soap, juice, soda, snacks, eggs, sugar, and toilet paper. Purchasing these items will allow Inés to keep meeting the demands of his customers, sustain the income from his store, and repay this new loan.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, rice, beans, candy, bread, soap, juice, soda, snacks, eggs, sugar, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Easter

texts.en:
Easter is a 23-year-old single woman with one child. She bakes and sells cookies, biscuits and pies in her community to earn a living. She has four years of experience with this business.

Easter needs a loan to buy sacks of flour, yeast, sugar, shopping bags, a gas oven, cooking pans, etc. She plans to use her profits to extend her business and to support her family financially. 

Easter has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, yeast, sugar, shopping bags, a gas oven, cooking pans, etc.

loans.name: Milda Lizeth

texts.es: Milda, tiene 36 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su conyugue con quien tiene 4 hijos, y reside en una aldea de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, cerca a Peña Blanca, Cortes. Anteriormente se dedicaba al comercio, hace dos años decidió cultivar maíz para vender. El cultivo lo hace en un terreno alquilado y recibe apoyo de su esposo y  dos hijos y la producción la vende en la zona o mercado local. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 3,000 lempiras para comprar abono y fertilizar su parcela de cultivo de maíz, para poder sacar mejor producción. Su objetivo es lograr la compra de un terreno para realizar su propio cultivo.
texts.en:
Milda is 36 years old and married to the father of her four children. The family lives in the town of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, near Peña Blanca in Cortes Department. 

Milda used to run a shop, but decided two years ago to raise and sell corn. She grows the corn crop on a rented plot with the help of her husband and two of her children. After the harvest, she sells the crop around the region or at a local market. 

Milda has applied for a loan of 3,000 lempiras for the purchase of manure to fertilize the the soil for her corn crop. The manure fertilizer will help Milda achieve a better harvest. Her goal is to purchase a plot of land for growing her crops.

loans.use: to purchase manure for her corn crop.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is married with two children. She operates a transportation business for a living. With two years in running a transportation business, Janet was happy to say that this helps a lot for her family. She also sells cosmetics in their village. 

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to pay the school fees of her children. 

In the future, she wants to have a better living with her family and plans to buy another unit of motorcycle for business expansion.

loans.use: to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.name: José Enoc

texts.es:
José de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta 8° grado tubo que abandonar los estudios ya que sus padres no podían sostenérselos, y se dedicó a trabajar junto a su padre al cultivo de maíz, frijol y hortalizas.

 Esta acompañado su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar y a cuidar su hija quien tiene 5 años y está iniciando sus estudios de kínder.

José se dedica a la agricultura desde que era un niño,  ya que su padre le enseño a desempeñar este rubro, cuando es la temporada que no puede cultivar por la falta de lluvias, siembra hortalizas con regadillo de los cuales obtiene buenos ingresos con la venta y por temporadas también trabaja como jornalero por la mañana y se dedica a cuidar de sus cultivos en las tardes por ello su horario de trabajo es variado, ya que mientras obtiene producto para vender tiene que buscar dinero para llevar el alimento a su familia.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas y plaguicidas para todos sus cultivos, también pagara el arrendamiento de la tierra donde ha cultivado y donde cultivara, ya que él no posee terreno propio donde poder cultivar, teniendo el dinero en la mano asegurara el terreno para la siembra y los productos que le aplicara ya que él no tiene mucho tiempo para ir a comprar a cada momento,  tiene que tenerlo en la casa listo para realizar la aplicación en el tiempo requerido y así asegurar una buena producción.

Él desea ver su casa construida de un material más resistente, ya que la actual es de bahareque y desea darle a su hija y esposa una mejor calidad de vida, comparada con la que el tubo en su niñez, el en su futuro ve a su hija graduándose en una carrera universitaria y teniendo mejores condiciones que  las actuales.
texts.en:
José, 28, studied to the 8th grade when he had to abandon his studies as his parents couldn't afford to pay for them, and he started to work together with his father to grow corn, beans and vegetables.

He is married and his wife takes care of the household chores and looks after their daughter who is five years old and is starting kindergarten.

José has been making his living in farming since he was a boy, as his father taught him the ropes of this trade. During the season in which he cannot work due to a lack of rain, he sows vegetables on irrigated land from which he obtains a good income through sales and he sometimes works as a laborer in the morning and tends to his crops in the afternoon. As such, his working day is varied, given that while getting products to sell, he has to find money to support his family.

The loan that José is seeking from CREDICAMPO, is to buy fertilizers, weed killer and insecticides for all of his crops, as well as to pay for the lease of the land he has toiled, as he doesn't have his own land on which to farm. By having the money, he will be able to secure the land for sowing and so that he will have the products he needs to apply as he doesn't have a lot of time to go and buy them at each and every moment. He needs to have these items ready at home to apply when needed and therein ensure a good production.

José wants his home to be built of a more solid material, as it is currently made of adobe and he wants to give his wife and daughter a better quality of life compared to what he had when he was a child. In the future, José sees his daughter completing a university degree and having better living conditions than what they have at the moment.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, weed killer and insecticides for all of his crops. He will also pay the lease for the land where he will grow the crops as he doesn't have his own land where he can work the land.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 23 years old and single with two children. She would like to start a small business, sewing clothes and selling elei (printed fabric) in her community. In order to do this, Marie needs a loan to buy thread, needles, scissors, a sewing machine, elei board, paint, etc. 

She hopes to use her profits to extend her business and to support her family financially. She has been a member of SPBD since this year.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, thread, scissors, needles, elei board, paint, etc.

loans.name: Palepa

texts.en:
Palepa is 32 years old and single with one child. She wants to start a small business, making and selling chips in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a frying pan, oil, salt, bananas and taro. 

In the future, Palepa hopes to save her profits to extend her business and support her family. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a frying pan, oil, bananas, taro, salt, etc.

loans.name: Fetui

texts.en: Fetui is 62 years old and married with 7 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling iced cakes and chips in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy plastic cups, oil, salt, taro, cordial, bags of sugar, and other items. In the future, Fetui hopes to save her profits for her children's education as well. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oil, a frying pan, plastic cups, cordial, bags of sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Jenith

texts.en: Jenith is a woman who stands out for searching for any possible way to obtain resources that will allow her to feed her family. Two years ago she began making a living selling grocery goods in her village while her husband is earning as a carpenter and as a driver. Her business is doing well. Based on this success, Jenith is asking for a loan to buy additional items and goods to sell, which will allow her to continue to forge her dream of growing as an entrepreneur. In the future, she wants to improve the quality of her family's life.

loans.use: to buy additional items and goods to sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina works in the fish industry and sells fish while her husband does fishing for a living. She has been doing this for many years. She earns better income from this and has successfully repaid her previous loan used used to repair her fishing boat.

Recently, she took a new loan to buy a new fishing net to obtain better production from her fishing business.

Angelina has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, she hopes to gain more profits from fishing and wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net.

loans.name: Jena Ruth

texts.en:
Jena Ruth previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in her family's personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jena Ruth hopes to have a bigger connection and have more customers. She dreams of giving her family a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Эту обходительную и жизнерадостную женщину зовут Гулчехра. В возрасте 53 лет она решила начать собственный прибыльный бизнес. Гулчехра у своей соседки научилась профессии швеи и теперь хочет открыть собственное швейное дело. Ей будет помогать ее невестка. Гулчехра живет в городе Куляб вместе с сыном, невесткой и тремя внуками. Ее сын находится сейчас на заработках за пределами страны, а невестка занимается выпечкой и продажей и пряников. Семья для Гулчехры самое дорогое. Вот и сейчас она хочет начать новый бизнес, чтобы улучшить условия жизни семьи. Для этой цели Гулчехра обратилась за кредитом, так как собственного начального капитала не хватает. Она верит в Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
This courteous and cheerful woman's name Gulchehra. At the age of 53, she decided to start her own profitable business. At her neighbor's house, Gulchehra learned the sewing profession and now wants to start her own sewing business. Her sister-in-law will help her with the business. 

Gulchehra lives in Kulob with her son, daughter-in-law and three grandchildren. Her son is now working abroad, and her daughter-in-law bakes and sells cakes. For Gulchehra, her family is most valuable. 

Now she wants to start a new business to improve living conditions for her family. For this purpose, Gulchehra applied for a loan, as her own startup capital is not enough. She believes in your support.

loans.use: to obtain an automatic sewing machine to start a sewing business

loans.name: Faaiuga

texts.en: Faaiuga is 43 years old and married with 5 children. She plans to start a business selling cucumbers, pumpkins, tomatoes, cabbages and other produce. She has requested a loan to buy bush knives, a weed sprayer, rakes, chemicals, a shovel, and other items. Faaiuga will use her profits to support her family and to pay for her children's education. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, bush knives, a rake, chemicals, shovels and other items.

loans.name: David Serapio

texts.es:
David es un hombre de 45 años de edad soltero sin hijos y su negocio es la reparación de teléfonos celulares,
Él es una persona sencilla de carácter amable y buen trato al cliente, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la zona ‘Gran Poder’ de la ciudad de La Paz un lugar muy comercial, donde existen muchas tiendas de venta de equipos electrónicos y línea blanca.
David es de estatura mediana tez morena, cabello negro y usa lentes de aumento, su negocio tiene necesidades de herramientas de trabajo para la reparación de teléfonos celulares, también tiene el deseo de ampliar su lugar de trabajo para generar mejores ingresos.
Su tienda es bastante pequeña, la utiliza como taller y también expone productos relacionados a su negocio, como; tarjetas prepago, audífonos y otros accesorios.
Es por esos motivos que David solicita un préstamo para la compra de herramientas de trabajo y la ampliación de su negocio.
texts.en:
David is a single 45-year-old who doesn't have any children and his business is in the repair of mobile phones.

David is a kind person with a friendly character and an excellent sense of customer care. His business is located in the ‘Gran Poder’ area of the city of La Paz, a very commercial place where there are many electronic and domestic goods stores.

David is of an average height, he is tanned, has black hair and wears glasses. His business is in need of work tools to repair mobile phones, and David is also keen to expand his workplace to generate more sales. His store is relatively small, he uses it as a workshop and he also displays other similar products such as prepay cards, head phones and other accessories.

It is for this reason that David is seeking a loan to buy work tools and to extend his business.

loans.use: to buy tools for work and to extend the business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Because she lacks capital, Arlene wants to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders through ASKI in the amount of PHP 15,000.

She wants to buy more stocks of canned goods, snack foods, noodles, assorted biscuits, candies, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to resell within her community. 

She is 49 years old and blessed with three children. 

She believes that this financial assistance will be a great help for her to improve the business. She is hoping that someday she will make her business more profitable to continuously support the necessities of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of canned goods, snack foods, noodles, assorted biscuits, candies, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to resell.

location.town: Brgy. Domang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jhondy

texts.en:
Jhondy, a Business Administration student at Stella Maris College, is on his way to finish his goal. He had used his previous loans from GDMPC for his school expenses. 

Currently, he took another loan to buy school materials and uniforms. He put his study as his first priority this time in order to gain success and be able to help his parents in the future.

loans.use: to buy school materials and uniforms.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is a hardworking man, 57 years old. He is married and lives in Carmencita with his family. He has a great desire to get ahead in life, and because of this, he always strives for success in everything he does. 

Gilbert has been working at farming for more than eight years, with rice the main crop he raises because of the favorable environmental conditions. This work is going well for Gilbert because he is very responsible and enterprising, and of course because he offers products of excellent quality.

Gilbert is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the help they provide he can buy fertilizers for his crops and thus have higher quality products and greater productivity. He will continue fighting to improve his family's quality of life and become the best rice producer in his area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to buy the products needed in her manicure and pedicure business. Her loan also helped in her variety store and in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are helping each other to generate more income for their family.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to meet her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Susan dreams that all her business will be more successful and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Job Din

texts.en:
Job Din wants to improve his living. With his determination in starting a business, he borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to cover the down payment for his new motorcycle. He uses this vehicle, which he had tried before he planned to own, in transportation services.  

He is going to amortize the remaining payments of the vehicle and is hoping to find success from his business.

loans.use: to cover the down payment for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
Blanca, sigue progresando con la facilidad que tiene al hacer uso de los préstamos, por tal razón nuevamente requiere de capital para comprar herbicidas, semilla, fertilizantes, plaguicidas y abono, con los que prepara la tierra y evitara posibles plagas a sus cultivos de maíz.
El crédito anterior fue de mucha utilidad para comprar materiales de construcción con los que mejoró la infraestructura de su vivienda y brinda a su familia un estilo de vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Blanca is progressing in life thanks to the ease that she has in using the loans, and it is for this reason that she once again needs capital to buy weed killer, seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and fertilizers with which to prepare the loan and avoid any diseases to her corn crops.

The previous loan was of great use to buy construction materials with which she improved the infrastructure of her home and gave her family a more comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy weed killer, seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis es un habilidoso y experimentado oficial de construcción residente del municipio de Santa Fe De Antioquia, presta servicios de fontanería, arreglos generales, pintura, entre otros.
Es un hombre muy conocido en el sector gracias a su buen servicio y excelente calidad de trabajo. Según la obra que deba realizar, contrata a los colaboradores que necesita y también pone la herramienta que se va a utilizar.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de nueva herramienta para hacer más productivo su trabajo.
Básicamente es herramienta manual y alguna maquinaria mas pesada. Este préstamo le ayudara a desempeñar su labor de una manera más eficiente y rápida, generando unos mejores ingresos para su actividad.
texts.en:
Luis is a person who is good with his hands and a skilled construction worker who lives in the municipality of Santa Fe De Antioquia, he provides services in plumbing, general repairs, painting and so on. 

He is man who is well-known in the sector thanks to his good service and the excellent quality of his work. Depending on the work that he needs to carry out, he hires the workers he needs and places the tools that he will need.

Luis is seeking a loan to buy new tools to make his work more productive, in essence this consists in manual tools and a bit heavier machinery. This loan will help him to carry out his work in a more efficient and quicker manner, generating a larger income for his activity.

loans.use: to buy tools for his job.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 24 years old and single. She has two children. 

She sews and sell clothes. In order to do this, Victoria  needs a loan to buy a sewing machine, scissors, thread, needles, etc. She hopes to save her profits for unexpected needs and for her children's education. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: To buy threads, scissors, needles, sewing machine, etc

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 38 years old, married and has two children. He and his wife manage a store selling grocery items. Aside from that, the couple also sells chicken. They have been in the business for over two years now. 

Joel would like to keep improving their sales and needs additional capital of PHP 50,000 to buy more merchandise to sell. It will help increase sales capacity and meet all their customers' demands for good and affordable grocery items. He will buy canned goods, noodles, biscuits and chicken to sell. 

Someday, he hopes to strengthen his chicken wholesaling business so they will earn more income for the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, biscuits and chicken to sell.

loans.name: Dúo El Rosario De Buena Vista Group

texts.es: Dúo El Rosario de Buena Vista La encargada de este grupo es la señora Rosario, quien desde hace 5 años se dedica a la elaboración venta de zapatos para damas y niños, y a la venta de tamales los fines de semana. Al contar con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo y al lado de sus dos hijos le agradece al creador por las oportunidades que recibe a cada momento de su vida.  La venta de zapato va muy bien pero últimamente le han hecho varios pedidos de zapatos para dama y caballero pero necesita comprar cuero y cuerina para la elaboracion de calzado.  Su sueño es llegar a tener una zapatería grande ofreciendo a los clientes estilos, numeraciones, tallas, colores de zapato para dama, caballeros y niños, actualmente es vendedora ambulante y sueña con su propia venta en su casa.
texts.en:
Rosario is in charge of the group Dúo El Rosario de Buena Vista. For the last 5 years she has worked making and selling shoes for women and children, and also selling tamales on the weekends. 

She thanks God for the opportunities she receives at every moment of her life, including the unconditional support of her husband and her children. The sale of shoes has been going well, but lately she has had a lot of requests of women and men shoes, and needs to buy leather and imitation leather to make them. 

Her dream is to have her own big shoe store and offer to the clients different styles, sizes and colors of women, children and men shoes. She currently sells on the streets and dreams about being able to sell her products at her own house.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make shoes.

loans.name: Fenumiai

texts.en:
Fenumiai is 35 years old and married. She has four children. 

She runs a small business selling sandwiches, noodles, etc. in her community and has been doing this for three years.

Fenumiai has requested a loan to buy boxes of noddles, breads, cucumber, mayonnaise etc. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Fenumiai would love to continue doing her business to improve her family's development.

loans.use: to buy boxes of noddles, breads, cucumber, mayonnaise, etc.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to buy more products for her direct selling business. Her loan helped not just in her business, but also in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting with their everyday household expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 10,000 PHP, to buy additional supplies and merchandise products, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics, needed in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her children’s education and their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gilda hopes to have other sources of income and dreams to have an outlet outside her house. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics, needed in her business.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly earns a living through snack vending. She is married and positions her business in Aloran. This brings her a promising income of PHP 4,000 per month. 

As a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC, Sherly is seeking a loan to purchase kilos of flour and sugar and other ingredients. Sherly doubles her effort to save enough so that she can redeem their cocoland and start cultivating for additional income.

loans.use: To purchase kilos of flour and sugar and other ingredients.

loans.name: Leah May

texts.en:
Leah May is studying for a BS in Criminology, for she wants to serve the country in the future. 

Her parents were farmers determined to push her to continue studying. 

She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to pay her school tuition fees for the first semester. 

She is hoping to become successful someday to be able to help her family in the future.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma has been helping her husband to make a living in their fishing business. For many years, the couple was able to sustained their living as well as their business. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, used for buying fish net. 

To improve fishing, she took  a new loan to buy more fishing nets.
 
In the future, Vilma hopes to purchase additional fishing boats and gain more profit.

loans.use: to buy more fishing nets.

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en:
Norberta has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than ten years, and she earns well from this. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.  

To improve sales, Norberta would like to apply for a PHP 25,000 loan to purchase grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Norberta dreams that her business will grow bigger and become successful. Weekly, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ana Mrisol

texts.es:
Ana estudio hasta primer año de bachillerato dejo de estudiar cuando salió embarazada, actualmente está acompañada, su compañero de vida se dedica a trabajar la agricultura,  él aprendió esto de su abuelo ya que su padre lo abandono a él y su mamá cuando aún era un niño. Ambos son padres de una hija y es una niña muy sana, viven en la casa de la madre de su compañero de vida y los gastos del hogar son repartidos entre todos ellos así se ayudan a salir adelante entre todos.

Ana por su parte se dedica a los oficios del hogar,  a esto se ha dedicado toda su vida ya que ha tenido que trabajar desde pequeña para ayudarle a su familia con todos los gastos de su hogar de esta forma pudo adquirir un trabajo como mesera en un restaurante y esto le implica tener que trasladarse unos 45 minutos para llegar a su lugar de trabajo y 45 minutos para retornar a su casa todos los días,  ya que el transporte es escaso tiene que esperar mucho tiempo en autobús.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar fertilizantes y semillas para una hortaliza, ya que el esposo se dedica a este rubro y quieren aprovechar que tiene un predio donde cultivar, que tiene acceso a agua natural con la cual ellos regaran sus cultivos, de esta manera tendrán un ingreso extra, cuando vendan la producción que saquen.  Con el crédito podrán realizar este proyecto en un corto tiempo, ya que con el dinero, compraran todo de una sola vez y así no andarán haciendo tantos viajes en comprar lo que necesitan sino que ya lo tendrán en su casa.

Sus sueños  a futuro son poder terminar sus estudios como bachiller,  ya que siente que así podrá tener una mejor oportunidad de trabajo con un mejor ingreso mensual.
texts.en:
Ana studied up to the first year of high school, but stopped when she became pregnant.  She lives with her life companion, who works in agriculture. He learned this from his grandfather, as he and his mother had been abandoned by his father when he was still a baby. They are the parents of a very healthy little girl. They live in her life companion’s mother’s house, and the household expenses are shared by all. In this way, they all help each other to get by.

For her part, Ana works as a housekeeper. She has been doing this all of her life, as she has had to work in this way since she was very young in order to help her family with all of the household expenses. She was able to get a job as a waitress in a restaurant, which means that every day she must travel about 45 minutes to get to work and 45 minutes to return home, as transportation is scarce, and she has to wait a long time for the bus. 

She is requesting a loan from CrediCampo to purchase fertilizer and vegetable seeds, as her husband does this kind of work, and they want to take advantage of having a plot of land that they can cultivate. It has access to natural water with which they can irrigate their crops.  In this way, they will have an extra income when they sell their harvest. With the loan, they will be able to carry out this plan in a short time because they will use the money to buy everything at once. Thus, they will not have to make numerous trips to purchase what they need because they will already have it in their house.

Her dream for the future is to be able to complete high school, as she feels that in this way she will have better opportunities for work with a better monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and vegetable seeds in order to cultivate a plot of land that she and her husband have.

loans.name: Nive

texts.en:
Nive is 44 years old and divorce woman with two children. She sells ice cakes and cocoa Samoa in her community and has been doing so for three years.

Nive has requested a loan to buy plastic cups, Chinese candy, cordial, sugar, etc. 

She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital.  With her earnings, Nive hopes to improve opportunities for her family.

loans.use: to buy plastic cups, Chinese candy, cordial, etc.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en: Adelina has run her general store for six years. She is now 61 years old, married, and blessed with three children. Adelina wishes to have a stable source of income, so she is asking for additional capital of PHP 40,000. She will be using this loan amount to buy a variety of merchandise such as assorted biscuits, soap, sugar, noodles, canned goods, and milk. She is hoping that through this loan she can improve her sales and offer a quality service to all her customers.

loans.use: to be used in buying a variety of merchandise such as assorted biscuits, soap, sugar, noodles, canned goods, and milk to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 55-year-old mother who has two adult aged children. She engages herself in buying and selling assorted products within the public market to help her husband in generating income. 

She has been in the business for almost 13 years. She aims to continue and further improve the business in order to generate a higher income. She wants to acquire more stocks of the said products to sell, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more stocks of school supplies, accessories, and bags to resell in the public market. 

Through hard work and strong determination, Veronica believes that she will make more improvements in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of school supplies, accessories, and bags to resell

location.town: Brgy. Almaguer North, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is 68 years old, married and he is a resident of Laurel St. Aguada,Ozamiz City, Philippines. They have five children.  

Starting with capitalization of 3,000PHP,  Virgilio opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative.  Aside from financial assistance, he was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit offered by the co-op.  He became a member on July 6, 2010 and has taken out several loans. 

Now he is applying for 40,000PHP loan to construct a kitchen.  In the future, Virgilio wants to own a mini-mart.

loans.use: construct a kitchen.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en: Jeffrey is studying at a university, taking a Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education. With his dedication to his studies, he continues despite some difficulties. He had a previous loan from GDMPC that he used for tuition fees, and he recently borrowed a new loan to pay his tuition fees for the first semester this current year. He wants to become successful in the future.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees for the first semester this current year

loans.name: Ken Lliemark

texts.en: Ken Lliemark studies Bachelor of Science in Criminology for he has a passion to serve. He used his previous loan from GDMPC for his tuition fees last school year. He took a new loan recently to pay the school tuition fees for the first semester. With his GDMPC education loan, Ken Lliemark will be able to continue his studies and hopefully in the future, will find a better job and be able to help his family and his community as well.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for the first semester

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and other materials needed in repairing cell phones and computers. His earnings were a big help for the education of his child and in his personal, household, and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for him to buy spare parts and other materials needed in repairing cell phones and computers. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of his child. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Jonathan hopes to have more customers and dreams that her family is always in good health. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and other materials needed in repairing cell phones and computers.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Twenty-seven-year-old Nadia who used the previous loan to buy a popcorn machine, lives in Bundibugyo Uganda. With a lot of hard work, she caters for her children who all go to school. She practices so many businesses to fetch enough for her living and her family at large. 

She is involved in selling secondhand clothes, cocoa farming as a major activity, and has a retail business for income generation. She dreams of building a permanent home for her children, though competition and high transport costs affect her business. Nadia needs a loan to buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes for men, women, and children to wear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy electronic spare parts and televisions.

loans.name: Mizraim

texts.en: Mizraim settled to earn her living in Oroquieta City, Philippines together with her family. Over four years, Mizraim was able to manage her farm that absolutely met the needs of the family. The farm is still doing well and is giving enough cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. With her generated revenue, she was able to save for their future needs. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase fertilizer to improve her farm. With the acquisition of in-demand basic commodities, Mizraim expects an increase in sales so as to expand her farm and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Terence

texts.en: Terence is 43 years old and single. He lives in a rural community and operates a motorcycle transport business to generate additional income. He has been in this business for more than six years. He aimed to earn and save more income to help in financing the education of his cousins and save for his future. To continuously operate his motorcycle, he wants to avail a loan of PHP 10,000.00  to purchase the needed spare parts, accessories and gasoline for the maintenance of his motorcycle. He believes that this financial assistance will help him to strengthen his business.

loans.use: to purchase the needed spare parts, accessories and gasoline for the maintenance of his motorcycle

location.town: Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Cherry May

texts.en: Cherry May wants to become an accountant in the future. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to pay her tuition fee for the first semester. Her parents serve in their community as barangay officials. Cherry May's future plan is to pass her board exam and succeed in her career.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: María Ester

texts.es:
María de 65 años de edad, no estudio ya que sus padres no podían mandarle a la escuela, debido a que vivia en un lugar muy extraviado donde tenía que caminar por veredas solas y casi una hora para llegar al centro de estudio, además era un lugar peligroso.

 Ella estuvo casada pero el esposo lo asesinaron por robarle hace 7 años, con él tubo 11 hijos pero en el conflicto armado fallecieron varios de ellos, actualmente solo están con vida 7 pero solo viven 2 hembras con ella quienes estudiaron hasta 6° grado, ambas están acompañadas pero viven con ella. 

María se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 10 años en la ciudad, su horario de trabajo inicia muy de mañana ya que ella sale de su casa a las 4:30 am para estar a las 5:00 am en la ciudad y así tener el tiempo justo para preparar su venta y esperar a que sus clientes lleguen a comprar, decidió dedicarse a este negocio en vista que las condiciones económicas de su familia estaban bajando y decidió buscar la forma de ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, cuando él falleció tubo que comenzar a trabajar con créditos para invertir en mas mercadería ya que tenía que buscar los ingresos que le ayudaran con los gastos del hogar.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar frutas y verduras. Con esto ella tendrá una mejor ganancia ya que comprara el producto un poco más barato y en la venta le generara mejores ingresos.

Ella desea seguir trabajando para tener siempre los ingresos necesarios para pagar todos  los servicios de su casa, desea también que todos sus hijos sean como hasta hoy personas muy entregadas a sus familias y con visión de crecimiento.
texts.en:
Maria is 65 years old. She has no schooling, since her parents could not send her to school. They lived in a solitary area, where she had to walk for nearly an hour on empty paths to reach the school center. Besides, it was a dangerous place.

She was married, but seven years ago, her husband was murdered to steal from him. She had 11 children with him, but several died in the armed conflict. Presently only seven are still alive, of which two girls live with her. They both finished sixth grade, and they have partners, but they live with her.

For the last 10 years, Maria has been making a living selling fruits and vegetables in the city. Her work day starts very early in the morning. She leaves home at 4:30am, to be in the city by 5:00am, in order to have enough time to prepare her sales and wait for her clients.

She decided on this business in view of the financial situation of her family. They were working, and she decided to find the way to help her husband with the household expenses. When he died, she had to start working with loans to invest in more merchandise, since she had to look for the income to help her with home expenses.

The loan she is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy fruits and vegetables. With it, she will generate better profits, since she will buy at slightly cheaper prices, thus getting more income from the sales.

She wants to keep working in order to always have the income needed to meet household expenses. She also wants all her children to stay very dedicated to their family, as it is today, and to keep a view towards growth.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Khoern

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Stoeng Sen district of Kampong Thom province, Khoern is 51 and married with three children, one of whom is still in school. She has been farming rice for 24 years. The current business earns her about 13 USD per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Khoern has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is applying for a loan to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee to study faculty of Accounting. She hopes to keep her daughter in school until her graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy electronic spare parts.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en:
Marvin is 30 years old, single with 1 child and a resident of Carangan, Ozamiz City, Philippines. He earns a living though his barber shop. Aside from financial assistance, he was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. He is a new member of Paglaum.

Now he is applying for 20,000 PHP to purchase second-hand motor unit. This will help him save for his mobilization.  Marvin hopes to fully support his child and provide a decent home in the future.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand motor unit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finance car wash equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beverages.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey used his previous loan to buy more local brew for sale, and he managed to use the proceeds to open up a bar. He is a married man living in Kagadi Uganda where he sells alcohol, while also farming and running a bar to earn a living since 1993. However, he is being challenged by price fluctuations accompanied with high license fees. He hopes to educate his children and send them to university. Godfrey is asking for a loan to buy more local brew (waragi) for selling.

loans.use: to buy more local brew (waragi) for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase steers for his business

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is 48 years old and married.  He lives with his wife in Carmencita province of Isabela. 

Jaime earns a living by growing corn and rice and by raising chickens. 

Jaime has requested this loan to buy manure, urea, and liquid fertilizers for his rice and corn crops. The loan has helped him to improve his financial situation. 

His dream is to buy his own land.  Jaime enjoys traveling with his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his rice and corn crops.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith, a 28-year-old female, is married with three children, living in Bundibugyo Uganda. With nine years practicing farming on her land, she managed to make small savings and opened a fish-selling stall in the market to improve on her household income and fight poverty. She is a hardworking mother even though limited capital affects her operations. Edith has asked for a loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a grill, oil, soap, drinks, snacks, bread, staple foods, disposable cups and plates, serviettes and other products

loans.name: Erinora

texts.en: Erinora is a 46-year-old widowed mother with two children who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. After the loss of her husband she took all the responsibility of providing for the family's cost of living and engaged in farming to meet her daily expenses. She grows cocoa and sells it, though harsh weather conditions affect her production yields. She wants a loan to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell

loans.name: Lucrecia Josefa

texts.es: Doña Lucrecia habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe en una comarca llamada Buenos Aires, Casada, sus hijos son independientes no tiene a cargo a ninguno, su esposo es Ingeniero Agronomo, ella se dedica a la actividad comercial ya que vende Ropa, este crédito lo esta solicitando para la compra de Mercadería como Ropa para damas, caballeros, ropa Juvenil, etc, Agradece la oportunidad que Kiva y Afodenic le están brindado.
texts.en:
Doña Lucrecia lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe in a region called Buenos Aires. She is married and she has no dependents now that her children are self-reliant. Her husband is an agricultural engineer. 

She makes a living selling clothes. The loan which she is asking for will buy merchandise, such as clothes for ladies and gentlemen, children's clothes, etc. She is grateful for the opportunity that Kiva and AFODENIC have given her.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Elanie

texts.en: Elanie is a farmer from Aloran. She is married and has a big heart for her farming activities. She focuses on growing corn, which primarily supports the income for her family. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for seedbed and land preparation. Elanie is hopeful to have a good harvest this season so she can save more and start the renovation of her family's house.

loans.use: to pay for seedbed and land preparation.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is applying for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics to stock her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result for better profits.  Margie also operates an electronic loading station to increase her income.

She and her husband work hard to provide for their everyday needs, especially now that they have two school-age children.  Her profits from business help Margie sustain her children’s education and daily needs. 

Margie looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Margie is thankful for financial assistance extended to her in the past.  Her previous loan helped her business and enabled her to educate of her children.

Margie hopes that her business will grow bigger and she hopes to help other people with her profits.  

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies to stock her business.

loans.name: Jepjep

texts.en: Jepjep is 19 years old and a resident of Enrile Cagayan. He lives with his parents, and is a second-year student taking a Human Kinetics course. He will pursue his education and achieve a good-paying job to become successful someday. He is now asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP from the Kiva lenders to pay his tuition fees and provide daily allowances for school. He hopes that this loan will be given to him to support him at school.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and provide daily allowances for school.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
María, desde muy joven aprendió de sus padres a  trabajar en el cultivo de granos básicos y crianza de cerdos, hoy que ya tiene su propio hogar es un medio de subsistencia para su familia; ella vive con su compañero de vida y dos hijos.
El capital que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abono, semilla, insecticidas, plaguicidas e insecticidas para preparar todo para la siembra de sus cultivos y mejorar su productividad, y también podrá adquirir cerdos para engordarlos y posteriormente venderlos a buen precio. 
Espera que su negocio sea más rentable para mejorar su situación económica, cancelar sus deudas y brindar a su familia una mejor alimentación, vestuario, salud y educación.
texts.en:
Maria, when she was very young, learned to work cultivating basic grains and raising pigs from her parents. Today she has her own home which is a means of supporting her family. She lives with her spouse and their two children.

The capital that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer, seed, insecticides, and pest control to prepare everything for planting her crops and improve her productivity and also to be able to acquire pigs to fatten them and later sell them at a good price. 

She hopes that her business is more profitable so she can improve her economic situation, repay her debts and provide better food, clothing, health and education to her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, insecticides, and pest control.

loans.name: Jeyam Shg - Kumbakonam Group

texts.en:
Kamalavalli is the leader of Jeyam Self Help Group, which consists of four more members hailing from Kumbakonam village, Tanjore district, Tamil Nadu.  

Kamalavalli is a widow. She has responsibilities for two children. She works day in and day out to make ends meet. Kamalavalli uses a conventional stove. Use of these stoves means that inefficient solid biomass fuels like wood are burned, and more trees and vegetation are cut down. The depletion of forests in turn destroys soil quality and agricultural land. Smokeless stoves are economical and greatly reduce carbon emissions, limiting the toxic and hazardous effects of indoor pollution.

Kamalavalli and the other members are requesting a loan to purchase smokeless stoves, which will help them lead a healthier life.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester is a married woman with five children, living in Bundibugyo Uganda. With a big aim of seeing her children go to school, she works hard selling cocoa to cocoa agents to earn and maintain her family's well being. She is challenged by harsh weather, which affects her farming business. She is requesting a loan to add maize and cassava flour to sell to her customers for more profits.

loans.use: to buy maize and cassava flour to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Vilma Yanet

texts.es: La señora Vilma Yaneth es madre de 3 hijos los cuales ya todos son mayores de edad y es una mujer casada y propietaria de una mini miscelánea y una mini fabrica de costuras ella  es una persona con muchos sueños y metas los cuales ha ido cumpliendo uno por uno pues siempre sueña con lograr cada meta que tiene con su familia y su esposo ella anteriormente ha sido beneficiada con los créditos que FAPE le ha otorgado y losa cuales con mucha honestidad y responsabilidad a ha pagado y ahora nuevamente solicita de ustedes un nuevo crédito para la compra de una nueva maquina la cual es un medio muy importante para que ella pueda trabajar y con ello poder pagar sus créditos… y agradece que le tome en cuenta dicha solicitud.
texts.en: Vilma Yaneth  is a mother to three children who are all adults and is a married woman and owner of a mini-miscellaneous shop and a mini clothing factory. She is a person with a lot of dreams and goals which she has been achieving one by one since she always dreams of achieving every goal that she has with her family and her husband. She was the beneficiary of loans that FAPE granted to her and which she has paid with a lot of honesty and responsibility. And now she is again requesting from you a new loan to buy a new machine which is a very important way for her to work and with which she can pay her loans. She is thankful that you take into account her request.

loans.use: to buy a machine to make blouses.

loans.name: Lucelly

texts.es: Lucelly  de 31 años de edad, se dedica a la decoración de eventos sociales desde hace 9 años; este negocio con el cual genera ingresos para sostener a su hijo de 3 años de edad, lo empezó por iniciativa propia siguiendo sus habilidades  creativas innatas en el área de diseño y decoración.  Los clientes de Lucelly solicitan decoración de sus matrimonios, cumpleaños para niños, quinceañeros etc. Todos los días desde la 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde Lucelly se dedica a su negocio con el fin de lograr en un futuro su meta de comprar una vivienda, aunque su mayor desafío es conseguir diariamente cliente en su municipio, ubicado a 1 hora de la ciudad de Barranquilla. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará manteles, mesas y sillas, pues tiene el propósito de decorar los muebles y alquilarlos ella misma. Con esta inversión planea ofrecer un producto de mayor calidad a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Lucelly is 31 years old, she has worked as a decorator for social events for the last 9 years. She uses this business to generate an income to support her 3-year-old son. She started the business on her own initiative following her innate creative abilities in the area of design and decoration. Lucelly's customers request the decoration of weddings, children's birthday parties, quinceañeros (15th-birthday-gala) etc. Every day from 8 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon Lucelly works at her business so that she can achieve her goal to buy a home in the future, even if her greatest challenge is obtaining customers in her town located one hour from the city of Barranquilla. 

Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing made by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she will use it to buy tablecloths, tables and chairs. She intends to decorate the furniture and rent them out herself. With this loan she plans to offer a higher quality product at a better price.

loans.use: to buy tablecloths, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a tent, chairs, tables and ingredients.

loans.name: Mosafar

texts.ru: Мосафар с детьми живет на районе Дангара. У нее трое детей, двое сыновей и одна дочка. Мосафару 57 лет и 4 года из них одна занимается шитьем и вышиванием таджикских национальных платьев. Время, проведенное за швейной машинкой, доставляет ей удовольствие. Сначала это было хобби, но сейчас для Мосафар это больше чем хобби. Она хочет развиваться в этой сфере деятельности и просит кредит, чтобы купить новую более современную швейную машинку, чтобы совершать другие операции. Но из-за нехватки капитала Мосафар не может совершать покупку. Поддержите Мосафар.
texts.en:
Mosafar lives in the Dangara region together with her children. She has three children; two sons and one daughter. Mosafar is 57 years old, and she has worked with sewing and embroidering Tajik national dresses for four of these years. The time she spends by the sewing machine gives her joy. 

Mosafar started sewing as a hobby. However, currently it is more than a hobby for her. She would like to expand her activity in this area. She requests a loan in order to purchase a new, more modern sewing machine, in order to perform other operations too. However, since Mosafar does not have enough capital she can't make the purchase. Please support Mosafar.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Jan Manuel

texts.es:
Jan Manuel tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus 03 hijos de los cuales el mayor de 14 años estudia secundaria en colegio nacional de Lagunas, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de chileno y alfalfa, cuenta con clientes de la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de chileno y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jan Manuel is 29 years old. He lives with his spouse and their three children of whom the eldest is 14 years old. He finished high school at the national high school of Lagunas, a community dedicated to farming, trade and livestock located in the Chiclayo province that belongs to the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

He is dedicated to selling chili and alfalfa. He has customers from the area. He has requested a 2000 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a greater quantity of chili and thus generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of chili to stock his business.

loans.name: Lusvin Ramiro

texts.es: Lusvin, de 34 años de edad,  inicio el negocio de venta de artículos para el hogar desde hace ya cinco años el cual se llama Distribuidora Zamar, en la cual distribuye licuadoras, planchas, cortinas, vajillas, y ropa de cama, en la cual puede proporcionar empleo a dos personas quienes son las que venden los artículos en las calles y el se dedica a realizar los cobros ya que los artículos se venden en cuotas, y esto le genera mas ingresos para su negocio, solicita el crédito ya que desea invertir en mas mercadería para la distribuidora y colocar diferentes diseños y colores de articulos para el hogar, ahnela tener mas clientes para asi seguir dando trabajo a mas personas necesitadas.
texts.en:
Lusvin, age 34, started the business of selling household items five years ago.  His business is called Distribuidora Zamar, and he distributes blenders, irons, curtains, dishes, and bedding.  In his business he is able to give employment to two people who sell the items on the streets.  He makes the collections because the items are sold on payments.  This generates more income for his business.

He is requesting the loan because he wishes to invest in more merchandise.  He will do this in order to distribute and place different designs and colors of household items.  He yearns to have more customers in order to continue giving work to more people in need.

loans.use: to buy home products to sell.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза является одним из таких личностей, которая старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами.  Фируза решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес шитьем женской одежды, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3500 сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Firuza is one of these people who try to improve their living conditions and promote the economic condition of the family. She is married and has three children. Her husband receives a small pay. This pay is not enough to support the family with all necessities. 

Firuza decided to help her husband, for the good of the family. With this aim she attended the training "To Get Ahead", organized by the Association of Business Women, and she received a certificate. Currently she is fully able to set up her own business and become successful in this area. She would like to start a business of sewing women's clothing, as she has experience with this type of business. 

She plans to use the income received to provide her children with a good education and nutritious food. She requests a loan in the amount of 3,500 somoni to purchase a sewing machine, in order to set up the new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy sewing machine to start a new business

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en: Dorcus is a hardworking lady with one child, and she lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is in the retail and green leaf business.  She started the business with the vision of stabilizing her income. She faces the hardship of low capital. But she still hopes to have a well established retail shop. Dorcus has asked for a loan to add stock of sugar, soap, cooking oil, pampers and g.nuts to sell.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, soap, cooking oil, pampers, and g.nuts to sell

loans.name: Coralia Elissette

texts.es:
Coralia, ha tenido nuevos ingresos al invertir el préstamo anterior en la materia prima  para elaborar la venta de tortillas, con los que ha cancelado su deuda personal y mejorada la calidad de vida familiar.
Está solicitando un nuevo crédito para realizar la compra de maíz, cal, leña y gas propano, son los materiales básicos para preparar la venta y seguir generando los ingresos que necesita para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Coralia has had new income upon investing the previous loan in raw materials to make and sell tortillas.  With that income she has repaid her personal debt and improved the quality of her family life.

She is requesting a new loan to buy corn, lime powder, firewood, and propane gas.  They are the basic materials to prepare for the sales and to continue generating the income that she needs in order to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder, firewood, and propane gas.

loans.name: Dora De Jesus

texts.es:
Dora, formo su familia desde hace 20 años junto a su compañero de vida tienen dos hijos de 21 y 19 años de edad, los cueles son empleados de una panadería; ella es propietaria de una tienda de productos de la canasta básica y un molino nixtamal, con los que tiene recursos económicos para aportar a los gastos de su familia, en sus inicios solo tenía la tienda pero ha ido ampliando su negocio y hace ya 10 años logro realizar la compra de un molino nixtamal de dos tolvas, atiende al público desde las cinco de la mañana a las cinco de la tarde. Hasta la fecha no presenta dificultades con el negocio.
El capital lo utilizara para comprar gaseosas, jugos, agua, condimentos, jabón, detergentes, golosinas, boquitas, huevos, aceite, granos básicos, etc., así abastecerá su negocio con más productos para satisfacer a sus clientes, el resto lo invertirá en el pago del  mantenimiento del molino tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar sus servicios, atraer nuevos clientes, mejorar las ganancias y pagar sus deudas. 
Sus anhelos son ampliar su negocio y seguir trabajando para brindar un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Dora started her family twenty years ago. Along with her spouse, she has two children who are 21 and 19 years old and who are employed by a bakery. She is the owner of a convenience store and nixtamal mill with which she has the economic resources to support her family. In the beginning, she had only the shop but she has been expanding the business and ten years ago managed to buy a nixtamal mill with two hoppers. She attends to the public from 5AM to 5PM. Until now, she has not had difficulties with the business. The capital will be used to buy sodas, juices, water, condiments, soap, detergents, candies, snacks, eggs, oil, basic grains, etc. Thus she will stock her business with more products to satisfy her customers. The rest will be invested in paying for maintenance of the mill. She will have the opportunity to improve her services, attract new customers, improve her earnings and pay her debts. Her dreams are to expand her business and keep working to provide a better style of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy sodas, juices, water, condiments, soap, detergents, candies, snacks, eggs, oil, basic grains etc. and to invest in the payment of mill maintenance.

loans.name: Jennylyn

texts.en: Jennylyn has been operating her own retail store for more than two years, and she earns good income from this business. With her generated revenue, she was able to repay her previous loan successfully. She works hard with determination towards the goal of having more income to provide her children a better education. To improve the business, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit in order to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, Jennylyn hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La señora  Tomasa de 49 años de edad, vive con su esposo  tiene  casa propia y dos  hijas  que  dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad de Trojes, al oriente de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 20 años al negocio de pan artesanal como ser rosquillas y hojaldras.
Doña Tomasa está solicitando el préstamo para compra de  maíz, manteca, harina, huevos, soda, etc. para poder seguir elaborando su producto, espera que esta inversión le permita lograr salir adelante y de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia. 
Doña Tomasa  uno de sus sueños es que su negocio siga creciendo y apoyar a sus hijas en con los estudios.


Trojes, Honduras - Junio del 2014.
texts.en:
49-year-old Tomasa lives with her husband. She has her own house and two daughters who depend on her. She lives in the community of Trojes in eastern Honduras. She has made artisan breads like rosquillas and hojaldras for 20 years. 

Tomasa is asking for a loan in order to buy corn, vegetable shortening, flour, eggs, baking soda, etc. to continue making her products. She hopes that this investment will allow her to be able to move forward and continue supporting her family. Tomasa dreams that her business will keep growing and support her daughters' education.

loans.use: to buy corn, vegetable shortening, flour, eggs, baking soda, etc. for her business

loans.name: Elfida Paulina

texts.es: Doña Elfida casada, su esposo se dedica a la extracción de basura de su comunidad, doña  Elfida se dedica a la venta de consumo diario, como maíz, frijol, huevos, también tiene a la venta golosinas, jugos, gaseosas y mas mercadería, doña Elfida empezó vendiendo solo maíz y vio la necesidad de vender otros productos pues sus mismos clientes le pedían que ella vendiera otras cosas ahora ya tiene más de diez años vendiendo, su clientela es fiel pues nunca la han cambiado y si falta algo y ella no lo tiene se lo trae a los clientes, feliz pues aun ayuda a sus hijos y a su esposo para dejar un patrimonio. Ahora desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y seguir sirviendo a su comunidad, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de producto comestibles para la venta.
texts.en:
Elfida is married, and her husband is a garbage collector in her community.  Elfida sells daily consumption items like corn, beans, and eggs.  She also sells candy, juice, soft drinks, and other merchandise.  

Elfida started selling only corn.  She saw the need to sell other products as her own customers asked her to sell other things.  She has now been selling for over ten years.  Her customers are loyal, and they have never changed.  If something is needed that she does not have, she gets it for her customers.  She is happy because she still helps her children and her husband in order to leave a legacy. 

She now wishes to continue investing in her business and to continue serving her community.  She is requesting this loan to buy food products to sell.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Aida Margot

texts.es:
Aida, requiere un nuevo préstamo para comprar láminas que utilizara para remodelar la cocina y evitar que en esta época de invierno se dañe más su estructura, invertirá otra parte en la compra de maíz, harina, levadura, aceite, pollo, verduras, cal, leña, etc., para preparar la venta de pan, tamales y tortillas.
La señora Aida ha logrado mantener su negocio funcionando con ayuda del préstamo anterior, su situación económica es mejor y cancelo con puntualidad sus cuotas.
texts.en: Aida needs a new loan in order to buy sheet metal that she will use to remodel her kitchen and avoid further damage this winter. She will use the other part of the loan to buy corn, flour, yeast, oil, chicken, vegetables, charcoal, firewood, etc. to prepare bread, tamales, and tortillas for sale. Aida has been able to maintain her business with the help of a previous loan. Her finances are better and she made her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, corn, flour, yeast, oil, chicken, vegetables, charcoal, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Dúo San Vicente Group

texts.es:
DUO SAN VICENTE
La líder de este grupo doña Francisca quien lleva más de 22 años en la venta de leña, venta y tejido de servilletas, y algunos años de una mini tienda donde ofrece frutas, verduras,  golosinas, huevos y frijol. Ahora también viaja dos veces por semana a la localidad de Estancia Grande donde ella llega a la entrega de servilletas como también la venta de ropa típica, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la venta.
texts.en:
DUO SAN VICENTE
Francisca is the leader of this group. She has sold firewood and made and sold tapestries for 22 years. For several years, she has had a small store where she sells fruits, vegetables, candies, eggs, and beans. Now she also travels twice per week to a store in Estancia Grande where she sells tapestries and traditional clothing. She is applying for this loan in order to buy food  to sell.

loans.use: to buy food  for sale

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: Richaman
