texts.en: Richaman is a 28-year-old man who lives in Bundibugyo Uganda, and is married with six children. He trades and grows cocoa in his home area. When he realized that the previous loan helped him improve his profit margin, he decided to request another loan to buy more cocoa to sell. Seasonality changes affect his cocoa expected profits. Richaman plans to expand his business and educate his children to higher levels of understanding.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Habibu

texts.en: Habibu is 30 years old and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is married with two children ages two and five years old. Since 2010 he has been working very hard to earn a living for his family. He owns a retail shop and he mainly deals in body lotion, hair treatment and Vaseline, especially for women. Due to very high demand in the area, he has decided to request a loan to buy more merchandise like body lotion and hair treatment to sell.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like body lotion and hair treatment to sell

loans.name: Erick Joel

texts.es:
Erick, nuevamente solicita capital para comprar abono, semilla, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas y pagar arrendamiento del terreno en el que realizará el cultivo de maíz y pipían, con lo que mantendrá la estabilidad de su negocio y sus ganancias.
Con el financiamiento anterior tuvo los materiales agrícolas para sembrar y el dinero para cancelar el alquiler de la propiedad, sus ingresos mejoraron y le han servido para comprar un vehículo, cambiar las circunstancias de vida familiar así como también para ir cancelando sus deudas.
texts.en:
Erick again is requesting capital to buy fertilizer, seed, herbicides, pest control, insecticides and to pay for the rent of the land where he cultivates maize and pipían (type of squash) with which he will maintain the stability of his business and his earnings.

With the previous loan, he had agricultural materials to plant and the money to pay for the rent of the property. His income improved and it has allowed him to buy a vehicle, to change his family's living situation ,as well as also pay his debts.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, herbicide, insecticide, pest control and pay to rent the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies for her coffee fields

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба 35-летняя замужняя женщина из района Шахритус. Она целеустремленная и энергичная женщина. Около года она работает кредитным экспертом в местном банке.  Ее муж работает в России и поэтому Насиба одна воспитывает двоих сыновей. Она решила параллельно начать новый бизнес и улучшить финансовое положение семьи. Насиба умеет шить и кроить женские платья. Это умение она теперь собирается использовать на профессиональном поприще. Однако для реализации цели Насибе не хватает 2000 долларов США. Эту сумму она просит в кредит, чтобы купить компьютерную швейную машинку. Она надеется на вашу отзывчивость.
texts.en:
Nasiba is a 35 years old, married woman from the Shahrituz region. She is a purposeful and energetic woman. She has worked as a credit expert at the local bank for around a year. Her husband works in Russia, and therefore Nasiba is raising their two sons alone. 

She decided to start a new business in parallel and improve the financial condition of the family. Nasiba knows how to sew and cut women's dresses. She has now decided to use this skill in a professional career. However, Nasiba does not have the 2,000 US dollar needed to realize this goal. She requests a loan of this amount, in order to purchase a digital sewing machine. She hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a digital sewing machine, in order to start a sewing business

loans.name: Kulobi

texts.ru:
35-летняя Кулоби в своем селе, расположенном в районе Дангара, занимается выращиванием скотов. Она разводит коров молочной породы вот уже 5 лет и успешно справляется с этой деятельностью. Кулоби замужем за военного и у них двое сыновей и двое дочерей. 
Кулоби в данный момент нуждается в кредите. Она хочет купить еще одну корову молочной породы, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Таким образом она сможет увеличить семейный бюджет.
texts.en:
35 year old Kulobi raises cattle in a village located near Dangara. She has been breeding dairy cows for five years and has been successful with the business. Kulob is married to a soldier, and they have two sons and two daughters. 

Kulob currently needs a loan. She wants to buy another dairy cow to increase the size of her herd. With this loan, she can increase her family's budget.

loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow

loans.name: Apple Group

texts.en:
Hilda is a mother of three daughters (who are in school). She is 40 years old. She is married and supports her family with a business. She runs a grocery business selling beers, spirits, water, juices and sodas, a business in which she has been involved for nine years. Hilda plans to make her business bigger (grow to wholesale level) and for the sake of fulfilling her dream, she started buying fifteen empty crates of beers and sodas as required by a supplier. She is a very hardworking woman, always desiring to learn from other good business performers. She starts working at 6 a.m. and continues until midnight daily and she is able to realize a fair monthly profit. 

Hilda, together with her group members, requests a loan to be apportioned among Apple, a two-member group.The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. To Hilda, this is her fourth loan request since she repaid the others successfully. She used the previous credits to restock her business with sodas, beers, water and spirits. With a good job, she manages to receive profits which she uses to support her kids with school fees and part of the household expenses. 

She will use her portion to replenish her grocery store with beers, sodas and water. Hilda is thankful to everyone who will support her group.

loans.use: to replenish her grocery store with beers, sodas and water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase beauty products and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shoes, used clothing, and beauty products to sell

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison has operated a transportation service for more than 11 years. The business earns good income for his family. He has successfully repaid a previous loan which was used to buy a new motorcycle. Recently, he took a new loan to cover the costs of motorcycle maintenance. He always wants to ensure that his customers feel secure with his services.
 
In the future, Edison hopes to gain more profit and expand his business to purchase more motorcycles.

loans.use: to cover the costs of motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Leslie Ann

texts.en: Due to a lack of job opportunities, Leslie Ann engages herself in selling personal products within the local community to help her parents in gaining income. She is 21 years old and single. Her ambition in life is to become successful and financially stable in the future. To attain her goals, she aimed to improve and strengthen her business to make it profitable. Having insufficient capital, she wants to avail a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more stocks of lotions, underwear, lipsticks, body sprays, face powders and other personal products to sell. She believes that this financial assistance will help her to improve and strengthen the business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of lotions, underwear, lipsticks, body sprays, face powders and other items

location.town: Brgy. Ineangan, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en: Jovia is a resident of Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is 26 years old and married. She is a hardworking woman and a cattle trader. She is cattle keeper and operates a soft drink shop selling sodas, juice, and milk. She started this business because she wanted daily income for her family and she wanted to construct a personal residential house. She is faced with lack of capital, high rental costs and transport to different market segments. She wants a loan to buy more milk to sell.

loans.use: to buy more milk for sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate his shop and purchase palm nuts

loans.name: Lemmarie

texts.en:
Lemmarie is studying criminology at a university and wants to become successful in the future. She has a passion for serving the community in the future. She used her previous loan for her school expenses and she has recently taken out a new loan to pay her tuition fees for the first semester of this year.

Her family has a simple way of living. She has two siblings and she wants them to have better careers. Lemmarie was determined to finish her course in order to gain a better job and to help her parents when they get old.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees for the first semester

loans.name: Kavule Fish Sellers Group

texts.en: Emmanuel, whose hand is raised in the group photo, is a 39-year-old male who is married with three children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. When he realized he wanted good support, he tried to join a group so that he borrows small loans to boost his clothing sales business. He also practices cocoa farming, although he is faced with high competition on the market. He is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Silvia Priscila

texts.es: La señora  Silvia Priscila quien tiene 25 años de edad, ella  posee un local  desde hace 5 años en su vivienda  donde vende útiles escolares ya que es la librería más cercana de  su  comunidad  porque las demás están más alejadas, ella solicita su crédito ya que este es el 3er crédito que solicita, ella desea  solicitar su crédito para comprar de  más útiles escolares porque el capital que ella posee ya no es suficiente para surtir su negocio y desea emplearlo ya que es muy pequeño y no cuenta con suficiente espacio para mostrar la variedad de regalos que ella también vende y desea invertir en compra de regalos de toda ocasión, ella agradece por el apoyo que se le ha brindado ya que ha podido  surtir su negocio y hacerlo crecer.
texts.en: Silvia Priscila is 25 years old. She has had a store in her home for 5 years from which she sells school supplies since is is close to the community and other bookstores are more distant. She is applying for her third loan. She wants the loan so she can buy more school supplies because she doesn't have enough capital to stock her store. She also wants to expand her store since it is small and it doesn't have enough space to showcase the variety of gifts that she also sells. She would like to buy gifts for all occasions. She is thankful for the support she has received since she has been able to stock her business and make it grow.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell in her bookstore.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en: To make a living, Marianita has been selling different types of products in her merchandise store. She earns a good income from this and was able to provide her family. With her generated income, she successfully repaid her previous loan used to improve the business. She always finds ways to offer more goods in order to increase her profits. She took out a new loan recently to purchase additional items to sell. She hopes to improve her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Marlin

texts.en:
This is Marlin: she is 39 and a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Felix, a safety officer, and is mother to two children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marlin operates a buy and sell business. She offers different kinds of ladies' bags. She also has a direct sales business for additional income.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy more variety of ladies bags needed for her business. She will also use her loan for her direct selling business. 

Marlin dreams to have more customers and a wider connection. She hopes that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and it is there where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more variety of ladies' bags needed for her business.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more feeds and other supplies. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and for their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy more feeds and other supplies needed to expand her product inventory. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to see to her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Merlinda hopes that her business will last longer and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and it is there where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more feeds and other supplies needed to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Channel Group

texts.en:
Mary, a businesswoman and mother of four children (one son and three daughters), is aged 40. One of Mary's children is in school while the rest are grown and have businesses like their mother.

Mary is married and she now supports her family with two businesses. Mary own a brick-making machine and has a few helpers who make those bricks for selling. She also sells woods from the same place. Working from 7:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit each month. 

She is requesting her first credit via Kiva field partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this credit to buy stock of cement for making bricks. Mary dreams of growing her business (to become a successful businesswoman). Mary and the other four members of Channel group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock of cement for making bricks

loans.name: G.s Lirios Del Valle Group

texts.es:
La señora  Ada de 42 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene  casa propia y dos  hijas  que  dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad  Trojes al oriente de Honduras.
Doña Ada se dedica desde hace 20 años al negocio de venta de rosquillas y hojaldras, etc. y necesita el préstamo para la compra de harina, sal, soda, queso, aceite, etc. que son la materia prima para elaborar su productos.
Doña Ada forma parte de un grupo integrado por  doña Leysi  que se dedica a la venta de granos básicos y doña Sonia que se dedica a la venta de combustible. 
Doña Ada al igual que sus compañeras de grupo espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante con sus familias y que les genere los ingresos necesarios para mejorar un poco sus calidades de vida.
 
 Trojes, Honduras - Junio del 2014.
texts.en:
Ada is 42 years old, a single mother with her own house and two children dependent on her. She lives in the Trojes community in eastern Honduras. Ada has been in business for 20 years selling doughnuts, pastries, etc. and needs a loan to buy flour, salt, soda, cheese, oil, etc. which are the main ingredients to make her products. 

Ada is part of a group created by Leysi who sells basic grains and Sonia who sells fuel. Ada, along with her fellow group members, hopes that this investment will allow them to move their families forward and that it generates the income necessary to improve their quality of life a little. 

Trojes, Honduras - June 2014.

loans.use: to buy flour, salt, soda, cheese, oil, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments and a variety of items to resell

loans.name: Lyra

texts.en: Lyra is a 36-year-old mother who owns and manages a small retail store within the local community. Due to financial insufficiency, she aims to make her business more profitable in order to support the education of her three children. She wants to increase her product offerings, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she  wants to access financial assistance of $250 (PHP 10,000) to buy more inventory of beverages, frozen foods, sugar, cooking oils, canned goods, laundry soaps and soft drinks to resell. She is hoping that someday, she will improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of beverages, frozen foods, sugar, cooking oils, canned goods, laundry soaps and soft drinks to resell.

location.town: Brgy. Ineangan, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Naume

texts.en:
Naume is a 48-year-old married woman with six children. Out of the six children, four attend school. Naume and her husband are farmers growing mainly matooke (bananas), sugarcane and maize on a smaller scale for both home and commercial purposes. Currently Naume's husband is sick and she is in charge of looking after the family including paying school fees.

Naume has now approached Ugafode for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 so that she can pay school fees for their daughter who is in nursing school, and the other children, who are in primary school. Naume is unable to raise this money all at once but can afford to pay it back in smaller installments.

Her dream is to have her daughter complete her studies and maybe in the future she can support the family. Naume is a hardworking person who is only constrained by the weather conditions affecting agriculture, as well as the price fluctuation for agricultural products on the market. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the financial support rendered to her through UGAFODE.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her daughter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 53 years old, married and lives in Enrile with her family. In their farming business, she and her spouse plant and harvest rice to sell. They patiently manage the business to acquire good income for the education of her children. She wants to increase crop production, but to achieve this, she needs enough farm inputs for sustenance. So, Vilma is asking for a loan of $475 (20,000 PHP) to buy fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides to use in farming. This loan will be a great help for her to attain income stability for her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to assist her coffee crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of fertiliser and a bad of seed to grow corn.

loans.name: Solidario Sagrado Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es: Solidario Sagrado Corazon de Jesus Este solidario está integrado por doña Verónica Julissa ella tiene 30 años de edad y su negocio es una panadería, ella se dedica  a la venta de panes, pasteles ,donas, empanadas, así como venta de café, capuchinos, café con leche, en su municipio de Santo Tomas Milpas Altas, ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de un cilindro para amasar, la masa para hacer sus panes, su deseo es lograr comprarlo ya que el que actualmente tiene ya necesita cambio, ya que ya no le está funcionando bien.
texts.en:
Verónica Julissa is a member of the Solidario Sagrado Corazon de Jesus group. She is 30 years old and her business is a bakery. She makes a living from the sale of bread, donuts, turnover pastries, as well as coffee, cappuccinos and coffee with milk. Her business is in Santo Tomas Milpas Altas.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of a dough kneader, with the dough being meant for bread. Her wish is to be able to buy one since the one that she currently has needs to be changed as it is not functioning well.

loans.use: to buy a dough kneader to make cakes

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en: Dominador is 46 years old, married and has three children. He sustains his family through income from his business, managing a farm, where he plants and harvests rice to sell. He was not able to generate good production from the previous harvest, so he is now asking for a loan of $1150 (49,000 PHP) to cope with his low production. He will buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming. This will help nourish his crops. Dominador promises to pay back his loan in full and keep improving his farming practices.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Sahima

texts.en: Due to the hardship of living, Sahima aims to improve her small retail store to generate sufficient income. She is 37-years-old and has three school going children. She and her husband want to educate all their children so that they will become professionals in the future. To improve the business, she seeks additional capital of PHP 21,000 to purchase more stock of canned goods, soft drinks, beverages, assorted candies, biscuits, soaps, noodles and seasonings to resell. She believes that this financial assistance will help her to further improve the business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of canned goods, soft drinks, beverages, assorted candies, biscuits, soaps, noodles and seasonings to resell

location.town: Brgy. Mabasa, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Velsie

texts.en:
Velsie joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $175 (7,000 PHP). This loan is intended to purchase ingredients for bread making.

Velsie dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to purchase various ingredients for bread making.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok, 54, is a lovely mother of four children who lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. In the last twenty years, she has been involved in an agri-business. By owning farmland, she is able to grow rice and sell the product to the local dealers and sometimes she sells directly to customers at the market. 

Sok goes to sell her product at the market that is located far away from her house. To get there, she would spend much time and energy as she normally does by bicycle. To ensure a comfortable way for delivering her rice product to the market, Sok really needs a motorbike to serve as her primary transportation. Due to the lack of budget, she is now applying for a Kiva loan through HKL to buy a motorbike. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is from Cangmangki, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor. She is 46 years old and is married with four kids. 

In 2013, Lina applied for her membership with PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become one. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Lina asked for financial assistance of PHP 25,000 to be used as additional capital to purchase processed meat products for re-sale. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and be of help in the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase processed meat products for re-sale.

loans.name: Mrangirangi Group

texts.en:
Yuni, who is in her early twenties, is married with one kid who is still small.  She has been running a beauty salon since 2008.  She works from 8 am to 9:30 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.  

This will be Yuni's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to sell electric money transfers, own a foot shop and open a beauty salon.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy salon equipment to make the salon more attractive.  She dreams of selling gas.

Yuni will share this loan with her loan group "Mrangirangi", which has three people, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment to make the salon more attractive.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dressmaking supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Julienne Mae

texts.en: Julienne Mae lives in Tuguegarao with her parents. Her mother is a dressmaker where she gets an income for their living. She is 19-years-old and a fourth year college student who dreams of becoming a successful entrepreneur someday. She is taking up a Bachelor of Science in Hospitality and Industry Management. She is borrowing a loan of PHP 7,000 to pay tuition fees. She will pay back her loan with the help of her mother.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dressmaking supplies.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and with their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Anselma dreams to have another store and hopes that her family is always in good health.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for the care of her coffee crop.

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José  de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta 4 grado de educación básica, él por motivos de distancia  ya no pudo seguir estudiando, ya que en la escuela de su comunidad hasta 4 grado existía. 

José está acompañado, ya que él había quedado viudo al morir hace siete años su primera esposa.  Su pareja actual se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar un par de vacas que poseen, ellos tienen 2 hijos.

José posee 30 años de experiencia de trabajar en la agricultura, aprendió este trabajo ya que su padre se lo enseño cuando él estaba pequeño, y decidió dedicarse a hacerlo ya que es una forma de trabajar sanamente y de donde obtiene sus ingresos.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar 4 sacos de fertilizantes, 1 bolsa de semilla de maíz certificada, 3 cajas de insecticidas, con esto pretende darle un buen mantenimiento a su parcela de maíz para obtener mayores rendimientos.

A futuro planea tener abundante granos básicos para darle una buena dieta alimenticia a su familia, además pretende tener ingresos de una parte de la cosecha que venderá.
texts.en:
Jose, 44, went to school through fourth grade in primary school. Due to the distance, he couldn't continue school since the school in his community only went up to fourth grade.

Jose is cohabiting after he became a widower when his first wife died seven years ago. His current partner handles domestic tasks and takes care of the two cows she owns. They have two children.

Jose has 30 years of experience working in agriculture. He learned this work from his father, who taught him when he was little. Then, Jose decided to make a living doing it because it's a healthy way to make a living and how he makes his income.

The loan he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy 4 sacks of fertilizer, 1 bag of certified corn seeds, and 3 boxes of insecticide. With this, he plans to perform maintenance on his corn parcel to have better harvests.

In the future, he plans to have abundant basic grains to provide his family with a good diet. Also, he plans to have income from the harvest he will sell.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of fertilizer, 1 bag of certified corn seeds, and 3 boxes of insecticide, with which he plans to perform maintenance on his corn parcel to gain better harvests.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy furniture.

loans.name: Mirta Lastenia

texts.es:
La señora  María  de  45  años de edad  es  casada cuenta con  un negocio de costura ubicado en su casa de habitación donde elabora lo que son vestidos de quince años, vestido para damitas, elabora chalecos pantalones de caballeros y también vende carne asada los fines de semana.
Doña María se dedica a la costura desde hace 12 años y sus clientes son todas las personas de su aldea y de aldea vecinas, es conocida por su amabilidad y carisma, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de refresco, carne, tomates, frijoles, arroz, tortillas, etc. para invertir en su segundo negocio de venta de carnes.
Doña María vende mucho estos productos y espera que la inversión le genere los ingresos necesarios para seguir invirtiendo en sus negocios y también que le permita mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Su sueño es  seguir  mejorar su casa y su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras  -  Julio 2014
texts.en:
Señora María is 45 and married. She has worked as a seamstress in her home for the past 12 years, making a variety of clothing items for girls as well as mens' vests and pants. Her customers include all of her neighbors and many people in nearby areas, who appreciate her kindness and charm. 

Señora María also has a second business selling roasted meats on weekends. She is applying for a loan for the purchase of soft drinks, meat, tomatoes, beans, rice, tortillas, and other food items for the weekend meat business. 

Doña María sells a great deal of food and hopes that the investment from these loan funds will help her generate the income she needs to keep supporting both of her businesses. She also hopes that she'll be able to improve family's quality of life a little while also continuing to make improvements to her home and her businesses. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras  -  July 2014

loans.use: for the purchase of soft drinks, meat, tomatoes, beans, rice, tortillas, and other food items for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a heifer and a crop of sorghum.

loans.name: Isabel Segunda

texts.es: Isabel de 45 años de edad  viaja a un municipio de Sucre y trae mercancía originaria de esa región: mecedoras, tejidos, accesorios y fantasías, para venderla en el municipio donde actualmente habita. 	Desde hace 5 años y por la necesidad de aumentar sus ingresos familiares generó esta idea de negocio y desde ese momento no descansa con el fi de hacerlo crecer. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primero financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará variedades femeninas y para el hogar que comprará en San Pues un pueblo en el municipio de Sucre caracterizado por sus artesanías tejidas y productos elaborados en madera de gran calidad. Su meta es fortalecer el capital de trabajo e incrementar sus ventas y utilidades de negocio, con el fin de aumentar cada vez más su nivel de vida, aunque su gran desafio es lograr adquirir el capital de trabajo suficiente para cumplir con sus sueños.
texts.en: Isabel, 45 years old, travels to the municipality of Sucre and brings merchandise native of that region: rocking chairs, textiles, accessories and novelty items, to sell in the municipality where she currently lives. Five years ago, due to the need to expand her family’s income, she created this business idea and from that moment she has not rested with the intention of making it grow. Currently she is still applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing she makes to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will buy products for women and the home that she will buy in San Pues, a town in the municipality of Sucre characterized by its textile handicrafts and products made of wood of great quality. Her goal is to strengthen the capital of her work and increase her sales and business profits, with the intention of expanding even further her level of life, although her great challenge is being able to acquire sufficient work capital to complete her dreams.

loans.use: to buy products for women and the home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro de 56 años de edad muy trabajador y responsable, es muy conocido en su comunidad  por su forma de ser y su actividad económica que lo caracteriza como una excelente persona por su buena educación y servicio a los demás. 

Él se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de granos básicos y al cuido de ganado que es de su propiedad, se creció con su padre y sus abuelos y su nivel educativo es de 2º grado y el motivo por el cual ya no continuo sus estudios fue porque la escuela le quedaba a 15 km de su casa y en aquella época no había trasporte. A medida que trascurrió el tiempo Teodoro adquirió experiencia y muchos conocimientos sobre la agricultura debido a que inicio desde los 12 años de edad  y es la actividad, que en la actualidad se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos ya que vende casi el 40% de sus cosechas y lo demás queda para el consumo de su familia, el lugar de su trabajo le queda a 2 km de su casa y a realizar esta actividad se suma la ayuda de uno de sus hijos quien le ayuda en horarios de 7:00 am a 11:00 am ya que se encuentra estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad.

El dinero será utilizado para pagar el alquiler de la tierra donde cultivara maíz y frijoles. De esta manera tendrá parcelas de cultivo más diversificadas, lo cual le dará una mayor fuente de ingresos al momento de vender las cosechas que serán invertidas en mejoramiento de su vivienda y compra de vitaminas para su ganado. 

Las metas que él tiene a futuro son las de ampliar sus parcelas y diversificar sus cultivos, y comprar más ganado en cuanto a sus hijos apoyarlos en todo lo que sea necesario para su preparación y formación académica, ya que manifiesta que uno de ellos tiene el sueño de ser doctor en medicina, otro ingeniero en construcción, y una que quiere ser enfermera y el ultimo mecánico automotriz y todo esto lo va lograr con la inversión de sus ganancias el buen manejo de un nuevo crédito,  ya que cuenta con mucha experiencia en el manejo de créditos para la agricultura.
texts.en:
Teodoro, 56, is very hardworking and responsible. He is known in his community for his character and his economic activity which show him to be an excellent person due to his good education and service to others. He is a farmer, planting basic grains and raising cattle. He grew up with his father and grandparents and studied through 2nd grade, but his school was 15km from home and back then there was no transportation so he had to quit. Through time, Teodoro acquired experience and a lot of knowledge of agriculture. He began working in the field at age 12 and it has become his main source of income as he now sells about 40% of his harvest and saves the rest for his family's consumption. The land where he works is 2km from his house and one of his sons helps with the work from 7am to 11am when he is not in school.

The loan will be used to pay rent on the land where he will grow corn and beans. This way he will have more diversified crops which will give him greater income at harvest time. He will invest the profit from his harvests in making improvements to his home and buying vitamins for his cattle. His goals for the future are to increase his land holdings and diversify his crops, and to buy more cattle. He wants to support his children and give them everything they need to prepare themselves academically; one of them dreams of being a medical doctor, another an engineer, one wants to be a nurse and the youngest a car mechanic. All of this will be achieved through good management and investment of his profits from a new loan. He has a lot of experience in managing agricultural loans.

loans.use: to pay rent on the land where he grows corn and beans.

loans.name: Kakakuona Group

texts.en:
Witress is among the Kakakuona Group members who joined in 2008. She is a good member of her group, paying her credits well. She is married, in her early thirties, and lives together with her three school going kids. For six years she has been supporting her husband with managing the family with a food business (mamalishe). She runs her business in a unique way - just cooks everything from home, packs into containers and resells them to people by walking office to office. She sells these foods at the bus terminal where there is more congestion of people. She wakes up early in the morning, sells from 7 am to 1 pm daily, and is able to make a good profit daily. 

Witress requests her fifteenth loan to be apportioned among Kakakuona, a ten member group. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. She used the previous credits that she repaid successfully, to buy food cooking ingredients such as rice, beans, sugar, and meats. She opened a new beauty salon business to grow her income. Witress earned a profit which she used to build and cover part of the school fees. She is so happy with Kiva's support. With her new request, she will use it to buy stock of rice and use part of it to buy bricks to build a house and put electricity in her house. She desires to manage a big business.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice and to use part of it to buy bricks to build a house and put electricity in her house.

loans.name: Flomercille

texts.en:
Flomercille is 38-years-old, married and lives in Siquijor, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she raises pigs and sells them commercially. 

Through Paglaum MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan to purchase animal feed and vitamins. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to more easily keep sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and vitamins

loans.name: Dora Eva

texts.es:
Dora una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora con 50 años de edad dedicada al mundo de las confecciones a terceros, actividad que es muy mal pagada por lo que hay que recibir grandes lotes para obtener utilidad por ellos. 
Aprendió de la actividad gracias a su abuela y madre quienes fueron grandes modista y le dejaron un buen legado de clientes y conocimientos a dora. 
Al ser esta una actividad muy poca rentable quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de una maquina fileteadora para recibir más producción y seguir junto con sus dos empleadas un camino de crecimiento y buena proyección a futuro. 
Con la compra de esta máquina no solo mejorara la cantidad de producción si no que podrá comenzar con su línea propia de salidas de baño para niños las cuales distribuirá en los almacenes pero todo esto depende del crédito que será la puerta de entrada al progreso.
texts.en:
Dora, a very responsible and hardworking woman of 50 years of age, works in the world of dressmaking to third parties, a business that is very poorly paid, for which it is necessary to receive large batches in order to obtain profit for them. 

She learned the trade thanks to her grandmother and mother who were great dressmakers and they left Dora a good legacy of customers and knowledge. This business being of little profit, she wants to request a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine (serger) to receive more production and continue, together with her two employees, a path of growth and good projection to the future. 

With the purchase of this machine she will not only improve the quantity of production, but she will also be able to begin her own line of bathrobes for children which she will distribute to the department stores, but all of this depends on the loan that will be the entry door to progress.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine to improve her production capacity.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is 49-years-old, a widow and has three children. She raises hogs and sells them upon achieving the desired weight. She patiently raises hogs for income. Susana is now asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy feed, rice bran and medicines for her hogs. This will help improve the growth and nutrition to her hogs. Susana wants to further develop her business, as well as her income, and save funds for her family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy feed, rice bran and medicines for her hogs

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 27-year-old married man from Deir El balah.  He lives with his wife and three kids: two sons and one daughter. Ahmad works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income.  This income barely covers all the family's needs. Ahmad would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy all their needed stuff.
 
Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water.  By taking this loan, Ahmad will reduce electricity use and provide his family hot water using solar power. 

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Accountancy at a university.  She wants to become a successful accountant in the future and is determined to have a better career.  She used her previous loan for her allowances and miscellaneous expenses. She took a new loan to pay her tuition fee for the first semester of this current year.

In the future, she wants to achieve her goal to become successful with her career.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee for the first semester of this current year

loans.name: Serafina Ludys

texts.es: Mercancia sobre pedidos, fue lo que compró Serafina con su anterior credikiva; con esta inversión ella logró fortalecer su capital de trabajo y mejorar la liquidéz del negocio beneficiando una vez mas sus ingresos familiares. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, mediante el cual comprará mercancia variada, como ropa calzado accesorios etc. para atender la demanda del segundo semestre del año, temporada en la que usualmente se incrmentan sus ventas y nuevamente obtendrá mayores utilidades si invierte rapidamente.
texts.en: Merchandise on order is what Serafina bought with her last Kiva loan.  With this investment, she was able to fortify her working capital and improve the liquidity of the business which once more benefitted her family income.  This time she is applying for a new Kiva loan with which she will buy varied merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, accessories, etc. in order to meet the demand of the second half of the year, a time when her sales usually increase and she will once again obtain more advantage if she invests quickly.

loans.use: to buy varied merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, accessories, etc.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia lives in the Wedza District of Zimbabwe, is married, and has one child. She is 26 years old. She started her poultry business in January 2010 as a way of raising income for her family. She has since gained experience and now has a capacity of 100 birds every six weeks. The business has been good so far, and she would like to keep improving it. Sylvia is often found volunteering in her community as a Leaner Guide with her local secondary school. She will use the Kiva loan to expand her fowl run and to buy more chicks and feed.

loans.use: To expand her fowl run and to buy more chicks and feed.

loans.name: Santos Fermin

texts.es:
Santos, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos tales como  frijol, maíz y maicillo desde hace 15 años, trabaja solo, cuando lo amerita contrata mozos para tener ayuda en sus actividades, su horario de trabajo es de siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde, su oficio lo aprendió dentro de la familia. Santos es casado, vive con su esposa y una hija, las cuales dependen económicamente de él.
Comprará abono, semilla, plaguicidas, insecticidas y herbicidas, así dará un buen desarrollo a sus cultivos, aumentará la productividad con la que dará a su familia una buena alimentación y venderá el resto esperando tener mejores ganancias con las que cancelara su deuda.
Sus proyectos son seguir ampliando el área de cultivo, mejorar la situación económica y dar una vida más digna a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos has been dedicated to the cultivation of basic grains such as beans, corn and sorghum for 15 years. He works alone and only when necesary hires laborers to help in the effort.  His work schedule is from 7:00 in the morning to 3:00 in afternoon.  He learned his trade from his family.

Santos is married and lives with his wife and daughter, who are economically dependent on him.  He wishes to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, insecticides and herbicides.  This will give good development for his crops and increase productivity.  This way he will be able to feed his family and sell the rest.  He hopes for better income with which he will repay the debt.

His project is to continue to expand the area under cultivation, improve his economic situation and give a better life to his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, insecticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Sreng, 49, who is a lovely mother of five children, lives in the small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. In the last twenty five years, she has been involved in the framing​ sector. On her farm land, she grows peanuts and sells the product to the local dealers and sometimes she sells directly to customers at the market. 

To keep her peanuts growing in a modern agricultural way, Sreng would use some natural fertilizers and some other farming material in her farming process. Since she can’t afford them, Sreng now is requesting a Kiva loan through HKL to buy fertilizers and farming materials. With the support of this loan, she hopes that she can receive more benefits than the previous farming season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farming materials

loans.name: Usalama Group

texts.en:
Mohamed, who is in his early 40s is single with one kid who is still at school. He has been selling chips with eggs, chicken, meat and fish for five years now. He works from 5 pm to after midnight daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Mohamed's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy a new gas cooker and a new electric cooker. He also bought Irish potatoes and cooking oil. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy a deep fryer, Irish potatoes, cooking oil and gas for cooking. He dreams of building his own house.

Mohamed will share this loan with his loan group Usalama which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a deep fryer, Irish potatoes, cooking oil and gas for cooking.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plantains.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda lives in the upland of Aloran. Nilda has taken advantage of the area for pasture development. The family earns well with her goat dispersal. This livelihood has supported the family for all their daily needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase animal feeds and vitamins. Nilda hopes to double her income with the additional heads of goats dispersed.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en: Rolly is a hard-working dad, who makes a living with his own farm - a piggery where he earns well while his wife works as a teacher.  He borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit.  Rest assured he is determined to have a better future.  In the future, he wants to expand his business to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel, tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien reside en una aldea que pertenece a Victoria, Yoro. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura con la producción de maíz, esta producción la vende en la misma zona de donde obtiene los ingresos necesarios para su hogar. El préstamo que ha solicitado es el segundo ciclo y es por 7,000 Lempiras con el cual va poder comprar insumos como abonos y pago de mano de obra para el buen  manejo de su cultivo de maíz. Su propósito es obtener mejor producción para vender a los mercados locales directamente a mejor precio y poder asegurar su fuente de ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Samuel is 33 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with his wife. They live in a village belonging to Victoria, in Yoro. He has always worked in agriculture growing corn.  He sells this production in the same area where he obtains the income needed for his household.

The loan he has requested is his second loan, in the amount of 7,000 lempiras, with which he will be able to buy supplies such as fertilizer, and to pay labor costs for the good management of his corn crops. 

His goal is to obtain better production to sell to the local markets directly at better prices, thus being able to ensure an income source for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs to help with corn farming.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget is a 19-year-old woman from the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. In addition to volunteering as a Learner Guide, delivering useful life skills curriculum every week at a secondary school in her community, Bridget runs her own poultry project. She has grown her poultry business to its current capacity producing about 50 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. She started her business in 2012 because she wanted to be financially independent.  

Bridget would like to increase her volume of sales and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is an 18-year-old businesswoman in the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. She is successfully operating a small grocery shop in which she sells basic commodities to community members. In addition to running her small business, she also makes time to volunteer every week as a Camfed Learner Guide working with a class at a local high school.

With the requested loan, Patience intends to make bulk purchases of sugar, cooking oil, soap, and salt to reduce costs. Patience would like to assist orphans and other vulnerable children in her community with the profits.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Luz Stella

texts.es: Desde hace 4 años Luz Stella inició su negocio; trabajaba en una empresa y queria independizarse para generar ingresos autonomos, por eso logró a través de una amiga vender productos mediante guias especializadas. Hoy no se detiene y ofrece a una clientela fija, perfumería, cosméticos tratamientos capilares, ropa interior productos de belleza  y articulos para el hogar. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito, dinero  que recupera  cada 20 dias trabajando en un horario de 2 a 6 de la tarde y comprando a sus proveedores a crédito. SLuz Stella es una mujer muy comerciante que tiene muchas metas entre ellas la de emprender una cafetería que genera aun mas ingresos . En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finacimeitno que hace a la Fundación mrio Santo Domingo mediante la cual comprará cosméticos y mercancias varias que han sido exhibidas en sus catalogos, con precios especiales y con ello quiere sorprender a su clientela.
texts.en:
Four years ago, Luz Stella started her own business.  She had been working in a company but wanted to generate her own independent income.  Through a friend, she started selling products through specialized catalogs. Today she is in motion and offers her loyal clientele perfume, cosmetics, hair care, beauty products, underwear and household items.

Her sales are in cash and credit.  Money gets repaid every 20 days, working on a schedule of 2-6 pm, and buying from suppliers on credit.  Luz Stella is a sales woman who has many goals including undertaking a cafe generating even more revenue.

Currently, she has applied for a Kiva loan, primary financing from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  With this, she will buy cosmetics and several goods that have been displayed in the catalogs, with special prices and thus she will impress her customers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and various merchandise.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz is a responsible housewife who supported her husband in cultivating their farmland by planting various vegetables for sale. The couple aimed to improve their farming business in order to generate a higher income to sustain their family's needs. They planned to expand their vegetable plantation but do not have have enough capital. For this reason, Luz wants to avail herself of a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy herbicides and fertilizers needed in vegetable production. Through hard work and strong determination, they believe that they will expand their plantation and achieve high production.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and fertilizers needed in vegetable production

location.town: Brgy. San Fabian, Kayapa, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Iris Lisseth

texts.es:
La señora  Iris de  31  años de edad  es soltera  vive en  casa propia y se dedica a la compra y venta de rosquilla, sus ventas son de forma ambulante por las diferentes aldea de la zona y su mayoría de clientes son personas que viajan  los diferentes destinos.
Doña Iris es conocida por ser un mujer luchadora con el deseo de seguir adelante, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras está  solicitando el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, harina, azúcar, aceite, etc. para elaborar su producto y poder satisfacerla demanda de sus clientes y su vez espera que esta inversión le permita obtener los ingresos necesarios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus familia. 
Su sueño es  seguir  mejorar sus ingresos y así seguir trabajando con la institución.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio 2014
texts.en:
Iris is 31 years old, single, and lives in her own house. She buys and sells bagels in the streets of the different towns of the zone, and the majority of her customers are people who travel to different destinations.

Iris is known as a woman with the strong desire to get ahead. She lives in the community of San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras.

She is soliciting a loan to purchase corn, firewood, wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc., to make her product, satisfying her customer's demands. Iris hopes this investment will permit her to obtain the necessary income to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

Iris' dream is to continue improving her income and to continue working with this institution.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – July 2014

loans.use: buy corn, firewood,wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Hani Group

texts.en:
Hani is a group which is comprised of four members of women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB.

Zaynab is the leader of the group. She is a 42-year-old married woman with nine children. Her oldest child is 26-years-old and the youngest one is 6-years-old. She studied until secondary education, but she couldn't complete her studies. Her husband is employed as a solider, and she works as a housewife, living with her family in their own house. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. His salary is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. Zayanb decided to share the expenses of the house with him. Their house lacks many food materials. In order to provide her family with their necessary needs, Zaynab applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase food materials for her household to provide her family with suitable food. 

Zaynab looks forward to preparing her house with all kinds of food materials in order to save for a secure future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase food materials for her household to provide her family with suitable food.

loans.name: Maria Roxana

texts.es:
María, es jefa de su hogar, ha tenido que enfrentar sola la responsabilidad de sacar adelante  a sus dos hijos, ella es viuda, todos viven juntos, su fuente de ingresos es una sala de belleza en la que ofrece el servicio de cortes de cabello, aplicación de tintes, manicura, entre otros así como también  productos de belleza; ella aprendió este oficio en una academia de belleza, ha ido mejorando su negocio con ayuda de préstamos.
Invertirá el préstamo en la compra de tintes, esmaltes, lociones, cremas corporales, tratamientos para el cabello, mascarillas faciales, blusas, faldas, entre otros accesorios, en busca de tener un mejor inventario para facilitar la satisfacción de los clientes incluirá la venta de ropa, espera tener resultados positivos y mantener un buen record crediticio.
María tiene la aspiración de tener un negocio muy amplio en donde sus clientes encuentren lo que necesiten y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
María is the head of her home. She has had to face alone the responsibility of getting her two children ahead. She is a widow. All of them live together. Her source of income is a beauty salon in which she offers services including hair cuts, dye applications, manicures, among others, and also beauty products. She learned this business in a beauty academy. She has been improving her business with the help of loans. 

She will invest the loan in the purchase of dyes, nail polish, lotions, body creams, hair treatments, facial masks, blouses, skirts, among other accessories. In search of having a better inventory to facilitate the satisfaction of her customers, she will include the sale of clothing. She hopes to have positive results and maintain a good credit record. 

María has the aspiration to have a very large business in which her customers find what they need and to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy dyes, nail polish, lotions, body creams, hair treatments, facial masks, blouses, skirts, among other accessories.

loans.name: Shingirai

texts.en: Shingirai, age 23, lives in the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. She serves as a peer educator in her community and a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school. Shingirai has been operating a grocery shop successfully for more than a year. She works with her family and with the assistance of her husband. She supplies the community with sugar, rice, tea, stationary, sanitary items, cooking oil, and potato chips. With the Kiva loan, Shingirai intends to make bulk purchases to reduce her costs and increase sales volume and profits.

loans.use: To make bulk purchases to reduce her costs and increase sales volume and profits.

loans.name: Gopuram Shg - Kandayakollai Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kavitha is a leader of the “Gopuram” Self-Help Group (SHG) with four other women, to which PAT, the local NGO, has been giving loans to improve their livelihoods. Kavitha lives in a small hamlet in the rural area of Kandayakollai in Tanjore District, Tamil Nadu. She is married to Mr. Kolanchinathan. They have three children, all studying. They live in a house made of thatched roof.
 
India accounts for six lakh (600,000) deaths every year caused by acute lower respiratory infections. This is the leading causes of disease and mortality, which are the offspring of indoor pollution and lung congestion caused by the use of traditional stoves emitting smoke. A majority of villagers usually cook on the earthen stove or a three brick earthen burner, which over a period of time is responsible for lung disease and blurred vision. 

Hence, Kavitha and her group members are looking forward to this loan to purchase a smokeless stove that can be used in their kitchen and help them breathe clean air.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove

loans.name: Kibosho Group

texts.en:
Asha is in her early thirties and has two kids, a small one and one other schooling child. She is married and owns a water tank where she fills it with water and resells to her neighbors. She also sells charcoal.  She has been with all the businesses for three years now.  Asha works from 6 am to 10 pm per working day and is able to make a good profit each month. 

This will be her third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With her previous loans, since she repaid them, she bought a water storage tank and sacks of charcoal. She manages to receive extra income which she uses to cover part of the school fees and home food expenses. She dreams to be a successfully mother managing a big business. Asha will use her new loan request to expand her charcoal store and purchase more sacks to resell. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "KIBOSHO", which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to expand her charcoal store and purchase more sacks to resell.

loans.name: Elsy Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elsy, se siente agradecida con la ayuda que se le da a través de los créditos y la facilidad  de pago que le brinda Padecomsm, por lo que se decidió por un  nuevo préstamo para comprar dulces, bebidas, pan, aceite, huevos, azúcar, sal, tomates, cebollas, chiles, repollos, etc., con los que seguirá atendiendo de la mejor manera a sus clientes.
Con el financiamiento anterior Elsy surtió la tienda teniendo efectos positivos como nuevos clientes, mejores ventas y ganancias, la familia se mantiene igual pero viviendo en mejores circunstancias.
texts.en:
Elsy is grateful for the help provided to her through Padecomsm's loans and their ease of payment, and has decided to request a new loan to buy sweets, drinks, bread, oil, eggs, sugar, salt, tomatoes, onions, chilli peppers, cabbages, etc in order to provide her customers with the best service. 

Elsy used her previous loan to stock up her shop, which brought such benefits as new customers, and improved sales and profits. She is still supporting her family, but they now have a better living situation.

loans.use: to buy sweets, drinks, bread, oil, eggs, sugar, salt, tomatoes, onions, chilli peppers, cabbages, etc.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
El señor Jaime es el propietario de un Kiosco muy famoso en su sector pues es punto de encuentro de muchos agricultores donde van y se toman unas cervezas o unos tragos con sus amigos celebrando o relajándose de un día duro y laborioso por eso es un reto para el señor Jaime tener siempre le Kiosco surtido para abarcar y darle gusto a sus clientes. 
Al ser una persona humilde y con recursos limitados se le es difícil mantener el local bien surtido pues vende a precios favorables para la población pro dicha razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cervezas, trago, Snakc, dulces y poder realizar reformas a su local pues el paso de los años y el clima lo han deteriorado mucho y quiere que se vea mejor. 
Su sueño es poder continuar con su local para disfrutar y compartir con sus vecinos sus gozosos años de vida.
texts.en:
Jaime is the owner of a well-known stand in the area, where many farmers meet and have beers and other drinks with their friends, and relax after a day of hard work. The challenge for Jaime is to always have a well-stocked stand and provide his customers with what they like. 

As he is poor and has limited resources, and sells at prices that are reasonable for his customers, it is difficult for Jamie to keep the stand well-stocked; for this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy beer, other drinks, snacks, and sweets, and to carry out renovations on the deteriorated premises, as the years and the weather have worn them down and he would like improve their appearance. 

Jaime's dream is to continue running his stand in order to enjoy and share the best years of his life with his neighbours.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of beers and liquors, and to renovate the deteriorated premises.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an assortment of merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Annaitherasa Shg - Thirulogi Group

texts.en:
Annaitherasa Self Help Group is managed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu, India.  They help people to improve their livelihood. Geetha (the lady who is standing with her hand raised) is the leader of the group. Four other women are part of this group from Thirulogi village, Tanjore district.

Geetha lives with her two children and husband, Manikanndan. Her husband is a farmer who works for daily wages. Geetha has previously taken loans from the PAT to improve her economic conditions and has repaid the loan on time.

Geetha and the other member of the group want to buy a smokeless stove to have a healthy life. The smokeless stove is economical and greatly reduces carbon emissions limiting the toxic and hazardous effects of indoor pollution.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Adaikalamatha Shg - Papanasam Group

texts.en:
A large number of people, especially in rural places in India, still use wood as the main source of heat for cooking, many of them using open fires. Open fires are not only inefficient, but they produce smoke, which is harmful to health and present a burn risk to children. The inefficiency of open fires results in large amounts of wood being burned, contributing to deforestation, and hard work for the women and children collecting it. 

For above reasons, women from “Adaikalamatha” Self-Help Group are planning to buy smokeless stoves. Among them Selvi (40) is a featured borrower of the group. She lives in Papanasam village in Tanjore District in Tamil Nadu. She is married and has three children. She has been taking loans from the local NGO PAT to improve her livelihood and has repaid the loans in installments on time.
 
Selvi, along with the other four members, is requesting a loan of INR 7,000 to buy a smokeless stove, which will help them to save money and time and keep their families healthier.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Malligaipoo Shg - Paniyur Group

texts.en:
Aburvam is the leader of a “Malligaipoo” Self-Help Group (SHG) managed by the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT), which provides microfinance loans. She has been receiving PAT’s support for the last four years.  

Aburvam is married to a farmer and is living in Paniyur, a small village in Tanjore District. She is 52 years old and has a child. Currently, Aburvam is using a firewood convention stove in her kitchen. Wood burning stoves get messy as the logs are burned and they turn into ashes that fill up the bottom of the wood burning stove and must be emptied regularly for safe use. If care is not taken when cleaning the ashes, they will get on the area around the stove, creating a mess. Aburvam has recently learned about the Greenway Smart Stove, a sustainable stove that reduces smoke emissions up to 80% resulting in better long-term health due to decreased inhalation. 

Her group hopes to take out a loan in order to buy this stove for the better livelihood of their families.

Aburvam and the other four members of the self help group are extremely excited about the possibility of saving on fuel and having less smoke emissions in their houses.

loans.use: to buy a sustainable stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: with one-time purchases like a television and remodeling of her business.

loans.name: Orlin Bladimir

texts.es:
El señor Orlin de 28  años de edad  es casado se dedica a la compra y venta de materiales para construcción desde hace dos años, antes era chofer y a su vez se dedicaba a entregar los materiales de construcción y ahora decidió trabajar propio.
Don Orlin  uno de sus patrones le financio unos de sus camiones con el cual trabajo y compro un segundo camión, es conocido por ser un hombre luchador y vive en una aldea de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.  
Don Orlin  está solicitando el préstamo  para compra  de materiales de construcción como ladrillos, bloques, cemento, arena, grava, etc. Y Con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo  desea salir adelante y seguir mejorando sus ingresos. 
Don Orlin  su sueño es  comprarse una volqueta  nueva.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2014
texts.en:
28 year-old Mr Orlin is married and has made a living for the last two years buying and selling construction materials. Before that, he was a driver and also made a living delivering construction materials; now, he has decided to work for himself.
An employer of Don Orlin paid for one of the trucks he uses for work. Don Orlin then bought a second truck. He is known for being a fighter, and he lives in the small town of San Lorenzo, in Southern Honduras.
Don Orlin is asking for a loan to buy construction materials such as bricks, blocks, cement, sand, gravel, etc. With the income and the support from this loan, he hopes to get ahead and continue to improve his revenue.
His dream is to buy himself a new dump truck.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2014

loans.use: to buy bricks, blocks, cement, sand, gravel, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Deisy  Yanira

texts.es: Deysi tiene una pequeña fáfriva de muñecos de felpa, ajuar para bebes y diversas artesanias que su creatividad la impulsa a desarrollar. Su negocio inició hace 10 años, , atendiendo a su otencialidad y aptitudes por las artes, que la llevaron a detenerse a observar a muchos artesanos que pasaron por su vida, Hoy con 40 años de edad le gusta mucho favricar adornos de navidad que son vendidos en todas las épocas del año pues gusta mucho a su clientela. Ella tambien fabrica pulseras, collares sillas decoradas etc trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche y sus principales clientes son profesores de los colegios amas de casa y en general jovenes que se acercan a ella para que les diseñe accesorios. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer fianciamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comrpará una máquina de coser, y materia primas como telas pellones lentejuelas etc, con el fin de fabricar los diseños que estén mas de moda para vender mas aumentando su productividad con ese nuevo activo fijo. Y justamente este sería el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Deisy has a small factory that produces stuffed toys, clothing and other items for babies, and various other crafts which her creativity drives her to make. She started her business 10 years ago, taking advantage of her gift and aptitude for the arts. This aptitude led her to stop and pay close attention to the many artists that she has encountered throughout her life. 

Today, Deisy is 40 years old and she loves creating Christmas decorations which she sells all year round, as her customers like them a lot. She also produces bracelets, necklaces, decorated chairs, etc. She works from 8 am till 7 pm. Her main customers are school teachers, housewives, and young people in general who ask her to design accessories. 

Deisy is currently requesting a Kiva loan, her first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo foundation. She will use the loan to buy a sewing machine, and raw materials such as fabrics, interfacing, sequins, etc, to produce the latest designs. This new fixed asset will increase her sales and productivity, which will be the successful outcome of her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, and raw materials such as fabrics, interfacing, sequins, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise including clothing, cosmetics, perfumes and jewelry.

loans.name: Yessica Amparo

texts.es:
Yessica, requiere de más capital para comprar variedad de ropa, pan, huevos, aceite, boquitas, dulces, galletas, bebidas, queso, crema, quesillo y otros productos básicos para que su inventario este más surtido y seguir generando ingresos para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Con el financiamiento anterior compro ropa, su situación económica es más estable permitiéndole aumentar la mercadería que ofrece a sus clientes. Actualmente Yessica está acompañada.
texts.en:
Yessica needs more capital to buy a variety of clothing, bread, eggs, oil, snacks, sweets, crackers, beverages, cheese, cream, fresh cheese, and other basic products so that her inventory will be better stocked and she can continue generating income to meet her obligations.

With the previous financing, she bought clothing. Her economic situation is more stable, allowing her to increase the merchandise that she offers her customers. Yessica is now in a relationship.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing, bread, eggs, oil, snacks, sweets, crackers, beverages, cheese, cream, fresh cheese, and other items.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino de 57 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, ya todos los hijos se independizaron, solo su esposa y una hija vive con ellos.

Paulino se dedica a la agricultura, trabajo que aprendió de su padre desde que era un pequeño y gracias a ello ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante. Él cultiva 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, y también siembra frijoles, el lugar del cultivo está a una distancia de 20 minutos de su vivienda.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para realizar la limpieza del terreno y lo restante será para comprar venenos,  abono y pago a los mozos, para realizar sus cultivos. 

Su sueño es salir adelante con los créditos, ya que con ello tendrá la oportunidad de trabajar para sacar adelante a su familia, darle una vida digna y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Paulino is 57 years old and studied through the second grade. He is married and his wife takes care of the household chores. All of his children are independent. Only his wife and a daughter live with him.

Paulino works in agriculture. He learned the trade at a young age from his father. Thanks to his training, Paulino has been able to help his family move forward. He cultivates 14,000 square meters of corn and is also planting beans. His crops are located on land that is located 20 minutes from his home.

The loan he is requesting from CrediCampo will be used to clear his land. The rest will be used to buy poisons, compost, as well as pay the workers so that his crops are maintained. His dream is to press forward with the help of the loans. This will give him the opportunity to work so that he can help his family get ahead, provide them a decent life, and improve his earnings.

loans.use: to pay workers to clear his land and to buy poisons and compost.

loans.name: Soniya

texts.ru: Женщину на фотографии зовут Сония. Ей 35 лет. Она разведена. От брака у нее осталось  двое сыновей. Старшему сыну 15 лет, младшему 13 лет. Сония с детьми живет у мамы. Мама Сонии домохозяйка, дети школьники. Поэтому доход в семью приносит только Сония. Она работает швеей у себя дома. Сония берет заказы на шитье национальной женской одежды. Данной деятельностью она занята более четырех лет. Соответственно гораздо больше лет Сония работает на этой швейной машинкой, которую Вы видите на фотографии. Машинка уже не наработает хорошо как прежде и это доставляет Сонии не удобства. Сония не имеет достаточной суммы, чтобы купить новую швейную машинку, поэтому обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: The woman in this picture is Soniya.  She is 35 years old and she is divorced with two sons, who are 15 and 13.  Soniya and her sons live with her mother, who is a homemaker, and her children are in school.  For this reason, Soniya is the only breadwinner in the family.  She works as a seamstress at home, taking commissions to sell women's national costumes.  She has been doing this for more than four years, and she has been working on the sewing machine you see in the picture for much longer.  The machine is not working as well as it used to and it is an inconvenience for Soniya.  She doesn't have enough money to buy a new sewing machine, which is why she is asking for a loan.

loans.use: to buy a new modern sewing machine

loans.name: Gulrakat

texts.ru: Гулракат еще не замужняя девушка в возрасте 33 лет. Она живет в маленьком городке Дангара вместе с матерью, братом и сестрой. Гулракат уже три года работает в центре обслуживания. Одновременно у себя дома она еще и занимается шитьем. Она любит это дело и сейчас хотела бы расширить его. Гулракат хочет сменить свою старую машинку, но для осуществления цели ей не хватает финансов. В связи с этим Гулракат обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить новую швейную машинку. Она надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Gulrakat is a woman of 33 who is not yet married.  She lives in the small town of Dangara with her mother, her brother and her sister.  For three years, Gulrakat has worked in a service center and she also sews from her home at the same time.  She loves to sew and now she wants to expand her business.  She wants to trade in her old sewing machine, but she doesn't have enough money to realize this goal.  For this reason, Gulrakat has asked for a loan to buy a new sewing machine.  She is counting on your support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Rocio Maribel

texts.es:
Rocío es una mujer de 33 años de edad casa, madre de dos hijos y su nuevo negocio es un taller de costura.
Ella es una mujer emprendedora, fuerte y luchadora; su éxito en los negocios la ha llevado a buscar nuevas actividades  para generar mejores ingresos económicos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, su trabajo lo realiza de lunes a sábado durante todo el día.
