Rocío es de tez morena estatura media y cabello obscuro, su negocio anterior es un kiosco donde vende dulces y galletas y ahora busca financiar su nuevo negocio; un taller de costura para diversificar sus actividades y competir en el mercado.
Es por esos motivos que Rocío solicita un préstamo para la apertura de un taller de costura y poder competir en el mercado.
texts.en:
Rocío is a 33-year-old woman who is a housewife and the mother of two children. Her new business is a sewing workshop.

Rocío is an enterprising, strong, and determined woman. Her success in business has led her to look for new activities for generating more income to improve her family’s quality of life. She works all day, Monday through Saturday.

Rocío has a tan complexion, medium height, and dark hair. Her previous business was a kiosk where she sold candy and cookies. Now she is looking to finance a new business, a sewing workshop that will diversify her activities and allow her to compete in the market. For these reasons, Rocío is requesting a loan so that she can open her sewing workshop and be able to gain a foothold in the market.

loans.use: to open her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Zulma Karolina

texts.es:
Zulma de 28 años de edad, tiene sus dos hijos, de 6 y 3 años de edad,  lo cual su primer hijo ya asiste a la escuela y el segundo todavía no ya que no tiene la edad.

 Zulma trabaja para mantener a sus hijos,  posee un puesto de venta de comida en el mercado junto a su mamá hace uno cinco años, ya adquirió su experiencia y conoce como es el movimiento que se debe seguir en el negocio.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar verduras, carnes, pollo, condimentos, para elaborar la comida que venderá en su puesto en el mercado.  

 Zulma  sueña en grande como extender su negocio y que alguna día pueda ser un puesto de comida muy reconocida por las personas, ademas tener muchos clientes
texts.en:
Zulma is 28 years old and has two children, ages 6 and 3. Her older child is in school and her younger child is not old enough to attend.

Zulma works in order to support her children. She has a vending stall at the market where she sells food with her mother. Zulma has been in this business for about five years. She has gained experience and is the driving force that keeps her business going.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy vegetables, meats, chicken, and condiments for preparing the food that she sells at her market stall. Zulma has big dreams, such as expanding her business and someday having a food stall that is well-known to the public. She also has many customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, chicken, and condiments.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Wonderful Kive Lenders! Meet Gilbert, 28 years of age, very honest, humble and a very hardworking person. He hails from the Litein area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile and has one of the best weather patterns on earth that favors farming. Gilbert is still single and has so much that he wants to achieve before starting a family; that is why he is focused and dreaming of being successful.

Gilbert never got the chance to go to college because of a lack of fees but this never killed the zeal that he had for succeeding and he started farming five years ago on a small plot of farm that he inherited from his parents. Through hard work he has managed to practice crop farming and animal farming and has managed to take care of his parents and also take care of his basic needs. Gilbert grows vegetables, fruits and keeps dairy cows as a source of income. Although Gilbert has been making profits, he has a challenge of timely delivery of products to the market and this has made his profits go down because goods reach the market when they are not fresh and hence fetch low prices.

Gilbert comes from an area that has poor feeder roads and this has been a major problem to him. That is why he is seeking a loan of KES 60,000 to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike, Gilbert will be able to transport his farm produce to the market and deliver it in a timely manner and hence it will fetch high prices. Vegetables, fruits and milk are perishable products and they require quick delivery to the market, so this motorbike will be so much help. Through timely delivery of his product, Gilbert is sure of increased profits and this will translate to better living conditions and a secure future.

Gilbert is very ambitious and he is planning that once he has accumulated more profits he will be able to go back to school and through education he will be able to have a more secure future because education is “the key to success”.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, es viuda y madre de dos hijos de 25 y 20 años de edad, el mayor trabajo y el menor estudia, no tiene ayuda de familiares para costear sus gastos y los de sus hijos; su negocio consiste en elaborar pan y salir a venderlo, sus labores inician de las cinco de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde.
Comprará harina, leña, levadura, maíz, crema, cuajada, leche, azúcar y otros ingredientes para elaborar la venta y mantener su negocio funcionando, espera tener una mayor productividad, mejorar las ventas e ingresos con los que podrá cancelar la deuda sin problemas.
Sus anhelos son ampliar su negocio, tener más utilidades, mejorar las circunstancias familiares y generar empleo en la panadería.
texts.en:
Teresa is a widow and mother of two sons, 25 and 20.  The older one works and the younger one studies.  She does not have the help of family members to cover her expenses and those of her sons.  Her business consists of making bread and going out to sell it.  She works from 5:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m.
She will buy flour, firewood, yeast, corn, cream, curds, milk, sugar, and other ingredients in order to make her sales products and keep her business going.  She hopes to have greater productivity and increase her sales and income with which she will be able to get rid of her debt without problems.
Her wishes are to expand her business, have more profits, improve her family circumstances, and generate employment in the bakery.

loans.use: to buy flour, firewood, yeast, corn, cream, curds, milk, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca, a microfinance member of PMPC, started a snack vending business from scratch and succeeded. She has mastered her skills and selling abilities and made her business sustainable. Recently, she wanted to increase her production. She applied for a loan to purchase raw ingredients and aims to double her profit. Francisca wants to save for life emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Marija

texts.en: Marija is the mother of two children at 26 years old and lives in a small minority community. She is employed in a clinic and her husband works in agriculture, planting corn and wheat on their land for personal use and selling. He also plants different vegetables during the various seasons. They are now in need of a loan in order to purchase a small tractor and trailer. With the loan he will be able to work on the land more efficiently and will be able to plant and harvest more of his products to sell, increasing their income and standard of living. They are very grateful for the support and want to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a small tractor and trailer

loans.name: Chuaxic Group

texts.es: Miguel tiene 32 años de edad (aparece en medio, viste playera blanca, suéter de rayas) vive en el municipio de Sololá, departamento de Sololá,  tiene una hija de un 1 año de edad, no asiste a la escuela porque todavía no tiene la edad escolar, Miguel es muy trabajador, lucha para que su familia tenga para cubrir sus necesidades básicas, Miguel se dedica a la agricultura a tiempo completo, cultiva cebolla, zanahoria y los vende en el mercado del municipio, él no pudo asistir a la escuela y aprovecho aprender de su papa y de amigos el manejo del cultivo de cebolla, su esposa se dedica a vender ropa típica y con las ganancias ayuda en los gastos de la familia, Miguel necesita un crédito para comprar insumos (abono químico, abono orgánico, semillas e insecticidas)  para el cultivo de cebolla, el sueño de Miguel es tener una casa de block y de losa.
texts.en:
Miguel is 32 years old. In the photo, he is seen wearing a white T-shirt and a striped jacket. He lives in the town of Sololá in the Department of Sololá. Miguel has a one-year-old daughter who is not in school because she has yet to reach school age.

Miguel is a hard worker who strives to help his family cover their basic needs. He works in agriculture full-time by cultivating onions and carrots and selling the produce at the municipal market. Miguel was not able to attend school, so he took advantage of the lessons he learned from his father and from his friends on how to manage an onion crop. His wife sells traditional clothing and her earnings help with the family expenses.

Miguel needs a loan in order to buy supplies for his onion crop such as chemical fertilizers, organic fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides. His dream is to have a block house that is built on a slab.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for his onion crop.

loans.name: Nyasha

texts.en:
Nyasha is a 20-year-old businesswoman who has been running a dressmaking business for the past year in the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. As a vibrant member of her community, Nyasha volunteers as a village health worker and also as a Learner Guide, growing life and study skills training among students when she is not working at her business. As a tailor, she produces school uniforms, as well as children’s and adult's clothing.

With the Kiva loan, Nyasha intends to purchase dressmaking materials so that she can continue to supply clothing for members of her community. Nyasha also hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more material for dressmaking

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase the number of broiler chickens she raises and to buy vaccines for the broilers.

loans.name: Ilirjana

texts.en:
Ilirjana is a 27-year-old Ashkali woman. She is the mother of four children, one boy and three girls. She is a housewife. Her husband works cleaning roads for a public company and earns a very low salary. 

The home they live in needs some improvements to give them better living conditions, so Ilirjana would like a loan to renovate the house. 

She is very happy for this opportunity and wants to thank all the lenders for their support. She promises to pay the loan back on time.

loans.use: To renovate the house she lives in with her family.

loans.name: Amalia Ambrocia

texts.es:
Amalia es una mujer de 54 años de edad casada y madre de un hijo, su negocio es la venta de ropa.
Ella es de carácter amable, le gusta hacer buena amistad con sus clientes y es muy ordenada en su trabajo, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la ciudad de ‘El Alto’ a más de cuatro mil metros sobre el nivel del mar y  distante a 30 minutos en auto de la ciudad capital.
Amalia es de tez morena cabello negro ojos negros y de baja estatura, su trabajo lo realiza de lunes a domingo desde las nueve de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche. Su negocio tiene necesidades de temporada como la compra de ropa por cambio de estación, ella desea mejorar su negocio para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Es por esos motivos que Amalia solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor y con los beneficios mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Amalia is 54 years old, and she is married with one child. Her business is selling clothing. She has a friendly nature, and she likes to become good friends with her customers. She is very organized in her work. Her business is located in the city of El Alto, which is more than four thousand meters above sea level and thirty minute’s distance by car from the capital city.  

Amalia is petite, with tan skin, black hair and black eyes. She carries out her work from Monday to Sunday, from nine in the morning until nine at night.  Her business has seasonal needs, such as clothing to be purchased for the change of seasons. 

She wants to improve her business in order to give her family a better quality of life, and that is why she is seeking a loan.  It is for the purchase of wholesale clothing, and with the profits, she will improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale clothing, and with the profits, improve her family's quality of life.

loans.name: Murugan Shg - Malaiyappanallur Group

texts.en:
Vinitha is the leader of the Murugan Self-Help Group (SHG) managed by the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT). 

Vinitha is married and living in Malaiyappanallur, a small village in Tanjore District. She is 33 years old and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter.

Vinitha has recently learned about the Greenway Smart Stove, a sustainable stove that reduces smoke emissions up to 70%, resulting in better long- term health due to decreased inhalation of poisonous gas.

Vinitha and the other six members are requesting a loan to buy this stove to give a healthier life to their families. They are extremely excited about the possibility of saving on fuel and having less smoke emissions in their houses.

loans.use: to buy a sustainable stove

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 43 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Gilda works very hard to provide for them.

Gilda's business and family home was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Gilda has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Gilda has taken a PHP 8707.10 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Gilda is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline lives in the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. She is 25, married and has three childen. She started her poultry and gardening business in 2008 selling green vegetables, tomatoes, butternuts and chickens. She opened her business to become financially stable and provide for her family. She volunteers her time in her community with her local secondary school as a Learner Guide offering life skills and counseling sessions to students. 
With a loan through Kiva, Pauline would like to build a fowl run so that she can change from Rhodes Island chickens to broilers. She will also buy seeds and fertilizer for her garden and increase sales of product from her garden.

loans.use: to build a fowl run so that she can change from Rhodes Island chickens to broilers. She will also buy seeds and fertilizer for her garden and increase sales of product from her garden.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe has maintained discipline, attention and focus in running her sari-sari store business. She has constantly sought financial help from PMPC as a microfinance member. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase basic commodities intended for resale. In the future, she hopes to mount another store outlet to cater to more customers.

loans.use: to purchase basic commodities to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods for his grocery store to meet the needs of his customers.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn owns and operates a farm - planting and harvesting rice for sale - to earn a living. She's been farming for many years and it sustains her family's living. She plans to use the additional profit generated from her farm to improve and expand her business. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer in order to gain more return for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is thankful for the financial assistance previously extended to her, as she was able to buy more products for her variety store. The loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her child, who is in college.

Her income from her business assists the family with its everyday household expenditures. Her husband helps her generate income for their family. 

Milagros has been in this business for more than 10 years. She would like to apply for another loan, of 50,000 Phillipine pesos, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Milagros hopes that her business will last longer and dreams of buying a vehicle. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. There, she can also draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 34-year-old woman who is married with three children and is currently living in the Mount Darwin District of Zimbabwe. As a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide, she teaches life and study skills to students in a community school.

Over the last year, Caroline has grown her piggery business to its current capacity – producing about seven pigs every six weeks and selling them to local residents and butcheries. She began her business because she knew it would be profitable in her community and she wanted to become financially independent. Caroline would like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use the Kiva loan to enlarge the pig house so that she will be able to increase production. Caroline hopes that the loan will enable her to increase her profits and remain financially independent.

loans.use: to build a bigger pig house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and supplies for her store.

loans.name: Sadat

texts.en:
Sadat is married and the father of five children: four boys and one girl between the ages of five and eight years old. They all live in a small village in the southern part of Kosovo. 

Sadat provides the main source of income for his family. He works as a painter for homes and businesses. This period of time is very busy for him, because a lot of people paint their homes during the spring-summer season. 

Sadat would like to earn even more income for his family and is requesting a loan to purchase a milk cow. He will use the milk products for his family, to cut expenses, and also to sell in the neighborhood. His goal is to be able to add more cows and expand into a farm. 

He promises to repay this loan on time and wants to thank all the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Marbel

texts.es: Marbel tiene 27 años de edad y habita con su cónyuge y su hijo de dos años de edad en la ciudad de Barranquilla. Allí se dedica al comercio en general desde hace 4 años, desde que decidió seguir los pasos de su tia, quien viajaba al vecino país en busca de oportunidades de compra a precios competitivos, para ofrecer a una clientela que poco a poco construyó y que hoy son sus mejores compradores. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y recupera su capital invertido diariamente, para posteriormente comprar de contado, lo que nuevos clientes le solicitan. En la actualidad Marbel está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiameinto que hace a la Fundación mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará Vestuario, útiles de aseo personal y calzado. Con este dinero tendrá la opotunidad de comprar mas mercancia obtener mas ganancias al venderlas, e incrmentar su capital d etrabajo, lo cual corresponde a un éxito para Kiva.
texts.en: Marbel is 27 years old. She lives with her spouse and her two-year-old son in the city of Barranquilla. In Barranquilla she was dedicated to working in general sales for four years until she decided to follow the footsteps of her aunt. Her aunt traveled to a neighboring country in search of opportunities to purchase items at competitive prices to offer to her clients who she gained little by little and who today are her best purchasers. Marbel completes her sales on credit and subsequently recovers the capital she invests on a daily basis so that she can buy what her new clients seek in cash. Currently, Marbel is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing made through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation which she will use to purchase clothing, personal hygiene supplies and shoes. With this money she will have the opportunity to purchase more merchandise, to obtain more profits selling them, and increase her working capital which will result in a success for Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, person hygiene supplies and shoes.

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Créer depuis  son inauguration le 15 Mai 2008, le banc villageois est composé femmes qui habitent le même quartier et partagent un objectif commun mener des activités de petit commerce afin d’être utile à leur famille respective. Elles jouissent de plus de cinq années d’expérience dans le programme. Elles font comme activité secondaire l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Awa (assise à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans, est mariée et mère de 02 filles. C’est une dame très enthousiaste dans son commerce qui tourne autour de la vente de produits de la cueillette : balaie, pomme de liane et autres ou de fabrications traditionnelles telles que le savon et l’huile de palme. Elle jouit  d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 02 sacs de savon à 15 000 Fr CFA l’un et un lot de balaie pour la revente au détail à 150 Fr CFA le tas.

Les revenus de son activité lui permettront de mieux aider son mari en prenant en charge totalement ou partiellement les frais sanitaires ou scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
Created and inaugurated on May 15, 2008, this Banc Villageois consists of women who live in the same neighborhood and who share a common goal of practicing small trade activities in order to help support their respective families. They boast over 5 years of experience with the program. Their secondary activity is rain-fed farming. 

Mrs. Awa (sitting on the right and raising her hand) is the featured borrower for this group. Age 48, she is married with 2 daugthers. She is very enthusiastic about her activity, which revolves around the sale of wild plant products such as brooms, passion fruit and others, or items made from traditional processes such as soap and palm oil. She has extensive experience in this activity. 

She will use this new loan to buy 2 bags of soap at 15,000 FCFA each, and a bundle of brooms at 150 FCFA to retail. 

The revenue earned through this activity will allow her to better help her husband by taking over part or all of the children’s healthcare and school expenses.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of soap at 15,000 FCFA each, and a bundle of brooms at 150 FCFA to retail.

loans.name: Karina Marleny

texts.es: Karina de 30 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que gracias a su visión ha logrado sacar adelante su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa en el cual tiene a disposición de su clientela una gran variedad de prendas de vestir como puede observarse en la fotografía. Karina desea seguir mejorando su negocio, para ello, necesita comprar una vitrina para mostrar mejor sus productos, y seguir invirtiendo en mercadería para seguir teniendo la variedad que caracteriza a su pequeño negocio. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en compra de la  vitrina para mostrar las prendas de vestir de su negocio y comprar más mercadería.
texts.en: Karina is 30 years old and she lives with her husband and two children who are 4 and 2 years old. She is an entrepreneurial woman who, thanks to her vision, has gotten ahead with her small business selling clothes. As you can see in the above photo, her business makes a wide variety of clothing available to her customers. Karina desires to continue improving her business. To accomplish this she needs to purchase a showcase to better display her products and to continue investing in merchandise to maintain the variety that characterizes her small business. Based on this goal she is seeking this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of a showcase to display the clothing from her business and to purchase more merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase a showcase to display the clothing from her business and to purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Cristela Jeanneth

texts.es:
Cristela, ha tenido que salir adelante sola con tres hijos, es madre soltera, vive con sus hijos de 18, 17 y 15 años de edad; su actividad económica es cultivar maíz y frijol, con lo que alimenta a su familia y vende el resto para tener ingresos y costear los gastos de su hogar, es un oficio que aprendió de sus padres y la apoyan sus hijos, su horario de trabajo es de siete de la mañana a una de la tarde, por el momento no presenta ninguna dificultad.
El crédito le servirá para realizar la compra de insecticidas, herbicidas, plaguicidas, abono y semilla, son materiales importantes para mejorar su negocio, aumentar su producción y tener ingresos extras para mejorar su situación económica.
Sus sueños son tener recursos económicos con los que pueda dar a sus hijos un mejor estilo de vida y apoyarlos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Cristela has had to raise her three children alone. She is a single mother who lives with her children aged 18, 17 and 15 years old. Her economic activity is growing corn and beans, with which she feeds her family. She sells the excess to have income and pay for the household expenses. She learned this activity from her parents and her children help her. Her timetable is from 7 in the morning until one in the afternoon and at this time she has no problems.

The loan will help her to buy insecticides, herbicides, pesticides, fertilizer ans seeds. These are important materials to improve her business, increase her production and have more income to improve her financial situation. Her dream is to have the economic resources to provide a better quality of living for her children and to support their studies.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, herbicide, pesticides, fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Lilian Suyapa

texts.es:
Lilian de 31 años de edad, es una persona con excelentes principios, los que la han puesto en alto en su comunidad, una mujer muy luchadora, dedicada y responsable en el cuido de su familia, ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su hogar además todo los días por la mañana hace una venta de golosinas para vender en la unidad de salud de su municipio desde hace más de 5 años; ella vende yuca frita,  enchiladas y refrescos, y los fines de semana hace pupusas para vender, ella creció junto a sus padres quienes son  personas muy humildes y trabajadores que también se dedican a la venta de golosinas tradicionales, su familia es de muy escasos recursos económicos por ello ella no cuenta con formación académica.  Eran 3 hermanos siendo ella la menor de todos a quien le correspondía ayudar en los quehaceres del hogar,  ya que sus otros dos hermanos ya son independientes y viven en otro municipio aledaño a su familia por esa razón se le hizo difícil completar sus estudios de educación media alcanzando únicamente hasta 3°grado, trascurrió el tiempo y con ánimos de su madre comenzó a vender en la clínica que está cerca de su casa. 

El dinero será utilizado para la compra de una estufa y material para elaborar las golosinas y compra de una plancha  para hacer pupusas,  ya que la que tienen ya se encuentra muy deteriorada y necesitan una nueva para continuar sus actividades laborales e invertir en mejorar del techo de su casa.

Las sueños y metas para un futuro son las de haber terminado de pagar el préstamo y hacer una nueva solicitud para montar una venta de pizza en el pueblo, ya que se encuentra asistiendo a un curso de formación de pan y pizza  que funcione de lunes a viernes, esto lo hará con ayuda de su hermana.
texts.en:
Lilian is 31 years old. She is a person with excellent principles and she has been raised high in her community. She is a dedicated and responsible woman who is a fighter and who cares for her family. She does the housework and in addition every morning she has gone to sell snacks at the city health unit for more than 5 years. She sells fried yucca, enchiladas and beverages. On the weekends she makes pupusas to sell. She was raised with her parents, who are humble and hardworking people who also sell traditional foods. Her family is very low income and that is why she has no schooling. They were three siblings and she is the youngest and she helped with the housework since her two siblings were on their own. They live in a different town from the where she lives with her family. For this reason, it was difficult for her to finish her education, and she only went through the 3rd grade. Time passed and because she is a mother, she started to sell at the clinic close to her house.

The money will be used to buy a stove and materials to make the snacks and to buy a press to make pupusas. The one she has is very deteriorated and she needs a new one to continue with her work activities. She will also invest in improving the roof on her home. 

Her dreams and her goals for the future are to finish paying off the loan and to make a new application so she can open a pizzeria in town open Monday through Friday. She will do it with her sister's help.

loans.use: to buy a stove and material to make snacks as well as to buy a press to make pupusas, because the one she has has deteriorated and she needs a new one to continue with her work activity. She will also invest in improving the roof on her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a tortilla grill and buy sweets, pastries, soup, detergent, cereal, etc. for his store.

loans.name: Frediy

texts.es: El señor Frediy es soltero, actualmente vive en Entre rios en la casa de su tio abuelo, en su patrimonio urbano no tiene cuartos construidos solo se encuentra el terreno. Actualmente se dedica a la agricultura, produciendo yuca,  realiza una venta promedio anual de 600 quintales, en 1 1/2 hectárea, mencionar que los trabajos se dan bajo contrato privado,lamentablemente sus ingresos bajaron debido a los cambios climatologicos, plagas y el bajo costo de sus productos, por ello solicita un credito para el mantenimiento de yuca porque actualmente los costos para el mantenimiento y aplicacion de insumos quimicos subieron, de esta forma mejorara su produccion y tendra mayores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Frediy is single. Right now he lives in Entre Rios in his great uncle's house. In his property, he doesn't have any rooms built and only has the land. He is a farmer and grows yucca. He sells an average of 600 quintals a year from 1 1/2 hectares. He says that the work is done under private contract. Unfortunately, his income went down due to weather changes, pests and low prices on his products. That is why he is asking for a loan to do maintenance on the  yucca crop because right now the maintenance and chemical application costs went up. This way, production will improve and he will have more income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his yucca crop.

loans.name: Ana Felipa

texts.es:
Ana, es promotora de salud voluntaria, trabaja en su comunidad capacitando a sus vecinos en temas de salud preventiva y planificación familiar, para tener ingreso se dedica a vender medicina química; ella es casada, con su esposo se esfuerzan para cubrir las necesidades de sus tres hijos, los cuales se encuentran estudiando primaria.
El préstamo que requiere será de mucha utilidad para comprar antibióticos, analgésicos, vitaminas, jeringas, pomadas, etc., tendrá a su disposición todo lo necesario para atender a sus clientes y satisfacer sus necesidades, espera mejorar las ventas e ingresos con los que aportara a los gastos de su hogar y resarcirá su deuda.
Se anhelo es seguir fortaleciendo su negocio y continuar aportando al buen desarrollo de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Ana is a volunteer health promoter. She works in her community training her neighbors on the subjects of preventative healthcare and family planning. In order to earn money, she sells medicine. She is married, with a husband who works to cover the expenses of their three children who are in primary school. 

The loan will be utilized to buy antibiotics, painkillers, vitamins, syringes, ointments, etc. so she will have everything that she needs to attend to her clients and meet their needs. She hopes to improve her sales and income so she can help with household expenses and repay the debt. She dreams of strengthening her business and continuing to support the development of her community.

loans.use: to buy antibiotics, painkillers, vitamins, syringes, ointments, etc.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana, ha progresado con la ayuda del financiamiento anterior surtió el inventario de su tienda con los productos que sus clientes buscan día con día, su nueva situación económica le ha permitido cancelar sus deudas y cubrir los gastos de su hogar, su familia tiene un mejor estilo de vida.
Opta por un nuevo préstamo para comprar aceite, detergentes, jabón, huevos, azúcar, sal, arroz, frijol, bolsas y bebidas así continuara trabajando y ampliado su negocio para mantener su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Ana has progressed with the help of the previous loan. She increased the inventory in her store with the products that her customers look for day to day. Her new financial situation has allowed her to pay off her debts and cover her household expenses and her family has a better quality of life. 

She has decided on a new loan to buy oil, detergent, soap, eggs, salt, rice, beans, bags and beverages. She will continue working and expanding her business to maintain her financial stability.

loans.use: to buy oil, detergent, soap, eggs, sugar, salt, rice, beans, bags and beverages.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo como ropa, accesorios, artículos de belleza y elementos para el hogar, estos productos los vende principalmente a amigos, vecinos y familiares.
Desde siempre se ha dedicado al comercio como única fuente de ingresos para su familia, por lo que hoy en día tiene grandes habilidades en este campo gracias a su simpatía y excelente calidad de servicio.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía variada para aumentar su inventario.
Esto le permitirá atender a sus clientes de una mejor manera y aumentara sus ventas de una manera significativa.
Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos.
texts.en:
Claudia is an enterprising woman who has much desire to get ahead. For the past 6 years she has been working selling products from catalogs like clothing, accessories, beauty products and household items. She sells these things mainly to her friends, neighbors and family. She has always been in business as this is the only source of income for her family. So today she has great skill in this field thanks to her friendliness and excellent quality of service.

Claudia is requesting a loan to buy a variety of merchandise to increase her inventory. This will allow her to serve her clients better and increase her sales in a significant manner. She hopes to be able to get ahead thanks to the help of people with good hearts that support this kind of project.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her business.

loans.name: Staa

texts.en:
Staa is a 19-year-old businesswoman in the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a flea market for the past six months. There, she sells trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, slippers, and shoes. Staa is also a volunteer Learner Guide who has committed to teaching life skills to local schoolchildren every week.

With the requested loan, Staa intends to make bulk purchases of trousers, shirts, skirts, and dresses to reduce costs and boost her sales and profits. She hopes to be financially stable and support her family.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Kerita

texts.en: Kerita is 38 years old and married. She has four children. As a Camfed volunteer Learner Guide, she teaches life skills in a local school, in the district of Mt Darwin in Zimbabwe. Improving the well-being of the young students is important to her. Kerita is a businesswoman as well. She sells dresses, blouses, skirts and jerseys, door-to-door. She has been running this mobile market for one year now, and it has enabled her to support her family. With the Kiva loan, Kerita will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own stall at the local flea market. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes, bags and shoes

loans.name: Kudakwashe Predominant

texts.en:
Kudakwashe is a 22-year-old mother from Mt. Darwin District of Zimbabwe. She serves as a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide. In that capacity, she teaches life skills education in local schools, to improve the well-being of the students.

For work, Kudakwashe used to travel around the community selling clothes, but now her business has expanded into a flea market. There, she is selling bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, t-shirts, and cosmetics. With the Kiva loan, Kudakwashe will purchase more products to increase her supplies, and therefore increase sales. She would like to have a better life and dreams of opening a chain of businesses, so that she can be a leader of economic growth in her district. She is also focused on giving her child the best that life has to offer.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Fredy Roberto

texts.es:
Fredy, es soltero, vive con su madre a quien le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, siendo empleado aprendió todo lo relacionado con la crianza y comercialización de ganado, su negocio está funcionando desde hace 4 años, lo hace en un horario de cuatro de la mañana a seis de la tarde.
Necesita el préstamo para comprar tres vacas, con lo que espera mejorar la producción de leche para elaborar lácteos que venderá entre sus vecinos y aumentara las cabezas de ganado para luego venderlo y tener nuevos ingresos con los que cancelara su deuda y apoyara a su madre.
Sus aspiraciones son crecer con su negocio, comprar un vehículo y un terreno para realizar sus actividades de una mejor forma.
texts.en:
Fredy, who is single, lives with his mother, helping her support the household.   As an employee he learned all about raising and selling cattle. He has been running his business for four years.  Fredy does this on a schedule beginning at 4AM and ending at 6 in the afternoon.

 He needs the loan to buy three cows, hoping to improve milk production and prepare dairy products to sell to his neighbors.  He will increase the number  of cattle he raises to sell.  This will gave him new income with which he can pay off his debt and support his mother.  Fredy aspires to grow with his business, and to buy a vehicle and a piece of land land to better carry out his work.

loans.use: to buy three cows

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en: Mavzuna is 32 years old. She is married and has three non-adult children. Mavzuna’s husband is a driver. His income is not enough for providing the children with all necessary things. So, Mavzuna also works every day, to earn a living. She has been busy with sewing. She sews national women's dresses. Mavzuna has been busy with this business more than 10 years. She serves her clients in a workshop. Her workshop is located in the center of her region. She is going to buy a new sewing machine, because she needs a new sewing machine. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy the sewing machine. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Abrigen

texts.en: Abrigen has carefully taken alternatives to earn more profits. She ventured into buying and selling whole nuts. She finds it comfortable to conduct the business; all she needs to do is to contact suppliers. Recently, Abrigen approached PMPC for the needed capital to purchase more whole nuts to sell. Abrigen hopes to triple her income this time, with the infusion of additional capital.

loans.use: to purchase more whole nuts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients, chairs, tables and a grill

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, desde niño aprendió de su padre a trabajar en el campo sembrando granos básicos, ya siendo un adulto lo tomo como una actividad para tener ingresos con los que costea los gastos de su hogar, su negocio tiene 20 años de estar funcionando, su horario es de 7:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m.; vive con su esposa e hijos, don Miguel se esmera por cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia ya que todos son dependientes.
El capital lo necesita para comprar abono, semilla, herbicidas, insecticidas y plaguicidas, con los que fácilmente prepara el terreno para seguir cultivando y protegerá los cultivos de plagas, espera que la producción sea mayor para abastecer a su familia y poder comercializar otra parte.
Sus sueños son tener mejores ingresos con los dará a su familia una vida más digna y cancelara la deuda adquirida.
texts.en:
Miguel learned farming from his father when he was very young, sowing basic grains. As an adult, he chose this occupation in order to have an income to cover his household expenses. His business has been operating for 20 years, and his schedule is from 7:00 A.M. until 3:00 P.M. He lives with his wife and children.  Don Miguel strives to cover the basic needs of his family, as they all depend upon him.

He needs the capital to purchase compost, seed, herbicide, insecticide, and pesticide. With them, he can easily prepare the land in order to continue planting, and he will protect his crops from pests. He hopes that his production will be higher, so that he can provide for his family and sell the other part. 

His dreams are to have better earnings with which he will give his family a more dignified life and pay off his debt.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seed, herbicide, insecticide, and pesticide.

loans.name: Lindiwe

texts.en:
Lindiwe is a 25-year-old married mother of one. She resides in the Mt Darwin District of Zimbabwe where she volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at the nearby school and assists the elderly in her community with household chores. In addition, Lindiwe rents a table at the local flea market to sell baby clothes, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family. 

With the Kiva loan, Lindiwe will purchase more clothes to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy owns and manages a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale and family consumption. She has been doing this work for more than three years, earning enough to sustain their needs. Juvy has had her photo taken with her vehicle that is used to transport their farm products. 

In order to purchase fertilizer, she has borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro-credit where she has been a member since 2013.  She hopes to have an abundant harvest in order to generate additional income for the purpose of renovating her house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cartons of rice, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more scrap and recyclable materials needed in her business. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in her children's education. Her income from the business is assisting with their everyday household expenditures. Her husband is helping her to generate income for their family.

Agustina would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy scrap and recyclable materials needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and her children's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Agustina hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for scrap and recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes and shoes

loans.name: Muthukaliamman Shg - Kalyanapuram Group

texts.en:
Navamani is the leader of the Muthukaliamman Self Help Group, which is managed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu, India. Navamani lives in Kalyanapuram village, Tanjore district. Navamani and her family live in their own house. Her husband is a farmer. 

The traditional mud stove is very inefficient, emits a lot of smoke and pollutes the air inside the home, which leads to a lot of health problems as well as soot that blackens the walls of the house. Wood burning leads to environmental pollution. 

Navamani and the other four members of the Muthukaliamman Self Help Group have taken loans from PAT before for improving their livelihoods. They all are now seeking a loan to purchase a smokeless stove, which is more efficient, sustainable, durable and designed for the daily use.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda is a 20-year-old woman from the Mt. Darwin District of Zimbabwe.

She is a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school, where she facilitates sessions on life skills. Matilda also helps with the general cleaning of the community hospital. Furthermore, Matilda is operating a rented stall at the local flea market, where she sells shoes, dresses, skirts, t-shirts, and jackets. She started the business from the small savings she received from her father.

With the requested loan proceeds, Matilda would like to purchase shoes, dresses, skirts, t-shirts, and jackets in bulk to reduce transportation costs and meet the demand of her customers. Her greatest hope is to expand her business into a large shop, though she would also like to use her profits to further her education.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional clothes and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to earn a BA degree by covering his university fees for the semester

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a 43-year-old married woman. She and her husband are blessed with three children.

She operates a direct-sales business in their village. She has been in this line of business for almost two years and earns a net income of approximately 3,500 PHP per month. She explains that her net income is usually spent on her children's school fees.

Due to insufficient capital, she is now seeking to secure a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to purchase goods such as lipstick, lingerie, bags, umbrellas, and colognes to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable in the future.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional goods (e.g., lipstick, lingerie, bags, umbrellas, and colognes) for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por tres socias laboriosas y coordinado por la señora María Rebeca de 32 años de edad, acompañada y madre de tres hijos quienes son motivos de superación, se dedica a la comercialización de frutas y verduras en el mercado de la municipalidad, se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace siete años, y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosecha de aguacate y tamarindo, ya que estas son las frutas que más demanda están teniendo por parte de la población. Otra de las socias es la señora Flor de María de 44 anos de edad, quien se dedica a la comercialización de frutas en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace diez años, y la señora María Auxiliadora la cual se dedica a comercializar gallinas en la ciudad de León desde hace diez años.
texts.en:
The communal bank is made up of three hard-working members. Maria Rebeca is the coordinator. She is 32 years old, in a relationship, and  mother of three children who are her reasons for personal growth. 

For seven years now, she has made a living selling fruits and vegetables in the municipal market. She requests the loan to buy avocado and tamarind harvests, since these are the fruits most in demand by the population.

Flor de Maria, 44 years old, is another member. She has made a living selling fruits in the municipal market for 10 years now.

And Maria Auxiliadora, for 10 years now, has made a living selling hens in the city of León.

loans.use: To buy avocado and tamarind harvests.

loans.name: Buena Amistad Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BUENA AMISTAD” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Teresa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de golosinas, venta de condimentos, venta de jugos, venta de chinelas, venta de libros, tejido en macramé, venta de CD’s, venta de busos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Teresa es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una campaña de promoción de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de prendas a macramé; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años de sus amigas, quienes trabajaban con la misma técnica en sus negocios. 
 El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Buena Amistad [Close Friendship] communal bank will begin its first loan cycle at Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana [Panamerican Regional Center]. It is made up of eight members and lead by a board of directors where Teresa is the president. The businesses which the members of the communal bank carry on with are varied. Amongst them are: sale of sweets, sale of condiments, sale of juices, sale of slippers, sale of books, woven macramé, sale of CDs and the sale of sweatshirts.

The loan will benefit micro businesses where Teresa is a member. She has been a part of Pro Mujer for ten years, joining at the invitation of a promotional campaign by the institution. She currently has a business weaving macramé garments. She launched this business several years ago with her friends who work with the same techniques in their businesses.

The loan she will now take out is to augment her capital (purchase of wool wholesale) which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto. After processing it she will sell it from her vendors stall. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family since she has two children and lives with her partner. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she responds that she likes the health center services which the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the number of chickens she will produce.

loans.name: Chipo

texts.en: Chipo is a 21-year-old businesswoman from the Mt. Darwin District of Zimbabwe. She is a hairdresser who is operating a home-based salon using the experience that she gained when she was still in school. Chipo is also a Camfed Learner Guide in her spare time. In this role, she has committed to leading life skills sessions at the local secondary school each week that school is in session. Chipo will use her Kiva loan to buy hair care products and salon accessories such as hair dryers, rollers, and combs. She has big hopes of building her community and becoming economically independent.

loans.use: to buy hair care products and salon accessories

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es un hombre de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, por la falta de motivación y exigencia de sus padres no continúo la escuela, ya que su padre le decía que de la escuela nadie comía. Está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a hacer los oficios del hogar también es la que se encarga del cuidado de los niños. Tienen dos hijos el mayor tiene 5 años que asiste a parvularia, la niña aun no asiste a la escuela, debido a que solo tiene 2 años de edad.

Él  se dedica a la agricultura, ya tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a la actividad productiva, su padre por medio de las correcciones que le hacía fue como lo hizo que fuera una persona de bien para la sociedad, le enseño a trabajar y ser un hombre responsable por lo que hoy en día eso le ha ayudado en su vida. 

Mercedes ha sido un hombre responsable, ha criado a sus 2 hijos responsablemente; el trabajo le queda a unos dos kilómetros de distancia, el recorrido lo hace a pie, nadie más se dedica a la actividad, y su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 10:00 am.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de insumos agrícolas entre ellos abono, herbicida, pago de mano de obra a quienes les ayudan a realizar sus trabajos. 

Desea tener primero lo más necesario para la familia, que sus hijos estudien y se preparen, por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida, el préstamo le ayudara en satisfacer la necesidad de poder realizar sus trabajos con el que le da la sostenibilidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a 37 year old man who completed up to the 2nd grade, but then because of a lack of motivation or demand from his parents he did not continue going to school. His father used to tell him that none of the school students eat. Accompanying Mercedes, his spouse dedicates herself to housework and also takes charge of raising the children. They have two children, the oldest is 5 years old and goes to kindergarten; the daughter still does not attend school because she is only 2 years old.

Mercedes earns a living through farming, and already has spent more than 20 years working in agriculture. His father, through lessons, made him what he is today, good person for society, taught him how to work and be a responsible man, and this has helped him in his life.  

Mercedes has been a responsible man and he has raised his 2 children responsibly. His work is located about 2 kilometers away, a journey he makes on foot. No one is more dedicated to the work, his work schedule is from 6:00 am to 10:00 am. 

The loan will be invested in the buying of agricultural components, among them fertilizer, weed-killer, and paying for the labor of those who help him complete his work.  

He desires first to have what is most necessary for his family, that his children study and prepare. What he hopes is to work always while God blesses him with health and life. The loan will help him satisfy the need to be able to complete his work, with which he provides sustainability for his family.

loans.use: to buy  fertilizer, weed-killer, and pay for the labor of those who help him complete his work.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia is a 37-year-old married mother of four from the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school, and she also volunteers in her community by cleaning and assisting the elderly. Additionally, Olivia operates a poultry business from her homestead and sells the chickens in the local community. She started the business with a batch of 30 and has grown to a capacity of 100 broiler chickens every six weeks. She has been able to support herself and her family using the proceeds from the business. With her Kiva loan, Olivia intends to increase the number of broilers per batch to 200 and also buy vaccines for them. The profits will help in the upkeep of her family as well as assist in the payment of her further education fees.

loans.use: To increase the number of broilers per batch to 200 and to buy vaccines for them.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products needed in her business. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from her business is assisting her family's everyday household needs. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan for her to pay for more vegetables and varieties of fish needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Cleofe hopes to have her own stall in the market and dreams that her whole family will always be in good condition. She meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more vegetables and varieties of fish needed in her business.

loans.name: Maa Thakurani Group

texts.en: Kunti is 26 years old and married with two children. She hails from a remote rural village named Phursund in Nuapada district in Odisha, India. Phursund village is located in one of the most underdeveloped area of Odisha state. Most of the people of this area depend upon cultivation and petty businesses for their livelihood. The lady sitting on the extreme left with her hand raised in the photograph is Kunti. She is a very active and headstrong lady. She lives with her husband and children in a small mud house. She earns a living by selling animals like buffaloes, bullocks and goats in markets with her husband. The income of 4,000 INR per month that she gets from her existing business is not sufficient for maintaining her family. So she was in search of a credit source for the expansion of her business. When Mahashakti Foundation started intervention in her village in April 2014, Kunti organized 11 other women members of her village with similar backgrounds and formed a Self Help Group (SHG) named Maa Thakurani to take a loan. From this loan of 16,000 INR, she wants to purchase more numbers of bullocks, buffalo and goats to sell. As this is the cultivation season and people are in search of bullock and buffalo for cultivation purpose, she hopes that this will help her to earn some extra income to manage her expenses smoothly. In the long run, with her small savings, she hopes to fulfill her dream of repairing her house and purchase some gold. Among the other 11 members of the SHG, six are doing an animal-selling business, three are doing vegetable vending and two members have general store businesses.

loans.use: To purchase bullocks, buffalos and goats to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Zosimo

texts.en: Due to financial hardship, Zosimo is engaged in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. He aimed to uplift his status of living and give his family a better life. He planned to expand his piggery and acquire more pigs to raise but he has insufficient capital. For this reason, he wants to access financial assistance of PHP 25,000 from Kiva lenders through ASKI to buy hog feed, vitamins, additional pigs and materials needed to improve the pigpen. Being a patient and industrious father, he hopes that someday, he will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, additional pigs and materials needed to improve the pigpen

loans.name: Jessel

texts.en: Jessel lives in Zamboanga del Sur with her family. She runs a general store selling goods in the local community to earn a living. She started it more than ten years ago. She earns well from the business and was able to sustain it. The business is running well and, to offer more goods, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy more goods to sell. She plans to expand her store in order to gain more income for the family needs.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products for her variety store. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting her family's everyday household expenditures. Her husband is helping her generate income for their family.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Arlene dreams that her business will grow bigger and have more products. She hopes that her family is always in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is a 20-year-old woman from the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers every week as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills to high school students. Melody also rents a table at the local flea market where she sells bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts. She has been running her business since last year and it has enabled her to support her family. 

With the Kiva loan, Melody will purchase more clothing supplies for her business. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to change her family’s status and finances.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing supplies for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 39 years old and blessed with four children attending school. Despite the hardship of living, she and her husband wants to educate their children so that they will become professionals in the future. 

With this regard, she aims to improve her small retail store to earn a higher income to support the education of her children. Having inadequate capital, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 25,000.00 to buy more stocks of soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, biscuits, detergent soaps, beverages, seasonings, and frozen foods to resell. She is hoping that, someday, she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, biscuits, detergent soaps, beverages, seasonings, and frozen foods to resell

location.town: Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia comes from the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. She is 23 and single. She is a source of inspiration for many young people in her community. She works as a tailor,  sewing and selling bed spreads, sheets, and curtains. 

Lydia volunteers weekly as a Camfed Learner Guide at her former secondary school and she also volunteers in her community as a health trainer. With the requested loan, Lydia would like to buy an electric sewing machine, cloth, and other materials to use so that she can produce at a commercial rate for her community. With the profits she will get, Lydia intends to expand her sewing business and receive large contracts from purchasers.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine, cloth, and other materials to use so that she can produce at a commercial rate for her community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make bulk purchases of clothing.

loans.name: Odisha

texts.en:
Odisha is a 19-year-old businesswoman who lives in the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a flea market stall, selling clothes, bags, and shoes. She was inspired by her neighbor who educated her children using  profits she earned through her flea market business. Odisha also serves as a weekly volunteer Learner Guide in her community and is known as a role model.

With the requested loan, Odisha intends to make bulk purchases of clothes, bags, and shoes to reduce transportation costs and increase her sales volume. She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Freddie

texts.en:
Freddie previously accessed an 50,000 PHP loan that he used to purchase scrap materials needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan. He will be incorporating the loan into his current revolving fund used to buy scrap and recyclable materials. His profits from business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Freddie hopes to have another warehouse and dreams to give his children a good life and education. Every week, Freddie meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Naboth

texts.en:
Naboth is a married man with three children. He drives a taxi to get money to provide for his family. 

The taxi has a mechanical breakdown at a  time when he does not have sufficient funds to replace the parts. He decide to come to UGAFODE so that he can buy some spare parts to repair his car. He  will use the income from transporting people to pay the loan. He is hard working and thanks the Kiva lenders for the job well done.

Photographed is Naboth, with the UGAFODE staff in a tie, at the car he needs to repair.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair his car

loans.name: Lutfiya

texts.ru: Она Лутфия. Ей 39 лет. Лутфия с семьей проживает на районе Рудаки. Она замужем и в браке имеет детей. Лутфия более трех лет назад, хотела выйти на работу, и начать зарабатывать, чтобы помочь мужу обеспечить семью, детей. Чтобы сохранить домашний уют и очаг Лутфия не хотела оставлять дом и нашла компромисс. Она хорошо умела шить и решила работать портнихой на дому. Лутфия с легкостью начала деятельность и сейчас развивается в этом направление. Лутфия собирала деньги, чтобы сделать ремонт в доме. Уже много лет они не делали ремонт и Лютфия очень хочет отремонтировать дом, но к сожалению им не хватает еще $1000. Она видит один путь получить кредит и сделать ремонт. Кредит она будет выплачивать за счет своей деятельности, и муж будет помогать. Поддержите Лутфию.
texts.en:
This is Lutfiya.  She is 39, married with children, and lives with her family in the Rudaki region of Tajikistan.  Over 3 years ago, Lutfia was conflicted over whether to start working to help her husband provide for the family.  She didn't want to abandon her duties as a homemaker, and eventually settled upon a compromise; she was skilled at sewing, and decided to work out of home as a seamstress.  Lutfia took to her new job with ease, and has continued to grow and expand her business to this day.  All the while, Lutfia has been setting aside money for home repairs.  Their home hasn't been renovated for several years, and she would like nothing more than to move forward with repairs, but her family needs an extra $1000 to get underway.  She views this loan as the only solution to her problem, and will be able to pay it off with her and her husband's combined incomes.  Please help Lutfia if you can.  

   Она Лутфия. Ей 39 лет. Лутфия с семьей проживает на районе Рудаки. Она замужем и в браке имеет детей. Лутфия более трех лет назад, хотела выйти на работу, и начать зарабатывать, чтобы помочь мужу обеспечить семью, детей. Чтобы сохранить домашний уют и очаг Лутфия не хотела оставлять дом и нашла компромисс. Она хорошо умела шить и решила работать портнихой на дому. Лутфия с легкостью начала деятельность и сейчас развивается в этом направление. Лутфия собирала деньги, чтобы сделать ремонт в доме. Уже много лет они не делали ремонт и Лютфия очень хочет отремонтировать дом, но к сожалению им не хватает еще $1000. Она видит один путь получить кредит и сделать ремонт. Кредит она будет выплачивать за счет своей деятельности, и муж будет помогать. Поддержите Лутфию.

loans.use: renovate her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks

loans.name: Olya

texts.en:
Olya is 56 years old and she lives in the village of Ddmashen in Gegharkunik region. 

She has a higher pedagogical education and from 1981 till now she has worked at the village school as a teacher of elementary classes. She is a devoted pedagogue to her work and she is greatly beloved by her pupils. 

Olya is not married and she lives alone and all her free time she spends on the care of her farm and her farm cattle. She has three cows, two calves, nine sheep, and four chickens. She has a small plot of land and a cute orchard, the harvest of which (apple, plum, peach and pear) she sells right from her house. 

As she says despite living alone, she is always busy around her farm with care of cattle, feeding them, land cultivation, watering and gathering the harvest, gathering hay, etc. So as she says she lives happily with her profession of pedagogue and with her farming activities. 

Olya asks for a loan of 400,000 AMD in order to buy fodder for her farm cattle, since the hay for the colder seasons she wants to store, dry, and get ready beforehand.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru:
Эта молодая замужняя женщина по имени Робия живет в предгорном районе Хуросон. Ей 25 лет. Она имеет маленькую дочку в возрасте двух лет. Ее муж работает в Министерстве обороны. Сама Робия домохозяйка. При дворе дома Робия выращивает коров и бычков. Эту деятельность она начала 6 лет назад. Ей помогают свекор и свекровь. Робия берет в откорм молодых бычков и по прошествии месяца продает их по прибыльной цене на местном скотном рынке. 
Сейчас за счет кредита Робия хочет купить несколько молодых бычков и расширить бизнес. Благодаря кредиту она увеличит поголовье скота и доходность бизнеса.
texts.en: This young married lady, Robiya, lives in the mountainous Khuroson region of Tajikistan.  She is 25 and has a young two-year-old daughter of her own.  She is a homemaker, while her husband works in the Ministry of Defense.  Robiya also raises cattle at home in their yard, and has been doing so for 6 years.  Her mother- and father-in-law help her tend to the animals.  She buys young bull calves, fattens them for a month, and sells them for a profit at a local cattle market.  Currently, Robiya is seeking to buy a few young bulls to expand her business.  Thanks to this loan, she'll bolster her herds as well as her income.

loans.use: buy young bulls for fattening and resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nyaradzai

texts.en: Nyaradzai is a 25-year-old mother who resides in the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a peer educator in her community and as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school. Nyaradzai also operates a stall selling fruits and vegetables. More specifically, Nyaradzai sells oranges, bananas, and apples to the local community and students at the nearby school. Nyaradzai intends to use her fresh fruits and vegetables to attract customers to her own flea market stall where they can also purchase clothing. She will use the Kiva loan to open the flea market stall, purchase dresses, skirts, and blouses, and also buy more fresh food to sell.

loans.use: to purchase dresses, skirts, blouses and fresh food to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university installments for this semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a small shop at her home and purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Rico

texts.en: Rico provides the needs of his family from raising pigs to earn a living. Aside from this, he grows fruit trees to earn extra income. He needs to improve his piggery.  Without hesitation, he borrowed a loan from GDMPC microfinance to buy feeding supplies to boost his pigs. His future plan is to improve his pigpen where he can keeps pigs to raise as an expansion of his business.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing products.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena has set up a small space within her house for her sari-sari store business. She makes promising daily sales, which sufficiently help the family. Elena never had doubts about running a business, as she owes her financial needs to PMPC on whom she can depend. She proudly owns a small parcel of coco land for added income. This was made possible because of her savings from her sales.

Now she wants to increase her inventories and restock her store with basic commodities, which is why she applied for a loan from PMPC.

Elena is hoping to sustain her business and wants to pass the business to her children.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Juanita dreams to be more successful in business and hopes that her family is always in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for making accessories and acquire a display cabinet for showcasing her products.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is taking a BS in Business Administration at the College of the Immaculate Conception. She chose this course because she believes that this will be her key to a bright future. Nancy wants to finish her studies to help her family and make her parents proud of her. But her parents can’t sustain her schooling. That’s why she wants a loan of PHP 70,000 from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee

loans.name: Hangoma

texts.en: Hangoma is a young and hardworking woman. She is 20 years old. Hangoma is not married. She lives with her parents. Hangoma sews national women's dresses. She began her sewing business one year ago. She develops her business little by little and perfects her knowledge and abilities. She is going to buy a new sewing machine but she does not have enough money for it yet. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en: Florenda is married with four children and resides in Zamboanga del Sur, along with her family. Her husband works as a farmer, while she is engaged with her retailing business to make a living. She joined Gata Daku MPC recently and borrowed a loan to buy more grocery goods to sell. She wants to improve her business in order to generate additional income to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Maqbool

texts.en:
