Francisca desea construir un cuarto para la cocina ya que como se aprecia en la fotografía está no cuenta con ninguna clase de protección es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo para construir un cuarto para la cocina y lámina para el techo del mismo.
texts.en:
Francisca is 24 years old and lives with her life partner and her 2-year-old. She is an entrepreneurial woman who makes a living selling chickens within her canton.  She saw the need to have more revenue, and so she decided to begin selling tortillas at home. She also sells curtido [a Salvadoran cabbage relish] she makes herself. Her life partner also contributes to household expenses with his work as a farmer and laborer. 

Francisca want to build a room for the kitchen because as shown in the photograph, hers does not offer any protection. She is therefore requesting a credit FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, and brick to build a room for the kitchen and sheet metal for the roof.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, and brick to build a room for the kitchen and sheet metal for the roof.

loans.name: Snooky

texts.en: Snooky resides in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur.  She has sold snacks in their village and in the school canteen for two years to make a living. She joined Gata Daku MPC recently and borrowed a loan to buy raw ingredients to prepare food to sell. She hopes to build a store where she can sell more goods to generate more profit and be able to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchasing more fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Progress

texts.en:
Progress is a 20-year-old woman. She is married and has one child and is currently living in the Mt. Darwin District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at a school in her community. 

Progress also has a thriving poultry business. Over the last year, she has grown her business to its current capacity – producing about 100 broiler chickens every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. 

However, Progress would like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production and continue to be financially independent.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grocery products in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more chicks, feed, and vaccines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to expand her business

loans.name: Sinikiwe

texts.en:
Sinikiwe is a 19-year-old businesswoman from the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a grocery shop for over 15 months. Sinikwe started supplying sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, and soap to her community after she realized there was a ready market for those items. Sinikiwe also volunteers as a Learner Guide each week at a local secondary school.

With the requested loan, Sinikiwe intends to make bulk purchases of sugar, cooking oil, and rice to reduce costs and boost her sales and profits. She hopes to expand into a large retail shop and create even more employment opportunities in her community and to provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Sekai

texts.en: Sekai is a 27-year-old, married woman from the Mt. Darwin District of Zimbabwe. She runs a poultry project where she raises 50 broiler chickens at a time. Sekai started her business in August 2012 as a way to support her family. The business has allowed her to provide for six people in her family, two of whom are young children enrolled in school. Sekai also assists students at the local secondary school as a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide; she teaches life skills lessons. With the Kiva loan, Sekai wants to improve the infrastructure of her business. She will also buy more chicks and feed to expand the business. With the increase in profits, Sekai plans to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to make renovations to the foul run and to purchase more chicks and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.

loans.name: Moleen

texts.en:
Moleen is an 18-year-old businesswoman in the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a flea market stall for the past 18 months using capital from her brother. She sells trousers, shirts, skirts, and dresses. Moleen also serves as a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide in her local secondary school, facilitating life skills lessons.

With the requested loan, Moleen intends to make bulk purchases of trousers, shirts, skirts, and dresses to reduce costs and boost her sales and profits, and to meet the demand of her customers. Moleen is also looking forward to furthering her education with the profits.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Wadzanai

texts.en:
Wadzanai is a 26-year-old single woman living in the Mt. Darwin District of Zimbabwe. She runs a grocery shop where she sells items such as bread, milk, butter, and sugar. Wadzanai opened her business in October 2013 after she realized that she needed a stable source of income to sustain herself and her siblings. She volunteers each week at the local secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide, as well. 

As for her business plans, Wadzanai intends to use the Kiva loan to purchase sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, washing soap, soft drinks, and snacks in bulk to reduce the costs. As a single woman, Wadzanai intends to invest her money in her education and also use it to support her siblings.

loans.use: To increase her stock of sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, washing soap, soft drinks, and snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for fruit for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for catering stock such as cooking oil, meat, mealie meal and restaraunt tables

loans.name: Asker

texts.en:
Asker is a 42-year-old married man with five children. His oldest child is 17 years old, and the youngest one is 5 years old. He has a secondary certificate. Asker lives with his family in his own house in Sana'a, Yemen. He is an employee with a good salary. His house lacks of many of the home appliances and furniture, and most of them are very old. Asker wants to furnish his house with new furniture instead of the old. For this reason, Asker applied for a loan of 100,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB in order to purchase furniture for the house in order to make his house in a good condition.

Asker looks forward to opening a store for selling furniture. He hopes to provide his house with all appliances and furniture.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for the house.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria, age 36, lives in the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. She is married with three children.  She strives to provide for them day and night. Gloria buys and sells different types of goods in her general store, which opened in 2009. She sells cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal (ground maize), sugar, and matemba (dried sardines).  She is volunteering at her local secondary school as a Leaner Guide, facilitating life skills sessions. Gloria intends to use the loan to expand her business by increasing her stock. Her hope is to be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to expand her business by increasing her stock.

loans.name: Shamiso

texts.en:
Shamiso is a 23-year-old single mother of one running a business selling scarves, perfumes, watches and other accessories in the Mt. Darwin District of Zimbabwe. She started her business in 2013 in order to better provide for her child. Shamiso is giving back to her community by volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide, delivering the My Better World well-being program to students at the local secondary school. 

Shamiso will use the Kiva loan to buy more products and widen her selection of merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of personal products

loans.name: Areli Del Carmen

texts.es:
Areli del Carmen es una joven de 35 años, casada, madre de una adolescente en edad escolar, originaria del municipio de El Sauce.
Hace nueve años su esposo le obsequió un pequeño capital para que iniciara su propio negocio el cual es una pulpería ubicada en su vivienda donde ofrece abarrotería en general. Esto fue con el objetivo de que generara sus propios ingresos y fuera una mujer independiente.
Desde entonces poco a poco con el paso de los años ha ido creciendo su negocio donde tiene variedad de productos.
Areli con el fin de surtir aún más su negocio y ofertar a sus clientes productos que ellos demandan, está solicitando un crédito a los inversionistas de Kiva para que a través de Ceprodel se lo financien, ya que en este momento lo necesita por la temporada buena del invierno.
Espera que le aprueben su solicitud con el que piensa comprar abarrotería en general.
texts.en:
Areli del Carmen is a young 35-year-old woman from the El Sauce area who is married with an adolescent child of school age.

Nine years ago her husband gave her a small amount of capital so that she could start her own business, which is a general store in her home where she sells groceries This was so that she could generate her own income and be an independent woman.

Since then she has been growing her business, where she has a variety of products, little by little over the years.

Areli, with the objective of stocking up her business more and offering her customers products that they ask for, is applying through Ceprodel for a loan from Kiva lenders. She needs this at the moment for the good winter season.

She hopes that her application will be accepted. She intends to buy general groceries with the loan.

loans.use: to buy general groceries.

loans.name: Estrella Resplandeciente Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por cuatro socias laboriosas y es coordinado por la señora María Elena de 62 años de edad, casada y madre de tres hijos, se dedica a la comercialización de calzado y ropa de segunda en su domicilio y en los al rededores de su comunidad, este negocio lo impulso hace quince años con la ayuda financiera de su esposo, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de pacas de pantalones, vestidos, shorts y camisetas, así mismo invertirá en sandalias y zapatos para damas y caballeros. Con los créditos anteriores la socia ha logrado pagar los estudios de sus hijos, además la compra de artículos personales. Las otras socias son las señoras Maricela de 63 años de edad quien ofrece el servicio de venta de comida desde hace cinco años principalmente a trabajadores de zona franca, Teresa de 62 anos de edad propietaria de un taller de costura en su domicilio desde hace treinta anos, además comercializa productos AVON a los pobladores de su comunidad, y Martha de 57 años de edad propietaria de un taller de costura desde hace diez anos en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of four working members and is coordinated by María Elena. She is 62 years old, married and has three children. María Elena works selling footwear and second hand clothing in her home and the surrounding community. This business was set up fifteen years ago with the financial help of her husband. She is asking for a loan to buy packs of pants, dresses, shorts and t-shirts as well as sandals and shoes for men and women. With previous loans, she has been able to pay for her children to study as well as to buy personal items.

The other members are; Maricela, 63, who has been serving food for five years, primarily to workers of the free zone, Teresa, 62, who has run a sewing business in her house for thirty years as well as selling AVON products to the people of her community, and Martha, 57, who has also run a sewing business in her house for ten years.

loans.use: to buy quality clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Cesar Alexander

texts.es: Cesar de 38 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida. Él es un hombre tenaz que trabaja en el área de medio ambiente de una institución cercana a su localidad. Cesar desea terminar de construir un cuarto de su vivienda, además debe colocar el techo a dicho cuarto por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento, arena, grava y pagar mano de obra para terminar la construcción del cuarto de su vivienda y comprará lamina, polines y pines para colocar el techo.
texts.en:
Cesar is 38 years old; he lives with his life partner. He is a tenacious man who works in the environmental area of an organization close to his home.

Cesar hopes to finish a room in his house, he must also put a roof on said room which is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, and pay the manual labour to finish the construction of the room and buy laminated metal sheets, purlins, and fasteners to build the roof.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, gravel, and pay the manual labour to finish the construction of a room in his house and buy laminated metal sheets, purlins, and fasteners to build the roof.

loans.name: Maria Melida

texts.es: Melida de 56 años de edad vive con sus 2 nietos de 10 y 13 años de edad los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos, además su hija que tuvo que emigrar al extranjero para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y su madre. Melida desea reparar el cuarto de la cocina ya que como se observa en la fotografía esta bastante deteriorado es por eso que solicita un  crédito a FUSAI para comprar madera, hierro, teja y pagar mano de obra para que le reparen el cuarto de la cocina de su vivienda.
texts.en: Melida, 56 years old, lives with her 2 grandchildren, 10 and 13, both of whom go to school. She is a hardworking woman who makes her living as a domestic servant. Her daughter had to move abroad to provide her children and her mother a better quality of life. Melida wants to repair the kitchen because, as can be seen in this photograph, it is quite dilapidated; so she is applying for a loan from FUSAI to buy wood, iron, and tile, and to pay for labor to repair the kitchen in her home.

loans.use: to buy wood, iron, and tile, and to pay for labor to repair the kitchen in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks and stock feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cigarettes and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Blantina

texts.en:
Blantina is a married 29-year-old mother of three from the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. In order to be economically independent, Blantina started buying and selling clothes over two years ago. She sells jackets, shirts, skirts, shoes, slippers, and dresses. When she is not working in her flea market, Blantina serves as a Camfed volunteer Learner Guide at the local secondary school.

With the Kiva loan, Blantina intends to make bulk purchases of jackets, shirts, skirts, and dresses to reduce costs and boost her sales and profits. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her children.

loans.use: To make bulk purchases of jackets, shirts, skirts, and dresses to reduce costs and boost her sales and profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to change the roof of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feedstock for her chickens.

loans.name: Corazones De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORAZON DE ORO” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por doce  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Martha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, venta de queso, venta de comida, venta de verduras, venta de chuño (papa deshidratada), venta de papa, taller de llantería, costura de chamarras.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Martha es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de leche; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicia hace varios años, aprendiendo la producción de su familia, desde niña, cuando se casa decide implementar un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para alimento en tiempo de sequía (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de su comunidad y posteriormente a la crianza generará su producto y lo venderá a las empresas lecheras. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el seguro de vida que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “CORAZON DE ORO” communal bank is beginning its third loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Copacabana. It is made up of twelve members and is directed by a board of directors where señora Martha is the President. The members of the communal bank have various businesses, including: selling milk, selling cheese, selling food, selling vegetables, selling freeze-dried potatoes, selling potatoes, a tire workshop, and sewing jackets.
 
The loan they are applying for will benefit small micro businesses of which señora Martha is a member. She explains that she became a member of Pro Mujer three years ago, following the invitation of one of the organisation's promoters, who came to visit her at her home. She currently has a business selling milk. She explains that she started this business several years ago, learning the production from her family when she was a young girl. When she married she decided to start an independent business.
 
The loan that she is applying for now is for food in times of drought (buying livestock), which she will obtain from the sellers in her community. After raising the livestock she will produce her product and sell it to milk companies. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is married and has three children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the life insurance offered by the organisation.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a grocery store

loans.name: Nyembesi

texts.en: Nyembesi is an 18-year-old businesswoman from the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. For the past nine months, she has been successfully operating a clothing shop, selling jean skirts, trousers, t-shirts and dresses. Nyembesi is also a volunteer Learner Guide because she is passionate about the development of her community and the economic independence of young women. With the requested Kiva loan, Nyembesi intends to order clothing in bulk to reduce costs, to increase her profits and to create employment for other young rural women.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and biscuits to expand her business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 25-year-old businesswoman who lives in the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. She began her poultry business when she realized that many members of her community could not buy their poultry locally. With her business running successfully, Josephine has a monthly capacity of 20 roadrunner birds in the fowl run that she is sharing with her friend. Josephine also serves as a Cama (Camfed’s Alumni Network) member in her district and as a Learner Guide volunteering each week at a class at a local school in her community. With the requested loan, Josephine intends to grow her poultry project by expanding her fowl run and buying feed so that she can meet her customers demands. Her biggest dream is to be economically independent.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is 50 years old, married and has one child who is in school. Julieta and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. Julieta is taking out a housing loan amounting PHP 7850 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. Julieta has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store business. With your help, Julieta can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and satchels for her business.

loans.name: Rumbidzai

texts.en:
Rumbidzai is a 24-year-old businesswoman. For the past year and a half, she has been successfully running a poultry business in the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. Rumbidzai is also dedicated to volunteering as a Learner Guide in Mudzi, providing weekly life and study skills sessions to students at the local school.

With the Kiva loan, Rumbidzai intends to make bulk purchases of poultry inputs in order to better meet the demand of the community. She is also looking forward to using the profits to send her brothers and sisters to school.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canes, wood and tiles, and to pay the labor costs for the construction of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Milagro De Dios Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Milagro de Dios está conformado por nueve integrantes, personas trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, padres responsables con hijos menores de edad, son originarios de  una comunidad alejada del pueble del Sauce.  Las cuales trabajan en diferentes actividades económica, y es la forma de vida que tienen para poder mantener a su familia. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos.  Porque las personas de las comunidades difícilmente tiene acceso a la educación por la condiciones de vida que prestan los pueblos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante el coordinador es Paulino y tiene por actividad económica la compra y venta de cerdos en pie. Actividad que la realiza en su casa de habitación,  a actividad a la que dedica unas ocho horas diarias, en el cuidado y la venta del mismo.  Ya que la crianza de cerdos  conlleva el cuido la alimentación, limpieza del corral  para que los animales se conserven en un ambiente sano y atractivo para el cliente por la calidad del cerdos.  Esa forma es que ha podido mantener la clientela y crecer en el mercado con clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es comprar un lote de cerdos para la crianza y venta del mismo. EL banco Comunal Milagro de Dios agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: The Milagro de Dios [Miracle of God] communal bank is made up of nine members. They are responsible mothers and fathers with children under their care. They are from Sauce, a place located in a remote part of the country. These people are known for being hardworking and responsible, with a desire for personal improvement. They work in different fields, and that is how they make enough money to support their families. Unfortunately, they couldn’t study due to the poverty that they live with in rural zones, the situation being worse there than in the cities, both in terms of education and living conditions. Thanks to his efforts and his desire to get ahead, the coordinator is Paulino. He buys and rears pigs, which he then resells. He works some eight hours daily, and his business is located at his house. He has to care for the pigs by watching what they eat and cleaning the pen in order to show them off to prospective buyers in a sanitary and clean environment. Thanks to his attention to quality, Paulino was able to retain his customer base and even attract new customers, both regular and occasional. The goal of the loan is to buy more pigs to rear and resell. The Milagro de Dios communal bank expresses their thanks for the help Kiva lenders give to people with scarce resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a respectable job.

loans.use: to increase his working capital by purchasing more pigs to rear.

loans.name: Naser

texts.en: Naser is a 26-year-old, single man from Qabatiya, a village near Jenin City. His family has agricultural land where they cooperate together. It is a good business, but with seasonal income. Naser opened his own business, which is a Quarry. He would like to improve his business and start to export his products. Naser took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his business, and to install an accounting program. By taking this loan, Naser will be able to control and improve his business.  Naser appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his business and to install an accounting program.

loans.name: Sheilla

texts.en: Sheilla is a 20-year-old businesswoman from Zimbabwe’s Mudzi District. Originally, she sold her clothes door to door, but with her determination to succeed, she now rents a stall at the local flea market where she sells dresses, skirts, jackets, and baby clothes. Sheilla volunteers on a weekly basis at the local secondary school working with the students as a Camfed Learner Guide, and in addition, she helps keep the facility clean. She is a source of inspiration to many young people in her community. Sheilla will use the Kiva loan to purchase dresses, shirts, and pants in bulk, to be able to increase her profits and to boost sales.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the materials he needs to repair his roof.

loans.name: Murodgul

texts.ru: Женщина, которая является хранительницей очага своего дома и опорой для своих детей, имеет грандиозную идею, организовать новый бизнес. Муродгул добрая и умная женщина. Муродгул замужем и имеет 5 детей. Ее муж имеет маленькую зарплату и не в состоянии обеспечить своих детей со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Дети год за годом требуют больше благ, так как они развеваются вместе с развевающимся миром. Она решила организовать бизнес шитьем женской одежды, так как она умеет шить женские платья. Она участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки швейной машинке. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: This woman, who is a guardian of the hearth of her home and foundation for her children, has a grand idea to organize a new business. Murodgul is a kind and smart woman. Murodgul is married and has 5 children. Her husband has a small salary and cannot provide their children with all of the necessities. The children need more comforts year after year because they grow in step with the world developing around them. She decided to start a business in sewing women's clothing because she know how to sew women's dresses. She participated in the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women" and obtained a certificate. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 somoni to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy sewing machine in order to start her new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery items to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Yeukai

texts.en:
Yeukai lives in the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. As a Camfed Learner Guide, Yeukai works as a volunteer with a class of students at a local secondary school teaching life skills and study skills. To help support her family, Yeukai rents a table at a flea market and sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts. She has been successfully running her business for half a year now. 

With a Kiva loan, Yeukai will purchase more clothing items in order to grow her business and eventually open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will help her to provide for her younger sisters, who are still in school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement, wood, paint, etc., to repair her house

loans.name: Nada Ramadhan Group

texts.en:
Nada Ramadhan is a group, which consists of five members of women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 135,000 YER from AMB.

Majeda is the leader of the group. She is a 33-year-old, married woman with six children. Her oldest child is 18 years old and the youngest one is 2 years old. She lives with her family in their own house. She studied through elementary education, but she couldn't complete her studies. Majeda's husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. He is employed as an officer in the army. Also, Majeda and her husband have many rented apartments in their house. Majeda wants to help her husband with the expenses of the family, and she wants to improve the living standards of it through saving all kinds of food materials inside the house, in order to face all the needs of the family. As a result, Majeda applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase food materials for her house, to face the needs of the family and to make delicious foods. Majeda looks forward to saving all foods materials for the house.

loans.use: to purchase food materials for her house to face the needs of the family.

loans.name: Carmen Marcela

texts.es: Carmen de 37 años de edad vive en casa de su madre con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros y venta de zapatos, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia pero también vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Carmen está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más mercadería por mayor y así seguir con sus ventas y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en: Carmen is 37 years old. she lives in the house of her mother with her husband and her two children. She works selling clothing for men and women and selling shoes. Her business is located in her place of residence but she also sells in the streets of the various neighborhoods that are close to her house. With what she earns from her sales she manages to pay some of the household expenses. Carmen is requesting a loan to be able to buy more merchandise wholesale so she can continue with her sales and have a better quality of living along with her family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise wholesale.

loans.name: Nuestra Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El banco  comunal Nuestra Esperanza está conformado por diez integrantes,  personas que corresponden a la misma comunidad, trabajadoras, responsables,  con sueños y metas que cumplir tanto personal como laboral.  Los integrantes de nuestra esperanza tienen diferentes actividades económicas el cual es su medio de trabajo para subsistir con sus hijos, apoyarlos y brindarles oportunidades de estudios, a pesar de las adversidades, los sacrificios que tengan que realizar en su día a día.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, la coordinadora es zayda y tiene por actividad económica , una pulpería en su casa de habitación, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas  como : arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, leche, pan, cuajadas, fósforos, hielos, tiste, chicha.a la cual dedica una doce horas diarias, ella se levanta a la 5 am para poder atender la  a sus clientes, ya que una pulpería demanda mucho tiempo porque así es como logra mantener a los clientes y surtir su negocio con la demanda de clientes, y cierra hasta las nueve de la noches, todos los días de la semana, de esa forma es como ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos, y tener un trabajo digno para ganarse el pan de cada día. Ella se ha propuesto muchas metas, como termina su casa, y preparar a sus hijos y en formarlos en profesionales.  El banco comunal  Nuestra Esperanza agradece la ayuda de los inversionistas kiva  la ayuda que brindan a países de escasos recursos económicos como es Nicaragua para tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nuestra Esperanza [Our Hope] is made of ten members of the same community. They are hard-working, responsible people who have dreams and goals to reach in their personal lives  as well as the workplace. 

The Nuestra Esperanza members are engaged in different economic activities that are the means of subsistence for them and their children, to support and offer the children oportunities to study, despite the adversities and sacrifices encountered day by day.

Zayda is the coordinator. Thanks to her efforts and desire to get ahead, she has a small general store in her home, where she sells food products in small quantities, such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, milk, bread, cuajadas [milk curd], matches, ice cubes, tiste and chicha [typical drinks]. 

She works about twelve hours per day. She gets up at 5am to receive her clients. A lot of her time is required by the store, in order to keep her clients and stock the products in demand. She closes 9 pm, seven days a week. In this way, she has been able to raise her children and to earn her daily bread through decent work. She has set many goals for herself, such as to finish her house, and to prepare her children to follow  professional careers. 

The communal bank Nuestra Esperanza is thankful to the Kiva lenders for the assistance offered to bring a better future to countries of scarce economic resources, such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy food products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, milk, bread, cuajadas, matches, ice cubes, tiste and chicha [typical drinks].

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба родилась в 1962 году. Она вдова. Ее муж умер много лет назад. Она сама вырастила своих двоих детей. Она имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Махбуба работает последнее 6 лет в средней школе своего района. Она преподает родной язык и литературу. Махбуба данное время живет с сыном. Ее дочь вышла замуж. У Махбубы последнее время проблема со здоровьем и ей необходимо лечится. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки лекарства для лечения. Она нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mahbuba was born in 1962. She is a widow. Her husband passed away many years ago. She raised her two children by herself. She has a higher pedagogical education. Mahbuba has been working at a secondary school of her district for the last 6 years. She teaches her native language and literature. Mahbuba currently lives with her son. Her daughter got married. Mahbuba has been having health problems lately and needs to seek treatment. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni to buy medicine for treatment. She needs and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy medicine for treatment

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por tres socias laboriosas y coordinado por la señora Martha de 43 años de edad, casada y madre de tres hijos, por quienes ha logrado superarse, se dedica a la venta de repostería y delantales en la capital, se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace seis años, cuando le hizo un préstamo a su mamá para la compra de delantales y luego distribuirlos, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de delantales bordados y sencillos, también donas, pan dulce, pasteles, maletas, empanadas, etc. Las otras integrantes del grupo son las señoras Ana de 48 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de cosa de horno desde hace quince años en la capital y Marbely de 30 años de edad quien ercializa ropa íntima de mujer en la capital y sus al rededores.
texts.en:
This communal bank is composed of three members and coordinated by Martha. She is 43 years old, married and the mother of three children for whom she has managed to excel.She works selling baked goods and aprons in the Capital. She has been doing this for 6 years when she took a loan from her mother to buy aprons which she later distributed. She is requesting the loan to purchase embroidered and plain aprons and also doughnuts, pastries, cakes, maletas, empanadas, etc.

The other members of the group are Ana who is 48 years old who has been selling baked goods in the Capital for fifteen years and Marbely who is 30 years old and sells woman's lingerie in the Capital and the surrounding areas.

loans.use: to buy donuts, pastries, cakes, maletas (local pastry) empanadas, etc and to buy plain and embroidered aprons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice, age 37, distributes and deals in fuel to earn her living. She has been a fuel dealer distributor for seven years, earning an income of KES.20,000 at the end of every month.

She and her husband Donatus have four children. They combine their incomes in order to support the family.

Beatrice was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer, and she is now accessing her first loan. She will use her loan funds in the amount of KES 20,000 to add a stock of fuel, as she is running low on fuel supplies to sell to her customers.

Beatrice plans to use the anticipated increase in her income to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes eventually to become a fuel distribution wholesaler by extending her fuel supply business into nearby towns.

loans.use: to buy fuel to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing and footwear to sell.

loans.name: María Vicenta

texts.es:
María de 49 Años de edad, es una mujer muy dedicada a los oficios y muy luchadora comprometida con su esposo y su familia de firmes principios morales los cuales a inculcado a su familia y han hecho de ellos mejores personas útiles a la sociedad su esposo trabaja la tierra y proporciona los granos para la alimentación de la casa es muy trabajador y luchador siempre ha sido agricultor,  pero sobre todo  muy buen padre que a enseñado a sus hijos esta noble labor de labrar la tierra, María les apoya y los cuida en las temporadas agrícolas llevando el almuerzo a tiempo para los ayudantes.


María desde que se acompaño a realizado las labores de oficios domésticos en su vivienda con ello a mantenido un aseo en toda su casa la cual permanece muy limpia y ordenada gracias a ella,  la cual se preocupa mucho por mejorar y mantenerse en lo aseado. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas y herbicidas para cultivar maíz. 


María comenta que seguirá apoyando a su esposo en las labores agrícolas y los oficios de la casa, pero que desea que su hija que esta en los Estados Unidos venga a verla algún día.
texts.en:
María, 49 years old, is a woman very dedicated to her work, and very determined and committed to her husband and her family, as well as strong moral principles which she has instilled in her family, making them better people and more useful to society. Her husband works the fields, and provides grains which feed the family. He is very hardworking and determined. He has always been in agriculture, but above all he is a very good father who has taught his children the noble work of working the land. Maria supports them and takes care of them in the harvest season providing lunch on time for all the helpers.   

Maria looks after the domestic chores in her home, including all the cleaning, and the whole house is very clean and organized thanks to her. She worries a lot about improving the house and keeping up with the cleaning. 

The loan that she is asking for is to buy compost, fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides to farm maize. 

María comments that she will continue supporting her husband in the agricultural work and the house work, but that she hopes that her daughter who is in the United States will be able to come and see her one day.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides to farm maize.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima, age 34, operates a food market shop to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for three years, and she earns an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

Halima and her husband Stephen have three children. They combine their incomes to support their family.

Halima has joined VisionFund Kenya and is requesting her first loan. She will use her KES 10,000 loan funds to buy vegetables such as cabbages, tomatoes, and onions so that she can replenish her store inventory. She plans to use the anticipated increase in her income to pay her children's school fees.

She hopes to become a successful businesswoman with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as cabbages, tomatoes, and onions to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shoes, trousers, dresses and skirts to sell.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José, tiene 27 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos, reside en el municipio del Negrito, Yoro con su familia. Desde pequeño se ha dedicado a la agricultura ayudando a su padre en cultivos de maíz, frijoles y arroz, lleva varios años realizando sus propios cultivos de arroz, en terreno propio, la producción es de buena calidad y lo vende en el mercado local de la zona. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 30,000 Lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de urea, formula, insumos  y pago de mano de obra para aplicarle a su cultivo de arroz y obtener mejor cosecha. Tiene como plan mantener esta fuente de ingresos para mejorar su casa y darles estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: José is 27-years old, married and has three children.  He lives in Negrito, Yoro with his family.  Since he was young he has dedicated himself to agriculture, helping his parents with their crops of corn, beans and rice.  For a number of years he has been growing his own crops of rice on his own land.  He gets a good quality product and sells it in the nearby market.  José has requested a loan of 30,000 ($1,450), and he will invest it in the purchase of urea, formula and supplies and to pay for labor to apply the inputs to his rice crop.  This will help him to obtain a better harvest.  José plans to keep up this source of income to improve his house and give his children an education.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of urea, formula and supplies and to pay for labor for his rice crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of plastic slippers for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements on her sales location (a stall selling chicken soup).

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es: El señora Demetria, vive en Cochabamba provincia chapare,  tiene 54 años de edad, de estado civil  soltera, económicamente es independiente, se dedica a la actividad de comercio vende productos como el plátano (dulce cajita), naranja, mandarina y otras frutas. Produce en una superficie de tres hectáreas. Para la venta de sus productos cuenta con un puesto en una feria, actualmente requiere un crédito para la compra de frutas para su puesto de venta, ya que su ahorro lo invirtió en la construcción de su vivienda. De esta forma lograra tener mejores ingresos y podrá mejorar su nivel de vida en beneficio de su familia.
texts.en: Demetria lives in Cochabamba, in Chapare province. She is 54 years old and single. She is financially independent and sells plantain (suitable to make sweet cakes), oranges, mandarines, and other fruits. She grows her produce on 3 hectares of land. She has a market stall where she sells the fruit. She asks for a loan to buy more fruit to sell, since she spent all her savings on building her house. She will be able to increase her income and improve her standard of living and that of her family's.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil in bulk (by the gallon) to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Esdrina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación  tiene 11 hijos mayores de edad, la menor de ellos estudia en colegio, 3 de sus hijos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Rosa es una muy buena esposa que realiza los créditos para ayudarle a su marido, él se dedica a la venta de pescado,  todos los días recorre las calles de la ciudad de Manta en un triciclo de su propiedad con la finalidad de vender el pescado y así ganar sus ingresos con los cuales han salido delante de una forma honesta y a punta de esfuerzo. Lleva más de 30 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar pescado. Lleva más de 12  años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así le ayuda a su marido.  Sus sueños son comprar un carro para que su esposo venda el pescado.
texts.en:
The " María Auxiliadora" communal bank meets every fortnight in La Sequita Parish which belongs to Montecristi Canton, a prosperous canton known locally and internationally for it's well-liked Panama hat.

Rosa lives in this place. She is 60 years old, is married and from this relationship has 11 grown-up children. The youngest of them is studying in college and three of her children still live in her house. Her husband is a businessman.

Rosa is a very good wife and she gets the loans to help her husband. He works selling fish. Every day he bikes through the streets of the city of Manta on his tricycle with the purpose of selling fish. In this way he earns the income he has used to get ahead in an honest way through much effort. He has been doing this for more than 30 years.

This loan will be used to buy fish. Rosa has been in the communal bank for more than 12 years and she like it as it helps her husband. Her dream is to buy a car that her husband can use to sell fish.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 37-year-old, married woman who supports a family of two children and her husband adds an additional income to their family. 

For nine years, Janet has been operating a second-hand clothing business, along with a handbag business stall, earning her an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

Janet is now servicing her fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya, in the amount of KES 10,000, and she intends to use the entire amount to buy warm clothes, jackets,  jumpers, pullovers, sweaters, blazers, and trench coats, both for adults and children to wear, which are in demand due to the cold season. In addition, Janet looks forward to purchasing some stocks of leather handbags to sell to her customers.  

Janet plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and she hopes to buy a family plot of land in the near future.

loans.use: to buy warm clothes, jackets, jumpers, pullovers, and trench coats to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Harold

texts.es: Harold de 27 años de edad, habita al sur de la ciudad con su cónyuge y su pequeño hijo menor de 2 años. Sus ingresos provienen de un negocio mediante el cual vende carnes frías, queso y toda mercancía que está a su alcance y que ofrece a su clientela de acuerdo a cada temporada. Su primer negocio fue el comercio de productos cárnicos, el cual inició impulsado por su amiga quien se dedica a esta misma actividad y le habló sobre esa tarea, en un momento en el cual Harold necesitaba generar ingresos pues no contaba con un trabajo fijo. Su venta de chorizos, salchichón, mortadela, queso, butifarras etc. las realiza de manera directa, de contado y a crédito, a clientes propietarios de negocios en el centro de la ciudad. Su meta es ampliar su mercado, ofreciendo muchos mas productos, para generara mayores ingresos y mas adelante poder ahorrar y comprar su propia casa. En la actualidad Harold está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará carnes frías, que tiene encargada por sus clientes, con las cuales incrementarán sus ventas para hacer de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Harold is 27 years old and lives in the south of the city with his wife and their two-year old son. He derives income from his business, which consists in selling cold cuts, cheese, and other items, depending on the season. His first business was in the sale of meat products, which he started on a friend's idea, since this friend was working in this industry. It was at a time when Harold needed an income, since he did not have a stable job. Now, he sells different kinds of sausage, mortadella, cheese, botifarra, etc. He sells his wares both cash and on credit directly to customers who own shops in the centre. Harold's goal is to make his business grow and to offer a greater variety of products, in order to earn more money, save, and buy a house. He asks Fundación Santa María for his first loan, through Kiva, so as to buy cold cuts to fulfill pending customer orders. He plans to increase his sales in order to turn this Kiva loan into a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy cold cuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more peppers to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soap, cream and toothpaste to expand her business.

loans.name: Ruhaama Abafundi Twetungure Group

texts.en:
Ruhaama Bafundi is a new group located in Ruhaama, Ntungamo district. It’s comprised of men and women whose major activities are carpentry or agriculture. They have applied for loan of 4,300,000 UGX, which they will divide amongst themselves. 

They have a challenge of doing agriculture manually because they lack machines to do their work, which results in little output from banana plantations because the plantations are not mulched. Their prime target is to mulch their plantations. 

Enid will specifically use the loan to buy mulch. She hopes the yields will help her children go to better schools and will help meet her family's needs adequately. Enid thanks the Kiva lenders for the financial support to boost her productivity and therefore increase her income.

loans.use: To buy mulch

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough slippers to sell.

loans.name: Aliyor

texts.ru: Алиёр родился в 1986 году. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 не совершеннолетних детей. Он живет вместе семьей в отдаленном регионе. Он работает в средней школе бухгалтером и еще он работает в государственном комитете. Алиёр очень трудолюбивый человек. Так как одной зарплатой не справишься со всеми семейными расходами, он дополнительно дома занимается скотоводством. Он откармливает крупно-рогатого скота и перепродает на местном рынке. Алиёр планирует увеличить оборотный капитал и с такой целью он запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки скота. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Aliyor was born in 1986. He is married and raising 3 underage children. He lives with his family in a remote district. He works as an accountant at a secondary school and also at a municipal office. Aliyor is a very hardworking person. Because it is impossible to handle all of the family expenses with one salary, he is additionally involved in animal husbandry at home. He fattens up cattle and resells it at a local market. Aliyor plans to increase his working capital and is requesting a loan in the amount of 7500 somoni to buy livestock and achieve this goal. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle and increase his working capital

loans.name: Edoh Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi a tout juste 28 ans, est marié et père d’un enfant âgé de 5 ans qui est scolarisé. Sa femme est une commerçante.
Koffi est dans le commerce d’articles de quincaillerie et envisage maintenant de s’étendre encore et de devenir grossiste.
A l’heure actuelle, Koffi s’approvisionne en matériel électrique  à LOME. Il les expose ensuite dans  sa boutique .
C’est le premier prêt que Koffi sollicite .Ce capital sera investi dans l’acquisition d’articles d’électricité et de plomberie. Koffi compte aussi acheter des articles de menuiserie plus pointus que ceux qu’il possède déjà, afin d’élargir et diversifier sa clientèle.
Koffi croit fermement à la prospérité de son commerce et par cette occasion assurer le bien- être de sa  famille.
texts.en: Koffi is 28-years old, married, and father of a 5-year old child who is attending school. His wife is a business owner.  Koffi is in the business of selling hardware supplies and now plans to further expand and become a wholesaler.  At present, he buys his electrical equipment in Lome.  He then resells in his store.  This is the first time Koffi is asking for a loan.  This capital will be used to purchase electrical and plumbing items. In order to grow and diversify his clientele, Koffi also plans to buy woodworking supplies that are more specific than the items he already has.  Koffi firmly believes in the prosperity of his business and its ability to ensure the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy hardware supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies to tend to her coffee plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more blood syrup, malarial drugs and pain tablets to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil in bulk.

loans.name: Jose Jaime

texts.es: Jose de 44 años de edad  se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de medicina natural, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus vetas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, Jose esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de medicina natural por mayor y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jose is 44 years old. He has worked for several years in the sale of natural medicine. He sells as a street vendor in the different villages that are near his home. He uses the money he makes to pay for some expenses at home. He lives in his own house with his wife and two sons. Jose is requesting a loan to buy wholesale natural medicine and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale natural medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a garage in his home.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: Marta de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus hijos, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Marta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de azúcar, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, etc. por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marta, age 58, lives in her own house with her children.  She has had a store at her house for several years.  She has a lot of customers because of the variety of products that she sells and because of the good prices.  With what she gets from her sales she manages to pay for some of the household expenses.

Marta is requesting a loan to buy wholesale sugar, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, and candy, etc.  She will do this in order to continue with her sales.  This way she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale sugar, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, and candy, etc.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Agée de 41 ans, Ablavi  est coiffeuse de profession. Elle a un atelier de coiffure situé à son domicile au quartier Baguida à Lome. Pour optimiser ses revenus, elle associe à cette activité principale, l’achat et la vente de produits de beauté.
Ablavi  est mariée. Son mari est transitaire au Port Autonome de Lome.
Le crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter des rouleaux de mèches et des tissages pour prestation.
Ablavi  compte sur l’accroissement de ses activités grâce à ce nouveau crédit pour mieux contribuer aux charges familiales.
texts.en: Ablavi is 41-years old and a hairdresser. She has a salon in her home in the Baguida neighborhood of Lome.  To maximize her income, in addition to her core business, she buys and sells beauty products. Ablavi is married. Her husband is a freight forwarder at the Autonomous Port of Lome.  The loan she is asking for will enable her to buy rolls of hair extensions and weavings.  Ablavi is counting on the growth of her business via this new loan to better contribute to the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Kodjovi Agbeko

texts.fr:
Agbeko est un jeune entrepreneur très dynamique. En dehors de sa formation professionnelle, il tient une boutique de vente de produits d’alimentation générale.
Dans sa boutique située au quartier Baguida, on trouve divers produits d’alimentation notamment des conserves, des pates alimentaires, des sardines et aussi des détergents. 
Maintenant que ses activités croissent, il sollicite un crédit qui sera consacré entièrement à l’achat de nouveaux articles pour attirer et satisfaire plus de clients.
Agbeko est marié et père de deux enfants âgés de 3 et 7 ans. Sa femme est coiffeuse. Il espère pouvoir épargner régulièrement afin d’assurer une meilleure éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Agbeko is a very dynamic, young entrepreneur.  Apart from his professional training, he runs a general store.   In his store, which is located in the Baguida neighborhood, one finds diverse products such as canned goods, pasta, sardines, and detergents.  Now that his business is growing, he is asking for a loan that will be entirely dedicated to the purchase of new items in order to attract and satisfy more customers.  Agbeko is married and father of two children, ages 3 and 7.  His wife is a hairdresser. He hopes to be able to save regularly in order to ensure the best education for his children.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more of food items for future retail in order to meet all the demands of his family.

loans.name: Izolda

texts.en: Izolda is 66 years old. She lives in Chiatura district with her son. Izolda is provided with a retirement pension. She is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has a vineyard and 0.4 hectare agricultural land, where she grows maize and haricot. Izolda is a very hard working woman and does her best to ensure a good harvest. She sells the harvested products in Chiatura at a good price. Izoda decided to purchase a cow and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 500 GEL to purchase a cow. When the cow is purchased she will start producing dairy products. Izolda will generate more income in the future. Izolda awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Marlene Esperanza

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive la señora Marlene, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación  tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad pero uno de ellos aun vive con ellos. Su esposo se dedica a la albañilería.
Doña Marlene es una mujer muy emprendedora que le gusta ganar algo para ayudarle a su marido a salir adelante, ella tiene y mini farmacia en su casa donde vende toda clase  de medicamentos para mejorar la salud de sus clientes que a diario llegan  hasta su local cuando necesitan de medicinas, ella también se  dedica a la cría de chanchos y pollos los mismos que al venderlos le dejan buenos ingresos 	que le sirven para ir mejorando su negocio cada vez más, lleva casi dos años  con su farmacia y cada día la surte mas para mejorar el servicio para sus clientes. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar medicinas para surtir su farmacia y alimento para pollos y chanchos. Lleva más de 17 años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gustan los beneficios que recibe de la institución. Sus sueños son mejorar su farmacia.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora Communal Bank meets every two weeks in La Sequita Parish in Montecristi, a canton known the famous straw [or "Panama"] hats that are valued both in Ecuador and abroad.

This is where Marlene lives. She's 49 years old and married, and she has four adult children from this relationship, only one of whom still lives in her house. Her husband works in construction.

Marlene is a very enterprising woman who likes to earn something to help her husband get ahead.   She has a mini-pharmacy at her house.  She sells all types of medicine in order to improve the health of her customers who come to her place day to day when they need medicine.  

She also raises pigs and chickens. She gets good profits when she sells them, and this helps her improve her business more and more.  She has had the pharmacy for almost two years.  She stocks it more every day in order to improve her customer service. 

She's going to use this loan to buy medicine to stock her pharmacy and to buy feed for chickens and pigs. She has been in the communal bank for more than 17 years, and she likes the earnings she receives from the institution.

Her dream is to improve her pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy medicine to stock her pharmacy and to buy feed for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Rakhi

texts.en:
Rakhi is 34 years old and from Kenduawatikar village, Dumka, Jharkhand. She is married and has a daughter and two sons, who all are studying in school.

Rakhi has been successfully operating a grocery store for a few years now. She sells rice, pulses, flour, salt, sugar, biscuits, spices, etc. The shop is small, but very convenient for the people in the village. It has been a good financial support for their family. 

Since there is an increase in demands from the customers and she lacks the capital, she is requesting a loan to stock up her shop with a variety of products. She hopes this will increase her sales and help her earn better revenue.

She wants to educate her children and to own a bigger grocery shop.

loans.use: to buy rice, pulses, flour, salt, sugar, biscuits, spices, etc.

loans.name: Laliya

texts.en:
Laliya is 49 years old, married and has two sons and a daughter. Her husband is a daily-wage worker in agriculture fields and earns around INR 1,500 per month. They have some cultivatable land, where they grow paddy, maize and vegetables and sell them in the local market. 

Laliya also rears goats to generate some income for her family. She has good experience in this field, and she also has a few loyal customers. Since goat meat has a good demand, and the pricing is equally good, she wants to expand her business and generate more revenue. She is requesting a loan of INR 5,000 to buy additional goats. 

Laliya is always trying to improve her living conditions and hopes for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn and beans.

loans.name: Freddinah

texts.en:
Freddinah is a 45-year-old woman married to Paul who adds additional income to their family. They are blessed with one child. Freddinah has been operating a clothing business shop for ten years, earning her an income of about KES 20,000 at the end of every month.

She is now servicing her 4th loan of KES 90,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends use the entire amount to buy additional clothing materials with different textures, designs and fashion to add to her current stock, which seems to be running out.

Freddinah plans to use the anticipated income to open a boutique and hopes to buy a family land in the near future.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing materials.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo quien trabaja en una empresa privada y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de tilapias (peces) desde hace varios años, los comercializa los peces en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Ana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de comida de tilapias y poder hacer más grande el lugar donde los mantiene que es el que muestra la fotografía para poder seguir con su trabajo y así darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 53 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband, who works in a private company, and her two children. 

She has been farming tilapia (a fish) for several years. The fish are sold in the different markets near her home. With the money from her sales, and with her husband's help, she manages to cover the household expenses, 

Ana is requesting a loan to buy food for the tilapia and to enlarge the area where she keeps them - which is shown in the picture - in order to continue with her work and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy food for the tilapias (fish) and enlarge their area

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 36-year-old married man with four children. He has been distributing items to retail sellers in his area and makes a monthly profit of 18,000 Kenyan shillings. He just joined Visionfund Kenya and has applied for his first loan, which he will use to buy more bales of sugar, rice and sweets to resell to the retail shops in his area. He anticipates using his profits to save for the education of his children. In the future, he would like to own a wholesale and distribution shop where he can do this on a larger scale.

loans.use: To buy bales of sugar, rice, and sweets to resell.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is 40-year-old married woman. She lives in Gonio, seaside of Georgia, with her family (husband and 3 daughters). She graduated from pedagogical college and works as a teacher at the local public school. Unfortunately, a teacher’s salary is not enough for a family of five. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living.  

Madona decided to renovate the family-owned flat with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Her credit requests were rejected several times, as she doesn’t satisfied their requirements. 

She received the credit within the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, called the Startup Program, that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of USD 3,000 she will renovate the family-owned flat and will rent it out. This will increase her income and she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for steel to make window frames, door frames and trailers

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 43-year-old lady who is married and blessed with two children who are in school. She has been a dairy farmer for the last 14 years, and every month she is able to make a monthly profit of about Kenya shillings 18,000, which is enough to take care of her family's needs.

She just joined Visionfund Kenya and has applied for her first loan, which she plans to use to buy animal feeds and also repair a cow shed. She hopes this investment will increase the milk production which will in turn increase her income. 

She hopes to be the best dairy farmer in the area and also be able to supply more to clients in her area.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds and repair a cow shed.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 48 years old. He is married to Beatrice, and together they have been blessed with two children. One of the children is in primary school, and the other in secondary school.

James is a farmer and also runs a butcher shop. He has been in these businesses for four years, earning a monthly income of about Kshs 14,500.

He is requesting his second loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs 45,000 which he will use to purchase goats for slaughter. He successfully repaid his previous loans.

With the anticipated profits, James will be able to pay school fees for both his children. His dream and hope for the future is to have his children educated to the highest levels.

loans.use: to buy goats for slaughter.

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.ru: Угулой родилась в 1990 году. Она замужем. Ее муж сварщик. Угулой еще не имеет детей. Она умеет шить национальные женские платья. Угилой более 6 лет занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Угилой предоставляет свои услуги дома. Она постепенно развевает бизнес и привлекает все больше клиентов. Она старается шить красиво и аккуратно. Ее швейная машинка сломалась, и она нуждается новой швейной машинке. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Uguloy was born in 1990. She is married, and her husband is a welder. Uguloy does not yet have children. She knows how to sew women's national dresses. Uguloy has been providing seamstress services for over 6 years. She provides her services at home. She has been gradually developing her business and attracting more and more clients. She tries to sew beautifully and precisely. Her sewing machine broke down and she needs a new one. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni to buy a new sewing machine. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Las Mariposas Panyebar Group

texts.en:
In the rural community of San Juan La Laguna on the shores of Lake Atitlan in Guatemala, a group of 14 hardworking women have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Mariposas Panyebar,” meaning “The Butterflies of Panyebar.” The Trust Bank is beginning a new loan cycle through Kiva partner Friendship Bridge. It will be their first cycle with Kiva. The ladies share a common goal of improving their quality of life and are committed to seeing their children enjoy a successful future, which includes education.

Francisca is the 35-year-old secretary of the Trust Bank. She is married to a farmer and has four children who range in age from nine to 15. Francisca has an animal husbandry business and is also a beekeeper. She is requesting a loan that she plans to invest in a bull as well as feed for him and for a dairy cow. She also needs to buy food for the bees. Francisca is very happy and proud to be involved in Friendship Bridge. She feels empowered with her loan because she is certain that she can make a big difference in the lives of her children, especially being able to meet their educational needs. Her oldest son is very interested in beekeeping and honey production.

Each of the women of the “Las Mariposas Panyebar” Trust Bank look forward to their monthly meetings with a Friendship Bridge loan officer. Besides conducting business on their loans, the ladies are eager to learn how to manage them and so they can acquire timely information about effective business practices, health, hygiene and nutrition, as well as women’s rights and leadership. Friendship Bridge calls this combination of loans and education “Microcredit Plus” and it is very effective!

Francisca as the other women in the group thank Friendship Bridge and Kiva lenders for enabling them to receive loans and education. They want to assure all that the investment is in good hands and that they will pay the loan back in full and on time. Kiva lenders are valuable partners in this effort!

loans.use: buy a bull and feed for him, a dairy cow and the bees she is raising.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 47-year-old married lady and blessed with eight children who are all in school. She operates a green grocery business and also does crop farming as a secondary business. She is able to make enough profit that she is able to care for all her family's needs.

She has applied for her third loan after successfully repaying her previous loan. She plans to use the loan to add more stock of vegetables and fruits, like onions, tomatoes, cabbages, kale, carrots and fruits for resale.

She hopes to grow her business so that she can also venture into a transport business as well as be able to own many more assets.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Simbat

texts.ru:
Симбат мирная жительница района Хуросон. Она проживает там с мужем, сыном и невесткой. Симбат 47 лет. У нее среднее специальное образование, она оканчивала медицинский колледж и по профессии работает медсестрой. Параллельно Симбат у себя во дворе дома держит скот. В течение 10 лет она занимается разведением коров и бычков для продажи. Симбат в ведении животноводства усердно помогает семья. 
Сейчас Симбат хотела бы расширить бизнес и улучшить финансовое положение семьи. Поэтому она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы приобрести несколько крупнорогатых скотин. Она надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Simbat is a peaceful resident of the Khuroson district. She lives there with her husband, son and daughter-in-law. Simbat is 47 years old. She has a secondary, specialized education. She graduated from a medical college and works in her field as a nurse. Parallel to this work, Simbat keeps livestock in a yard of her house. She has been involved in breeding cows and bulls for sale for 10 years. Her family diligently helps her with running the animal husbandry business. Currently, Simbat wants to expand her business and improve the family's financial situation. This is why she requested this loan to buy several cows. She hopes for the support.

loans.use: to buy several cows in order to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more red oil and soap to sell.

loans.name: Moline

texts.en:
Moline is 18 years old and resides in Zimbabwe’s Chiredzi District. She has been volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills in local schools.

In addition, Moline runs a small grocery shop in the local town center where she sells products such as sugar, rice, flour, salt, milk, canned food and cooking oil. She has been running this business for three years now and it has enabled her to support her family. 
 
With a Kiva loan, Moline will expand her inventory and buy new stock in bulk to reduce her costs. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  buy enough flour, butter, yeast, etc. for baking bread to sell.

loans.name: Manzaneras Group

texts.en:
Chichicastenango is a rural place, full of color and tradition in western Guatemala. This place has a considerable number of inhabitants in rural areas. In one of these areas, the Trust Bank "Manzaneras" was established. Manzaneras means "women of the apple area." The group is composed by 9 beautiful women wearing their traditional outfits.

One of the members of the Manzaneras Trust Bank is Mrs. Juana. At 36 years old, she has zero years of formal education due to the financial situation of her family, and because education for girls was not important during her childhood. Juana is the mother of a baby girl who is a year old. Juana and her husband are working hard to offer a good future for their daughter. 

Juana's business is the design, development, manufacturing and sale of textiles, especially the majestic traditional huipil, as well as shawls of different colors. Due to demand, Juana has seen the need to hire seven more people in order to take all orders. She provides necessary materials, and these people work from home. Juana is requesting a new loan through Friendship Bridge which she will use to buy threads of different colors, and of the highest quality so that her business continues to grow. It currently delivers orders once a month, and she sells by the dozen as well as individual units.

Juana has spent several years in this business, but until she joined the Friendship Bridge, the business was unable grow because she could not always maintain inventory of materials. Juana also enjoys the trainings delivered once a month by a Friendship Bridge loan officer as part of its program of Micro Credit Plus, which includes loans and non-formal education. During trainings, women learn about empowerment and decision making. For that reason, Juana enjoys leadership development and is currently the president of the group.

All women of the Trust Bank Manzaneras appreciate the confidence of the Kiva lenders granting them loans to invest in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy high-quality thread in different colors.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 20-year-old who is married to Patrick and they currently do not have children. She operates a clothes selling business which has been running for the last one year with a monthly income of KES 25,000.

She has applied for her first loan after joining Visionfund Kenya and she plans to use the amount to add more stock of clothes like shirts, blouses, skirts, belts, trousers, and shoes to bridge the gap after Ramadam is done. She hope to get good returns after this investment and she will save this for her family's future use.

In future she would like to be successful and have a happy family.

loans.use: to add more stock of clothes to resale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 52 years old. He is married to Nancy and together they have been blessed with three children. Nancy helps provide additional income for the family.

Peter is an agricultural farmer, a business he has done for the last 13 years, making a monthly income of about Kshs 10,000. He has requested his third loan of Kshs 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase fertilizers and seeds for planting. He successfully repaid his previous loans.

With the anticipated profits, Peter will be able to educate his children. His hopes and dreams for the future are to provide for his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged 32 and married with five children, aged between 11 and 5 years; four of them attend school. 

He owns a produce store mainly dealing in maize and makes extra income through farming and a retail shop. He saved money from a motorcycle (boda boda) transport business and started a produce store. He desires to buy a car to aid delivery of maize to his customers. John, a honest and hardworking man, will use the loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more tans of red oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment for a tailoring business.
